story:
Our Story

Imagine the epic, rich sound of 12 French horns showcasing everything from movie soundtrack scores, contemporary jazz, and pop tunes to classic horn concerti (but arranged entirely for horn ensemble)! That’s our vision, and now we're hoping to make it a reality.

Coup de Brass is Yale’s oldest (and only) all-French horn choir, drawing the best players from many of Yale’s musical ensembles. Our mission is to create a fun, high-quality experience for both our members and our audiences by showcasing our unique sound over a wide variety of genres.

We've toured various locations, most recently sunny South Florida, to play at a wide range of engagements, including music festivals, schools, retirement communities, country clubs, charity functions, and sporting events. Our last tour included a performance of the National Anthem at a Miami Heat game for over 19,000 spectators! This year, we’ll be trying to expand our experiences, most notably by recording our first album. 

To do this, we need your help. Any donation, no matter how small, can help us solidify our group's fundamental goals, taking our dream to the next level.

How Your Donation Helps

In creating an album, we are trying to create another world for our listeners, and even the smallest donation can get us closer to that goal! Your donations go towards...

·  Recording: We have an incredibly talented crew of hornists and breathtaking arrangements – all we need now is: 1) a professional sound engineer and studio space to record our tracks, 2) funding to transform our hard work into CDs through the discography process (i.e. mastering, jewel cases, informational inserts, physical CD pressing and printing, etc.).

·  Other merchandise: Beyond our CDs, we’re looking to make t-shirts and decals and hopefully take another step toward becoming a self-sustaining, entirely student-run organization for future albums and tours! 

·  Publicity: We firmly believe that our work is both important and compelling, so we'd like as many people as possible to see and hear us. In order to do that, we need posters and other physical forms of advertisement to put out into the world.

What other ways can I help?

Besides contributing, you can: 
  • Get the word out about our group and our campaign!
  • Either share our campaign using the Indiegogo share tools, or tell people to like us on Facebook to hear more about our campaign at http://www.facebook.com/coupdebrass

Thank you so much for your support!!

story:
We are recording our Epic Debut Album at Dave Grohl's Studio 606 and we need your help to finish it!!!


  ~ Galactic power trio fronted by violinist, vocalist and composer Emily Palen wrestles their music up from the heart, blood, guts and glory of real human life;  propping it onto the infinite horizon of our great many galaxies.  
Emily Palen : Violin - Vocals - Composer
Uriah Duffy : Bass
Rob Ahlers : Drums

Make a kick ass record ~ Tour the World ~ Live Free!   Blast Earth with Love through the Epic Power of Music!

We're halfway through recording and need your help to fund the final two week session of the record in June.  We are recording at Studio 606 with the best people and best gear in the industry.  This album is going to take the world by storm and we need your help to make it real.   

Hi!  Thank you for checking out my fundraiser and supporting KnightressM1.  This band is a culmination of my every breath and heartbeat since I was a child.  I fell in love with the violin early and it continues to be my reason and my way.    From a young classical training to my heavy rocker heart, this music is my everlasting fire.   This album is the story of my own Super.Hero.  

KnightressM1 ~ Music for Super.Heroes. 

You and me ~ hanging on the edge of a planet brinking on rebirth ~ with       

            wings and a match we set it all ablaze and sing ~ to be free ~ to be free.  

    

THE BACK.STORY. ~

 I played with The Foo's at Red Rocks:

After meeting them here:

By winning a contest with this video:

Then Dave invited me to record this album at his studio using the Neve Board featured in his "Sound City" Documentary and his amazing team of engineers and studio assistants.  Check out the trailer for the documentary!

   15 Songs ~ 15 Dimensions ~ 15 Videos

                            One Complete Story of KnightressM1

We have recorded half of the album and I will be returning to Studio 606 to finish the album in June.  The rhythm tracks were laid down in a record 2 days to tape by drummer Rob Ahlers and bassist Uriah Duffy.  I recorded violin to half of the songs and will finish the rest of the album and mix it during our two week session in June.  

The album is a sonic journey of awakening to a personal and collective freedom and power ~  grounded in the raw truth of the human experience and lifted by a connection to ethereal worlds.  

                                        

                                        

Engineering the record is super-pro Jon Lousteau, chief engineer at 606.

We all work hard for the money and I appreciate your help more than you know.  I humbly ask you to help me reach the finish line and I promise to you I will do everything I can to make this album absolutely kick ass and be worth every penny donated.   

WHERE YOUR MONEY GOES ~

$14,000 for 14 studio days at $1,000 per day from June 7-20

I will personally be covering all travel, lodging, and pyrotechnical expenses.

Dreams As Reality ~

We all have dreams inside of us that refuse to die, that are determined to come true.  I'm asking you to support us now in the last leg of the journey.  

I'm so excited to be making this album.  I believe in it with all my heart and soul.  I know you'll believe in it too!  Thank you for all of your help!  

My Gratitude to You ~

You have received this invitation to be part of this because I know you, value you and genuinely love you as a unique powerful person on the planet.  I want to personally thank you for being supportive of me and my music and for bringing magic and moments of truth into my life.  As you all know deeply within your own hearts, this life is a full spectrum of emotion and experience and the most important part of it all is who you meet on the way and the friendships that are born.  Thank you so much for being a beautiful part of my life.   ~emily


Check out the Music!  Live Footage filmed by Joe Mason

   With Rob Ahlers on Drums ~ Bryan Dean on Bass


With Paula Sutor on Keys ~ Michael Shiono on Bass ~ Robert John Tucker on Drums ~ Mohini Rustagi on Doumbek ~ Sunni McGarity on Vocals ~ Jill Parker Bellydancer

     Other Ways You Can Help

If money isn't flush for you right now and you still want to help, here is what you can do.  Do the social media thing and share this campaign with your friends and family!  Talk about this campaign to people, spread the word, share the excitement and help create a buzz.   We are also pulling together our team so if you are skilled in any relatable area be it video production, art, promotion or strategy, please consider joining us!  As always, thank you for everything!!


WEBSITES!!
www.KnightressM1.com
www.emilypalen.com
ROB AHLERS! ~ of 50 Foot Wave
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/50_Foot_Wave

URIAH DUFFY!  of Points North, Whitesnake, Sly and the Family Stone 
www.uriahduffy.com

STUDIO 606!
http://www.fooarchive.com/606/
Studio Photo Credits: David Papas
http://www.papas.com
Live Photo Credits: Tim Guydish
Campaign Co-Produced by Craig Cannon
Video Production by Wayne Narruhn and Mission Pictures SF

story:
Short Summary

 Who We Are?
We're a Heavy Metal Band based out of Upper Marlboro, Maryland. We've been at this for approximately five years. We started LouderThanQuiet in the summer of 2010 when we branched off from another group. Over the years we've taken pride in learning how the music industry works, what drives it and how we can set ourselves up to be the most successful. One thing about this group that we've noticed is our ability to get through adversity. It seems as though everyone and everything is out to stop us, yet, we continue to push on and reach for higher goals.We're an independent band, no labels, no contracts. We take pride on being able to blaze our own path and do things how we want. We've never been ones to conform to what people want. We do our thing and hope folks can get down with what we do.

What We Need & What You Get

So you may wonder, how did we come up with our number for our goal? Our planned uses for the fund are divided into three categories: Music, Transpo, and, Merch. First and foremost we would like to be able to go in studio and record our full-length album with Producer Jamie King. So that would provide the tunage. But what is tunage if you can't get around to share with folks in front of their face? We've never toured, we've never been outside of our general area to share our Music? Why? Having reliable transportation, so we can accept those show offers in New York and North Carolina. We want to get to you!! Help us, Help you, Help Everyone. Finally, Merchandise! We have an extremely talented artist in our corner who is constantly scheming up designs and once we get those means to print up this Merch we're going to spread it like wildfire. Check out the perks, I think we have a little something for everybody!

Risks & Challenges

So what's standing in our way? Simple, the industry. Trying to break into the industry is beyond difficult. Talking to the folks we know who are in and successful, we realize just how much dedication is required to set yourself up to be successful. You can do everything right, but you still need a little bit of luck. And watching others try to achieve the same thing we are, we see the difficulty, we feel the difficulties. However, we have our team, we've constructed our plan. Now, its time to make it happen. Hopefully with your help we'll get the jumpstart we need to shock the world. Come be a part of the team!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can not donate, that's still fine. There are plenty of ways we could use your help. Directing a friend, family member, coworker, girlfriend, boyfriend, dog, cat, alien life-form or anybody or thing to our social media accounts is just as helpful. Granted Facebook likes and Instagram followers do not pay the bills. But the ability to share with fans and interact is something that we hold to an even greater regard than money.

TL;DR - We are a band aspiring to make great music and share it with everyone. We just need a little help!! 

Feel free to contact us on any of our Social Media sites or email us at louderthanquiet@gmail.com

Stay Metal \m/

Check Out The Video!!! 

------> http://youtu.be/Pbnc6dvlzWA <------

story:
Moonlight Co. Media Campaign

Just a two-piece folk band from North Carolina, we recorded an EP in our bedroom using only two microphones and our rag-tag talents. That same EP has earned us the chance to work with Tinderbox Music (they work with the likes of Ingrid Michaelson and Imagine Dragons)! Alas, radio campaigns are expensive. So, we're asking for your help! Together we can launch a national campaign and make the dreams of two starry-eyed beach bums come true :-)


What We Need & What You Get

We need $2,100 to reach 300 college radio stations and have monitoring for 8 weeks. This price obviously pays for the company's services but also all the postage included (300 stamps, envelopes, one-sheets, etc..). The monitoring for each station helps us know where to tour and where our music is well received. It can also lead to working further with the company by licensing our music for TV!

If we raise the money within 30 days, our EP will be available on BandCamp for one week at a “pick-your-price” option as a timely “Thank You!”

The Impact

We've seen people dance, cry, and find joy in our music. We believe in what we do. Lives can be changed with beauty and sincerity. The more people we can reach, the further that goodness gets passed along. We're certainly not asking for a handout, just exactly what we need to make the biggest impact possible.

Risks & Challenges

Big risks make for big rewards! If we're unable to pay for our campaign it will result in years of effort to find ourselves in the same position and by that time it may just not be feasible to continue our rigorous performing schedule.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

Share the word and help us make some noise. I have 700 friends on Facebook. If everyone donated $3 we would be at our goal, everyone would get an EP, and we would be in your city before you know it!


As always, Thank You Very Kindly!

-Moonlight Co.

story:
Qui suis-je?
(English below)

Moi, c'est Licia Chery!

Je suis une artiste indépendante, et j'ai de grands projets :)
Ayant déjà récolté plus de 75'000€ pour la production de l'album, j'ai besoin de vous pour financer la promotion. Vous êtes partants?

Ma musique est un mix de soul, de pop et de rock. J'aime parler de la vie, de l'amour, de l'importance d'être heureux. Découvrez ma musique au fil de la page par des vidéos et des liens soundcloud.
Ecoutez ici:


Combien?

Promotion Suisse/France par attachés de presse 
- presse écrite, presse web, envoi single aux radios, aux télés...:  9'800€
Fabrication d'albums: 5000€
5 clips vidéos
- le plus important pour un artiste de nos jours c'est le visuel, le fait d'avoir plusieurs clips vidéos en stock est essentiel: env.25'000€
Fonds pour transports
- un aller/retour pour mes musiciens=1100€. Avoir un fonds pour toutes les fois où les transports ne sont pas pris en compte est nécessaire (~13 aller/retour): 15'000€
Marketing France/Suisse: 7000€
Frais impayés:
- Il reste encore quelques frais impayés, à savoir ceux de la fabrication d'un partie des albums: 4785.-
Il reste 3415.- pour les imprévus!

Je suis une battante, j'y crois et tous ceux qui me soutiennent me donnent la force d'avancer. 

L'album est enregistré, mixé, masterisé, en fabrication et tout est prêt! 
Ce qu'il manque? Des fonds pour le promouvoir!



Ce dont j'ai besoin et ce que vous obtenez!


  • Dans une situation idéale, un label, une major ou un producteur met de l'argent sur la table pour couvrir les différents frais. Ce n'est pas mon cas. Après m'être débrouillée pour faire en sorte que l'album soit là, je recherche des fonds pour la suite... 


  • Jusqu'à aujourd'hui, voici ce que j'ai réussi à financer:
     
    - Enregistrement: studio, salaires musiciens, choristes, arrangeur, ingénieur du son, repas, transports etc...) 
    - Mixage, le mastering, les retouches mastering éventuelles...  
    - Séance photo où il faut payer le photographe, le/la maquilleur/euse.
    - Graphisme, car il faut bien la créer cette pochette d'album, le livret etc...          
    - Fabrication des albums, les différents clips (réalisateur, repas, figurants...)
    - La scène, il faut créer le spectacle, payer les musiciens , le lieu pour répéter etc...
    - Parfois, lors de concerts, les transports ne sont pas pris en compte, donc c'est à moi de payer. Il y a aussi les tenues de scène, les voyages d'affaires et j'en passe...


  • Aujourd'hui, je n'ai ni label, ni fonds, et le travail n'est pas fini: il faut payer la promotion, la fabrication de nouveaux albums, des attachés de presse, faire des clips, avoir un fonds pour les trajets lorsqu'ils ne sont pas pris en charge... Bref, il faut de l'argent!

  • L'industrie du disque est en mutation et il devient de plus en plus difficile pour les artistes d'intéresser les labels. Soyez plus intelligent que les maisons de disques! Rêvez avec moi! Vous obtiendrez des albums dédicacés, des billets pour les concerts, une écoute de l'album en avant première, un accès aux coulisses du succès :)

  • Si l'objectif n'est pas atteint, j'utiliserai quand-même l'argent récolté pour la promotion. Mais l'objectif sera atteint sinon, je risque de m'énerver comme dans la vidéo ci-dessous :P

L'impact

Je vous ai parlé de ce que je n'ai pas, mais voilà ce que j'ai:

  • Un album sensationnel qui sort le 13 mars 2015!
  • Un spectacle que j'ai préparé spécialement pour vous!
  • De la foi de l'énergie et de la motivation!
  • Des tourneurs qui croient en moi!
  • Beaucoup d'émotion à partager!
Les labels/majors n'ont peut-être pas encore vu mon potentiel, mais si vous vous y croyez, je peux décrocher la lune!
On tente le coup?

Risques et défis
  • Cet album représente plus d'un an de travail acharné. Avec assez de fonds, j'aurai de quoi motiver tous mes collaborateurs de donner le meilleur d'eux-même pour que cela fonctionne.

  • Il y a toujours un risque que cela ne fonctionne pas malgré tous les efforts, mais il y a plus de chances pour que ça marche lorsque l'argent n'est pas un problème.

D'autres façons d'aider

Impossible pour vous de mettre de l'argent? Pas de problème!

  • Vous pouvez aider en faisant passer le message!
  • Vous pouvez aider en mettant vos talents à disposition (vous faîtes des clips? vous prenez des photos?...)


Who am I?

 I am Licia Chery!

I am an indie artist and I have big plans :)
I have already raised more than 75'000€ on my own to produce the album. Now I need you to help me finance the promotion. Are you in?

My music is a mix of soul, pop and rock. I like to talk about life, love and how important it is to be happy. Discover my music on this page with videos and soundcloud links. 
Listen:


Promotion Switzerland/France by press agents
- written press, web press, sending single to the radios, tv...:  9'800€
CD production: 5000€
5 music videos
- the most important for an artist nowadays, is the visual. Having a few music videos is essential: 25'000€
Transportation costs
- a round trip for my musicians costs 1100€. Being able to pay for transportation anytime we need is necessary: 15'000€
Marketing France/Switzerland: 7000€
Unpaid bills:
- Some bills are still unpaid like the first CD fabrication: 4785.-
That leaves 3415.- for mishaps!

I'm a fighter, I have faith and all those who believe in me give me the strength to go on.

The album is done. Recorded, mixed, mastered, cd's have been made; everything is ready! What's missing? Money to promote it!


What do I need and what do you get!

  • In a perfect world, a record label would put money on the table and pay for everything. I'm not in that perfect situation yet, but I know you'll get me there!

    Now that the album exists, I'm looking for money to promote it...
  • As of today, this is what I have managed to finance:
    - The recording: studio, musicians, backup singers, producer, sound engineer, food, transport costs...)
    - Mix, mastering...  
    - Photo shoots, makeup artists...
    - Graphic design (because you need to create the cd liner, the album cover, etc... )
    - CD production, music videos (director, food, actors...)
    - Stage, create the show, pay the musicians, the place to rehearse...
    - Sometimes, on some shows the transport costs is not taken care of so I have to pay for it... and the business traveling and so on...
  • Today I have no record deal and no money and the promotion has to start. I need to pay promotion, music videos, have some money for the transports costs, the  press agents... I need money!

  • The music industry is changing and it is harder for artists to find record deals. Be smarter than those majors! Dream with me!
    You'll get signed albums, tickets, you'll be able to listen to the album before the general public, you'll have backstage access to success :)
  • No matter how much money I get, it will be for promotion. But I'll get the money . If not, I'll behave like in this video :P

The impact

I told you about what I don't have, but here is what I've got:

  • A beautiful album out on March 13  2015!
  • Aa amazing show I created specially for you!
  • Faith, energy and motivation!
  • Tour managers who believe in me!
  • A lot of emotions to share!

Record labels and majors might not have seen the potential I have, but if you do believe in me I can do the impossible!

Shall we try?

Risks and challenges

  • This album has been more than a year of crazy work and expenses. With enough money, I'll be able to motivate press agents and other relevant people to help me do a great job. I'll be able to motivate everybody to work real hard to make this happen.

  • There is always a risk that it might not work, but it's easier to make it work when money is not an issue.

Other ways to help

Not able to contribute financially? No problem!

  • Spread the word!
  • Share your talents with me:) Do you know how to make videos? how to take pictures, etc...?
story_txt:
Qui suis-je?(English below)




Moi, c'est Licia Chery!
Je suis une artiste indépendante, et j'ai de grands projets :)Ayant déjà récolté plus de 75'000€ pour la production de l'album, j'ai besoin de vous pour financer la promotion. Vous êtes partants?
Ma musique est un mix de soul, de pop et de rock. J'aime parler de la vie, de l'amour, de l'importance d'être heureux. Découvrez ma musique au fil de la page par des vidéos et des liens soundcloud.Ecoutez ici:
Combien?
Promotion Suisse/France par attachés de presse - presse écrite, presse web, envoi single aux radios, aux télés...:  9'800€Fabrication d'albums: 5000€5 clips vidéos- le plus important pour un artiste de nos jours c'est le visuel, le fait d'avoir plusieurs clips vidéos en stock est essentiel: env.25'000€Fonds pour transports- un aller/retour pour mes musiciens=1100€. Avoir un fonds pour toutes les fois où les transports ne sont pas pris en compte est nécessaire (~13 aller/retour): 15'000€Marketing France/Suisse: 7000€Frais impayés:- Il reste encore quelques frais impayés, à savoir ceux de la fabrication d'un partie des albums: 4785.-Il reste 3415.- pour les imprévus!
Je suis une battante, j'y crois et tous ceux qui me soutiennent me donnent la force d'avancer. 
L'album est enregistré, mixé, masterisé, en fabrication et tout est prêt! Ce qu'il manque? Des fonds pour le promouvoir!



Ce dont j'ai besoin et ce que vous obtenez!


Dans une situation idéale, un label, une major ou un producteur met de l'argent sur la table pour couvrir les différents frais. Ce n'est pas mon cas. Après m'être débrouillée pour faire en sorte que l'album soit là, je recherche des fonds pour la suite... 

Jusqu'à aujourd'hui, voici ce que j'ai réussi à financer: - Enregistrement: studio, salaires musiciens, choristes, arrangeur, ingénieur du son, repas, transports etc...) - Mixage, le mastering, les retouches mastering éventuelles...  - Séance photo où il faut payer le photographe, le/la maquilleur/euse.- Graphisme, car il faut bien la créer cette pochette d'album, le livret etc...          - Fabrication des albums, les différents clips (réalisateur, repas, figurants...)- La scène, il faut créer le spectacle, payer les musiciens , le lieu pour répéter etc...- Parfois, lors de concerts, les transports ne sont pas pris en compte, donc c'est à moi de payer. Il y a aussi les tenues de scène, les voyages d'affaires et j'en passe...




Aujourd'hui, je n'ai ni label, ni fonds, et le travail n'est pas fini: il faut payer la promotion, la fabrication de nouveaux albums, des attachés de presse, faire des clips, avoir un fonds pour les trajets lorsqu'ils ne sont pas pris en charge... Bref, il faut de l'argent!
L'industrie du disque est en mutation et il devient de plus en plus difficile pour les artistes d'intéresser les labels. Soyez plus intelligent que les maisons de disques! Rêvez avec moi! Vous obtiendrez des albums dédicacés, des billets pour les concerts, une écoute de l'album en avant première, un accès aux coulisses du succès :)

Si l'objectif n'est pas atteint, j'utiliserai quand-même l'argent récolté pour la promotion. Mais l'objectif sera atteint sinon, je risque de m'énerver comme dans la vidéo ci-dessous :P



L'impact
Je vous ai parlé de ce que je n'ai pas, mais voilà ce que j'ai:

Un album sensationnel qui sort le 13 mars 2015!
Un spectacle que j'ai préparé spécialement pour vous!
De la foi de l'énergie et de la motivation!
Des tourneurs qui croient en moi!
Beaucoup d'émotion à partager!

Les labels/majors n'ont peut-être pas encore vu mon potentiel, mais si vous vous y croyez, je peux décrocher la lune!On tente le coup?


Risques et défis



Cet album représente plus d'un an de travail acharné. Avec assez de fonds, j'aurai de quoi motiver tous mes collaborateurs de donner le meilleur d'eux-même pour que cela fonctionne.

Il y a toujours un risque que cela ne fonctionne pas malgré tous les efforts, mais il y a plus de chances pour que ça marche lorsque l'argent n'est pas un problème.



D'autres façons d'aider
Impossible pour vous de mettre de l'argent? Pas de problème!

Vous pouvez aider en faisant passer le message!

Vous pouvez aider en mettant vos talents à disposition (vous faîtes des clips? vous prenez des photos?...)

Having a few music videos is essential: 25'000€Transportation costs- a round trip for my musicians costs 1100€. Today I have no record deal and no money and the promotion has to start. I need to pay promotion, music videos, have some money for the transports costs, the  press agents... I need money!

The music industry is changing and it is harder for artists to find record deals. Be smarter than those majors! Dream with me!You'll get signed albums, tickets, you'll be able to listen to the album before the general public, you'll have backstage access to success :)

No matter how much money I get, it will be for promotion. But I'll get the money . If not, I'll behave like in this video :P



The impact
I told you about what I don't have, but here is what I've got:

A beautiful album out on March 13  2015!
Aa amazing show I created specially for you!
Faith, energy and motivation!
Tour managers who believe in me!
A lot of emotions to share!

Record labels and majors might not have seen the potential I have, but if you do believe in me I can do the impossible!
Shall we try?



Risks and challenges


This album has been more than a year of crazy work and expenses. With enough money, I'll be able to motivate press agents and other relevant people to help me do a great job. I'll be able to motivate everybody to work real hard to make this happen.

There is always a risk that it might not work, but it's easier to make it work when money is not an issue.



Other ways to help
Not able to contribute financially? No problem!

Spread the word!
Share your talents with me:) Do you know how to make videos? how to take pictures, etc...?

story:
What Is All Of This?

It has been nearly three years since I put out new music. Lately people have been asking me over and over, "when are you going to put out a CD!?" Well that time is now, but I am going to need YOUR help. I have been writing new music that I have been wanting to release, badly. Just writing in this town, on a regular basis, has allowed me to hone my craft and become a much better songwriter than I ever thought I could be. Right now, I currently have a producer I am working with who is outstanding at what he does. We have been in the studio these past 3 weeks working on the lead single from the EP, Tipsy. So far, everything has come out fantastic and I couldn't be happier with the result! My goal is to release Tipsy to radio and try to fund new music and merchandise that way, but I'd like to get a head start on that, which brings me here to Indiegogo. Otherwise, the EP might take 6-8 months before it ever sees the light of day. I want there to be music available to everyone if Tipsy does end up doing well. So, if you do decide to contribute to the campaign, there will be plenty of incentives for you. The more you contribute, the better they get. I am incredibly excited about this new EP and I hope you are too. Thanks for checking it out, and if you feel so inclined, then please feel free to share with your friends and family. Every little bit counts! 

What We Need & Why

You may be asking yourself, why $3,500? That number is what I have come up with that will enable me to pay for the EP's production, as well as fulfill all rewards and printing hard copies of the EP. Your money is not cheap. But thanks to my Enginner/Producer, we have found an affordable way to get this whole thing done that works for both of our budgets. 

Your money will go to:

Paying the Musicians, Mixing/Mastering, CD Duplication. Merchandise, Marketing/Promotion and Distribution.

If all goes well and we exceed the goal, any remaining money will go into making the EP even better, possibly longer with even more songs. That extra money will go towards more marketing, as well as a longer and bigger radio campaign. 

The Impact

Your impact is huge. If I can't raise the money, I can't put out an EP. All of this relies on your generosity and I will be forever grateful for that. And you'll also get your cool stuff too!

Risks & Challenges

As far as Risks and Challenges go, there aren't very many. Mainly, If I am short of my goal the EP may be shorter than anticipated (less songs). But I am determined to succeed and plan to do everything in my power to get to the goal. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Share, share, share! Tell your friends and family about the campaign. You never know who may want to help, and every little bit counts!

story:
D.C. LaRue....live?

Greetings Disco Fans!!!

Well, for all those hundreds of friends and disco fans around the world that have been asking me through the last couple of years will I ever start performing again...this should come as good news.  Seems that over the last few months there have been serious inquiries from promoters in the UK and Europe as to my availability to do same this coming Spring/Summer 2015.  

Nice!!  And after giving it considerable thought I've decided to give it a shot...at least before I have to make my entrance on stage using walker!!  (Only half kidding!!) 

But before I can give them a serious response I'll have to put a few of the pieces together which is why I'm reaching out for a little financial help at this juncture.  The first step in the process will be to get the  performance tracks in place.  The existing three tracks in my possession ("Cathedrals", "Let Them Dance" and "Do You Want The real Thing?") date back to 1979 and where converted from digital to analog about fifteen years ago.  Tracks like "Hot Jungle Drums", "Indiscreet, "Face Of Love", "Don't Keep It In The Shadows" and whatever haven't been out of their boxes in 35 years!!

In order for me to use them in performance singing "Live to Tracks" they all have to be converted from two track stereo analog to digital...which includes "baking" them so as they don't turn into dust when played after all these years.  Then into a real recording studio with those huge AMPEX reel to reel playback machines, removing my original lead vocals, editing and digitally enhancing the recordings to bring everything up to what is considered 2015 state of the art.

That having been said it appears that I'll need a little help from my friends.  I sincerely wish I were in a financial position where I could cover the cost entirely myself but I regret that isn't the case.

Thus I turn to "disco aficionado" funding through Indiegogo.  

I won't be able to tell these promoters "yes" until this first step has been completed. I'm thinking positive....we all know "Disco Lives!!"

Warmrest Regards & Thanks,

D.C. LaRue

story:
We are two extremely motivated music educators who would like to use our profession to help the youth by offering gratuitous tuition to low income families. As of now there are no organizations providing this service to the poorest areas of the San Fernando Valley. We would like to have the opportunity to help. 

Our current staff includes music instructors with stellar credits as well as guest speakers and teachers that are very established in the music industry. As diverse as our backgrounds, they all share one thing: we found our way in life through music. Many of us come from the same neighborhoods that we are trying to help. 
This fundraiser is to help get our organization started. Please help us make a difference. 
Thank you,
The Gift Of Music Foundation

story:
I’m Judy Peiser.
I am Co- founder and Executive Producer of the Center for Southern Folklore in Memphis.  For the last 40 years I’ve learned from, presented, and celebrated the music and culture of everyday people from across Memphis and the Delta Region of the United States. 


2015 is the 20th year of normalized relationships between Vietnam and the United States. 

The Memphis Music & Culture Tour will represent the United States of America as part of the festivities to commemorate the 20thyear of normalized relations between the United States of America and the Socialist Republic of Viet Nam.

Memphis native Judy Peiser(Judy Peiser Productions, LLC) was selected by the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism of Vietnam and then approved by the U.S. Embassy in Hanoi to produce nine (9) shows for this historic event. The Memphis Music & Culture Tour’s “Memphis Show” will include approximately twenty-five (25) performers, artists, dancers, musicians and approximately ten (10) production crew and management staff.

In the Fall of 2015 we'll entertain children and families of all ages.  There will be dance instruction, harmonica playing, song writing, arts and crafts demonstrations and much more. 


The tour is much more than just great entertainment.  It’s really about connecting people.


I believe the tour’s performances and creative sessions provide a vehicle for artists and audiences to learn more about one another, as we share our music and culture. "one person at a time".


Vietnam has one of the youngest populations in all of Asia with most Vietnamese under 35 years old.  They are immensely curious about America.  Our Memphis Music & Culture Tour gives us the opportunity to create new relationships and discard issues in our past. 


Your support will help us REDEFINE THIS RELATIONSHIP and ENHANCE OUR Community Outreach efforts associated with these shows.


WE NEED YOUR HELP TO EXPAND and ENRICH OUR EFFORTS. 
Our tour will provide a total of  7 free shows. 


We will host 4 shows in Hanoi at the American Club and we will go on the road
to host 3 shows in the provincial cities of Thai Nguyen, Hai Phong and Ha Long Bay. 
YOUR SUPPORT WILL ALLOW US TO:


1. Produce signage and flyers in Vietnamese to enhance and promote FREE SHOWS and OUT  REACH PROGRAMS
2. Host events for Memphis artists to meet Vietnamese artists.
3. Provide pop up performances at parks in Hanoi and the provincial cities we visit
4. Extend our Memphis Music Student Programs to reach more colleges and universities
5. Pay for street teams to promote THE FREE SHOWS in Hanoi, Thai Nguyen, Hai Phong and Ha Long Bay


For your support we have some great perks!!  Some perks even include an opportunity for you to join our production team Vietnam. 


Please take a look and find what fits you and make a pledge.


Please go to our website: www.realmemphismusic.com for more information about the Memphis Music & Culture tour. You’ll hear more about our projects in Asia and have a chance to participate in the Memphis Music & Culture Tour.

story:
The Music Culture is booming in the city of Pomona, CA. and has been for years now.  The downtown area of this city is filled with concerts on the daily hosting some of the most amazing bands and solo artists in the area. We want to focus on this culture and the local bands and artists of our community by providing a high-quality, yet affordable, recording and rehearsal studio where local talent can jump-start their music careers and develop their brands.

We can only have a certain number of Perks displayed on this campaign. However, if you contribute $20, we will send you a Limited Edition T-Shirt and if you contribute $25, we will send you a Dope Spot Crew Neck... and if you contribute $15, we will send you a Dope Spot Snap-back Hat! (must provide shipping address & size)


The Dope Spot Studios is ran by artists, musicians and  creatives of the community who understand the concept of hard work and dedication for one's craft.  We are passionate about our art and the idea of chasing a dream.  So we've created this studio to help other individuals do just that.  A number of studios are in business solely for the money and not the Art.  A lot of artists and bands, including ourselves, have spent so much money at studios where the engineer simply "clicks the record button" and has nothing else to offer.  And we often never go back to that studio and simply end up trying to record at home with a laptop and a microphone. 

Here at The Dope Spot Studios, we've adopted the ideology of "Artists helping other Artists", which is very rare nowadays.  We believe in doing everything we can to help artists with their projects, including giving them advice based on our own experiences and providing them with more than just recording services.  The Dope Spot Studios is a "One Stop Shop" for artists serious about pursuing music as a career and would like to take it to the next level.  Here at the studio we provide artists with very special services including:

      To get the best possible use out of this studio, we've calculated the costs to be around $15,000 (our campaign goal).  If we reach our goal, all of this funding will go into sound treatment installment, upgrading our recording and rehearsal equipment and marketing the studio. Furthermore, we lease the space out to run this studio, so anything left over from this campaign will be deposited into a "rainy day fund" account and will be used to pay the lease on the space when business is slow, allowing us to keep our doors open and continue servicing the community.

      If we do not reach our goal, whatever money we do raise will go into the sound treatment of the studio, which we believe is the most important aspect of our studio starting out. In this case, we will continue to service the community of local artists by simply working with what we've got and continuing to build from there.

      NOTE: All Perks claimed will  be fulfilled whether we reach our goal or not.

        We believe that the The Dope Spot Studios will change the culture of Independent Music in the city of Pomona and the surrounding cities in a HUGE way.  This studio is designed to elevate artists to the next level.  Local talent often have a hard time getting their music out there due to lack of knowledge and/or inexperience, which is sort of like a catch 22; Artists have a hard time getting out there because they haven't had the opportunity to get out there.  We want to help artists succeed.  This is why the studio exists. So far, we are one of the only studios for local artists that still exist in Pomona, CA. And not only that, but we are providing affordable, high-quality recording services, as well as a large-sized Rehearsal Space.

          If you are unable to contribute to our project, please take the time to share this campaign with other artists you know who may be in need of the services we have to offer.

          THANK YOU! Let's make this dream a reality!
story_txt:
The Music Culture is booming in the city of Pomona, CA. and has been for years now.  The downtown area of this city is filled with concerts on the daily hosting some of the most amazing bands and solo artists in the area. We want to focus on this culture and the local bands and artists of our community by providing a high-quality, yet affordable, recording and rehearsal studio where local talent can jump-start their music careers and develop their brands.

We can only have a certain number of Perks displayed on this campaign. However, if you contribute $20, we will send you a Limited Edition T-Shirt and if you contribute $25, we will send you a Dope Spot Crew Neck... and if you contribute $15, we will send you a Dope Spot Snap-back Hat! (must provide shipping address & size)







The Dope Spot Studios is ran by artists, musicians and  creatives of the community who 
understand the concept of hard work and dedication for one's craft.  We 
are passionate about our art and the idea of chasing a dream.  So we've 
created this studio to help other individuals do just that.  A number of studios are in business solely for the money and not the Art.  A lot of artists and bands, including ourselves, have spent so much money at studios where the engineer simply "clicks the record button" and has nothing else to offer.  And we often never go back to that studio and simply end up trying to record at home with a laptop and a microphone.  
Here at The Dope Spot Studios, we've adopted the ideology of "Artists helping other Artists", which is very rare nowadays.  We believe in doing everything we can to help artists with their projects, including giving them advice based on our own experiences and providing them with more than just recording services.  The Dope Spot Studios is a "One Stop Shop" for artists serious about pursuing music as a career and would like to take it to the next level.  Here at the studio we provide artists with very special services including:









To get the best possible use out of this studio, we've calculated the costs to be around $15,000 (our campaign goal).  If we reach our goal, all of this funding will go into sound treatment installment, upgrading our recording and rehearsal equipment and marketing the studio. Furthermore, we lease the space out to run this studio, so anything left over from this campaign will be deposited into a "rainy day fund" account and will be used to pay the lease on the space when business is slow, allowing us to keep our doors open and continue servicing the community.



If we do not reach our goal, whatever money we do raise will go into the sound treatment of the studio, which we believe is the most important aspect of our studio starting out. In this case, we will continue to service the community of local artists by simply working with what we've got and continuing to build from there.
NOTE: All Perks claimed will  be fulfilled whether we reach our goal or not.     

We believe that the The Dope Spot Studios will change the culture of Independent Music in the city of Pomona and the surrounding cities in a HUGE way.  This studio is designed to elevate artists to the next level.  Local talent often have a hard time getting their music out there due to lack of knowledge and/or inexperience, which is sort of like a catch 22; Artists have a hard time getting out there because they haven't had the opportunity to get out there.  We want to help artists succeed.  This is why the studio exists. So far, we are one of the only studios for local artists that still exist in Pomona, CA. And not only that, but we are providing affordable, high-quality recording services, as well as a large-sized Rehearsal Space.    
 If you are unable to contribute to our project, please take the time to share this campaign with other artists you know who may be in need of the services we have to offer.THANK YOU! Let's make this dream a reality!

story:
"...The music's incendiary tone is conducted by Mathlouthi's galvanic voice, which is at turns vulnerable and strong. On "Ensen" you hear a person refusing to compromise, a searing vision founded on real risks and the necessity of truth. Pitchfork


If you believe that labels aren’t the only ones who should decide what has artistic value, and what you listen to, please come along on this journey... 


Where it started...

I am Emel Mathlouthi, singer, songwriter and composer from Tunisia and of the world. I’ve been singing since I was 10.

In 2007 I left my country and started composing from Paris after my music and conscience suffered the cultural and political dictatorship that tried to cut the Tunisian people off from good ideas and free words.

In 2008 my song Kelmti Horra (my word is free), started travelling on the web to become a kind of anthem for revolutionaries starving for a larger horizon in Tunisia and all over the Arab region during what came to be known the Arab Spring. 

In 2012 I released my first album of the same name with songs composed during the dictatorship and drawing the start of a new music inspired by 90’s trip hop, 60’s protest folk music, and the unique 70's musical agitators from Egypt and Lebanon. I toured over 40 countries connecting with audiences around the world and have been invited in December 2015 to perform  at The Nobel Peace Prize Concert.


©Olav

The New Album  

After a big search and multiple journeys, I connected with great artists including old friends from the underground scene in Tunisia at first, and then new collaborators from France, Iceland, Sweden and the United States. 

I am proud of what is emerging over years of collaboration, striving and inspiration. 

I am producing an album pushing the boundaries of music, by bringing analog North African rhythms and instruments through cutting-edge and very organic electronica. 

A unique sonic universe where shaded Arabic tones would co-exist with thundering beats and searing melodies, evoking an urgent and passionate search for humanity and truth. 


©Mehdi Hassine

Why I need you

I approached many record labels. None was ready to leap.  All had many good things to say, but none could imagine how I could fit. To some I was too exotic, to others, not enough. The world music labels wanted to keep me in some kind of an ethnic box. The indie labels can’t get past the fact that I sing in Arabic.  

The market believes that there are only modern artists from the West, and ethnic caricatures from places like Tunisia. 

I disagree. 

It is not only for Western artists and labels to define the way sounds will mix. Artists from the rest of the world can be influenced by rock or electronic music, be pioneers and have equal chances to be recognized artistically. 

I want to self-release this album, to send a strong message to the industry that it can no longer confine us by our backgrounds and to have the independence needed to create an art that is true to me. 

It will be a lot of extra work, and a lot of extra risk, but I refuse to compromise, to deny the mix of influences that made me the artist I am and that is the basis of my connection with my fans, friends and many creative partners.

I refuse to be dependent, I am complete and I draw an art that defies all limitations and borders. 

I need your support. If you believe that a woman can be an independent creative and a free artist, please help. 


©Areon Mobasher

What you can do 

I invested all what I had at this point of the adventure and now I need your help to be able to share the album with the world.

 Releasing this album requires pressing the actual CDs; carrying out a marketing campaign including hiring publiscists and promoters, doing the album artwork, posters and videos and working with a distributor to get the album online and in stores in diverse markets.  

Every little helps, if you can't donate, spread the word, share with anyone and everyone wide and far...

Thank you from the bottom of my heart for your attention and support, remember, you are the only reason that true art and music can exist and by that, you are already being the change you want to see in the world.

Love, Emel

story:
Your Support for The U-Rock Network™ goes directly to supporting an unique network of music supporters that know great rock music. On the playlist of any of the U-Rock Radio™ affiliates you will find great rock overlooked and long forgotten by marketing fads!! Our main slogan is "Rocking The Unheard with the Under Exposed" and we mean it. We play stuff we know you will like and have not heard, plus stuff deeper off the album, not just the run of the mill "Classic Rock" Hit. We play stuff from artist and musicians before they were big and after they were big, from their garage band to the big band they became and toured areas with.

The U-Rock Network™ feed is the main streaming feed that you will find selections by great new bands and artist playing Rock and Roll Today. These bands are on the up and coming and deserve to be heard. They are selected on songwriting, sound, beat but overall by Quality of Material. 

The U-Rock Network™ spins any style of rock. You will hear everything from metal, progressive, indie, punk, garage, revival, 50′, 60’s, 70’s and all the other styles not mentioned. One of the main reasons for this diversity are the Network affiliated Stations.

We currently have affiliates operating in  Hillsdale, MI, Indianapolis, IN, Atlanta, GA, Philadelphia, PA, Pittsburgh, PA and  Pittsburg, KS on the FM at KSEK-FM 99.1. We are always looking to recruit more folks with the same drive and love of rock music.

The U-Rock Radio™ Network was designed around the traditional call-signs like AM, FM and TV. The only difference is we use DB. Presently we have 25 Station Call signs registered to The U-Rock Network™ and any additional funds we raise will help us secure additional call signs. 

The idea at work behind this concept is a network of individuals that really care about music and are involved in some manner already, or have been and would like to be once more. 

The ultimate goal is to develop a support network complete with radio and properly supported gigs in each Affiliate town or city. By working with the local business owners to provide support like free meals or reduced cost, safe storage of instruments, etc. Things that bands really need while on the road.

Presently, we have launched U-Rock™ Today in short run print to connect with the local business owners and let them know about our new Network. U-Rock™Today Online is the central collection point for the news from the affiliates as well as the current Best of the Week, Band of The Week, Video's of the Moment, Local Business Spotlight etc.

 U-Rock™Today is also used to showcase the bands we play in rotation, by featuring the Band of the Week in  print with the local advertisers. Giving bands the ability to be introduced to new fans and build a local audience.

We have a massed a large library of music that is in every category of Rock and that is why we say, “From The 50’s to Today™. When U-rock Radio™ was started 15 years it was small and simple but many changes have taken place in the Internet Radio segment since, with the most recent development being a metric standard to gauge listen hours of audio commercials. This development over all has brought about the importance of our campaign at this the time.

Please Remember The U-Rock Network™ covers today's best new artists, and plays them side by side with the underexposed rock music long forgotten by marketing trends and fads. Thanks you for checking out our campaign and cause. Be Well and Rock On!!!

Please donate even just $5 dollars, it will bring us to our funding goal and will give new music a chance. We have great plans and once we have enough capital for the overhead, we can roll full steam ahead. Thank You.

http://igg.me/at/urock/x/9262903

story:
I have been learning by working in the candy industry for nearly 10 years now. Teaching myself to make molds, temper chocolate and vet supplies and resources to bring my designs to life.  My intention has been to bring my unique contribution to hip hop culture into the world.  The journey hasn't been a smooth one, but has been lovely none the less.   I am finally ready to exit the "underground" and I need your assistance to keep this dream alive! 

Hip Hop Culture is arguably the most amazing culture earth has given birth to!  After a short 40years in existence it now informs and inspires popular culture on a global level!  Chocolate truly is a reflection of the smooth, sometimes bitter, sometimes sweet nature of hip hop and its people.  Not to mention the parallels between the journey of the sacred cocoa bean to bar throughout history and the Hip Hop Cultures journey from obscurity to commodity world wide.   Hip Hop Chocolates represent the most delicious aspects of a culture still emerging into maturity! 

I learned this year that there are many many large distribution outlets interested in offering my product on their Platform!   (KITSON, Urban Outfitters to name a few!) What they all wanted to see was an big improvement in the packaging and branding. 

  I am raising money to finance this next level of packaging, marketing, production costs of supplies and to cover the cost of renting a commercial kitchen to accommodate our expanding operation.  I will also be using the funds to produce a small batch of Raw/Organic turntable chocolates. Featuring special recipes containing specific super foods to enhance peak performance for artists, intellectuals and athletes in the culture. Offering Healthy candy options to the culture!

"Hip Hop Chocolate isn't just a Candy brand, its a way of interacting with the culture and taking full responsibility for what you contribute." 


We will be adding awesome Perks throughout the life of the campaign so stay tuned and SHARE!!

What we will use the funds for

  • Print Packaging for (5000) Turntable Gummy.
  • Make 5000 Turntable gummys
  • Pay a Graphic Designer to finalize Lollipop box and packaging.
  • Print die cut boxes for (10000) Turntable Lollipops.
  • Pay the 8 month rental fees for a commercial kitchen.
  • Launch a modest marketing campaign. Concentrating on targeting hip hop blogs, magazines, websites and Event promoters.
  • Lawyer fees associated with manufacturing contract.
  • Cover the manufacturing cost of making a run of 5000 gummys and 10000 lollipops.
  • Begin developing our Organic Super food line of Hip Hop Chocolates!

Stretch Goals Would Include:

  • Expanding our Graffiti gummy line into Vitagummys and hard candies
  • Securing Manufacturing for other Hip Hop Inspired gummys and products
  • Hip Hop Chocolate Inspired allover printed clothing
  • Self Publish my book The Physics of Hip Hop

*Each stretch milestone will be identified when the previous goal is meet. Everyone who has contributed will then be first to receive these extra perks as stretch goals are overcome!*

If you like what you see please help us SPREAD THE WORD!! #HipHopChocolates #Believeinhiphop

Hiphopchocolate.com


HUGE THANK YOU TO OUR SPONSORS!


                                   

ARTDONTSLEEP

THRIVE MARKET

KEPT SEE SOUNDCLOUD


We will be applying funds to have these boxes Printed!! KITSON and Urban Outfitters have expressed interest in carrying the Turntable Gummys!!

We will also be completing the design of this Awesome lollipop box!!


I want to create a line of Organic Raw Chocolates! These Pyramids and Turntables were the home made beginnings.

Turntable Lollipop!



Hip Hop "Activists" Will receive this all over Dye sublimated T Shirt (value $45)

 HipHopChocolate Gift Baskets for you Valentine!! (Value $200)


EVERYONE LOVES HIPHOPCHOCOLATES!!

THE PRESS!!


THE HIPHOP CULTURE!

DJ QBert!


QuestLove


Posedanose/De La Soul


ZTRIP

ALOE BLACC

Snoop!


THE CHILDREN!!

I cant wait to introduce Hip Hop Chocolates to the World!!

story:
Do you remember shows like “Hell’s Kitchen”, “Metalla” or “Headbanger’s Ball?” We all sat glued to the tube, letting spectacular music videos, legendary concerts and festival reports wash over us.

For many of us, shows like these laid the groundwork for a lifelong passion for rock and metal. Metal isn’t just a genre, it’s an outlook on life and a way of living it. The demise of classic music television and the ever growing tendency for its strings to be pulled by zeitgeisty trends quickly saw such formats disappearing from the screen.

Today, we're all busy jumping back and forth between various instances of social web, audio and video streaming and on demand platforms while trying to keep our groups together and our sorry selves up to date. Still rock and metal is barely represented. Imagine we had that single one spot, that hot zone where we can build all that together. Our own Netflix just for rock and metal. Where we are not zombies and eat what gets tossed in our direction, but a bunch of great people who meet and actively define, refine and grow the perfect meal. Talk about it after dinner. Become buddies and inspire each other. Let's fall back from the zombie zones and make that RockZone, shall we? Support us and move in with us!

To build the platform with the greatest rock and metal concerts we need money for licensing on a global state:
  • If we fund 50.000 EUR we will get more than 100 concerts and documentaries incl. Metal Evolution series, Slayer,  Mastodon, Accept and many more
  • We already are in negotiations with the biggest labels, bands and managements in order to get access to special contents and great concerts
  • In addition we will bring you the best news out of the rock and metal sector - including newcomer bands, new releases, festivals, tours and much more
  • We are going to produce content by ourselves - visiting concerts and festivals and give you behind the scene information on your favorite artists and bands
  • We already have support from: Accept, Overkill, Blind Guardian, In Extremo, EMP, Grüne Hölle, 70.000 Tons of Metal, RockFels Festival and many more.


If we reach more than 50.000 EUR we will license much more concerts and will organize a fantastic event for you as fans. Stay tuned for updates on this matter.




It’s time to reignite the fire! RockZone’s more than ready to bring those lost riffs back to life. Starting spring 2015, this Video on Demand service will be providing fans with their favorite tunes, delivering them straight to their living rooms and gadgets. But this is no ordinary clip stream - in our extensive library, you’ll be able to find all kinds of content, ranging from concerts and festivals, interviews and behind-the-scenes material to exclusive videos, editorials, documentaries and radio sessions. Apart from well-known acts from rock to hard metal, we’ll be showcasing newcomers of all pertinent persuasions, a true feast for ears and eyes – with audio and video in top-notch quality!
And since we want RockZone to be all about you, the fans, there will be designated areas and channels for an open exchange of ideas – among fans, editors and makers alike. We want you to be an integral part of this project from the very start: Crowdfunding support, a say in content choices and styles and a whole lot more. Your opinion, your voice, your support matter – they are indispensable for making RockZone what we want it to be: a service by fans for fans, a reflection of the way rockers and metalheads across globe are united by their passion for the heavy sounds.

RockZone is the brainchild of Michael Bogatzki and Christian Morawietz.

         

Michael’s love for the rough stuff began when he got a hold of Golden Earring’s legendary “Radar Love” single at the mere age of five. In his teen years, he also frequented the dark side of the speaker: along with his friends, he’d be seen rocking out in a hardcore/crossover band which would later go on to spawn Chronical Diarrhoea and the avant-gardists of Bohren & der Club of Gore.

Christian’s first concert was the Monsters Of Rock Festival back in 1988, where he witnessed Iron Maiden, Kiss, Anthrax, Testament and many others work their magic. This experience has stayed with him ever since, shaping his work endeavors as well as his downtime. The two rock admirers know each other since many years and became instant friends. Their first collaboration was MAKE MUSIC TV, a well-established video streaming service for concerts, documentaries and a lot more.

When setting up the project there are some hurdles to overcome

  • Platform development will be based on Make Music TV mature streaming and content technology - but still we have to develop some more fantastic features in order to bring the greatest performance to you. If we have to face challenges during the development, the launch of RockZone may be delayed.

  • Content sourcing is a crucial thing. We always try to find the best and greatest concerts - still some of the licenses will be not available or to expensive. So not every concert on our wishlist might be on the platform at the beginning. Nevertheless we will have enough fabulous content to show in any case.

  • If we don’t succeed reaching our goal, we will still get you access to some of the best concerts and documentaries. Maybe we will not have as many concerts from the start.

If you are contributing or you know people who might be interested in the RockZone perks, just send them a link via mail or Facebook to share the idea and campaign.

  • Tell your friends about RockZone and the fabulous perks via your Facebook, Instagram, Tumblr or Twitter accounts!
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thanks for reading the whole thing!

Do not read the next line:

You little rebel! We like it!
story_txt:
Do you remember shows
like “Hell’s Kitchen”, “Metalla” or “Headbanger’s Ball?” We all sat glued to the tube, letting
spectacular music videos, legendary concerts and festival reports wash over us.
For many of us, shows like these laid the groundwork for a lifelong passion for
rock and metal. Metal isn’t just a genre, it’s an outlook on life and a way
of living it. The demise of classic music television and the ever growing
tendency for its strings to be pulled by zeitgeisty trends quickly saw such
formats disappearing from the screen.







Today, we're all busy jumping back and forth between various instances of social web, audio and video streaming and on demand platforms while trying to keep our groups together and our sorry selves up to date. Still rock and metal is barely represented. Imagine we had that single one spot, that hot zone where we can build all that together. Our own Netflix just for rock and metal. Where we are not zombies and eat what gets tossed in our direction, but a bunch of great people who meet and actively define, refine and grow the perfect meal. Talk about it after dinner. Become buddies and inspire each other. Let's fall back from the zombie zones and make that RockZone, shall we? Support us and move in with us!








To build the platform with the greatest rock and metal concerts
we need money for licensing on a global state:


If we fund 50.000 EUR we will
     get more than 100 concerts and documentaries incl. Metal Evolution series,
     Slayer,  Mastodon, Accept and many more
We already are in negotiations with the biggest labels, bands and managements in order to get access to special contents and great concerts
In addition we will bring you the best news out of the rock and metal sector - including newcomer bands, new releases, festivals, tours and much more
We are going to produce content by ourselves - visiting concerts and festivals and give you behind the scene information on your favorite artists and bands
We already have support from: Accept, Overkill, Blind Guardian, In Extremo, EMP, Grüne Hölle, 70.000 Tons of Metal, RockFels Festival and many more.





If we reach more than 50.000 EUR we will license much more concerts and will organize a fantastic event for you as fans. Stay tuned for updates on this matter.
















































  












It’s time to reignite the fire! RockZone’s 
more than ready to bring those lost riffs back to life. Starting spring 2015, 
this Video on Demand service will be providing fans with their favorite tunes, 
delivering them straight to their living rooms and gadgets. But this is no 
ordinary clip stream - in our extensive library, you’ll be able to find all 
kinds of content, ranging from concerts and festivals, interviews and 
behind-the-scenes material to exclusive videos, editorials, documentaries and 
radio sessions. Apart from well-known acts from rock to hard metal, we’ll be 
showcasing newcomers of all pertinent persuasions, a true feast for ears and 
eyes – with audio and video in top-notch quality!And since we want RockZone to 
be all about you, the fans, there will be designated areas and channels for an 
open exchange of ideas – among fans, editors and makers alike. We want you to be 
an integral part of this project from the very start: Crowdfunding support, a 
say in content choices and styles and a whole lot more. Your opinion, your 
voice, your support matter – they are indispensable for making RockZone what we 
want it to be: a service by fans for fans, a reflection of the way rockers and 
metalheads across globe are united by their passion for the heavy sounds.

RockZone is the brainchild of Michael Bogatzki and Christian 
Morawietz. 
           

Michael’s love for the rough stuff began when he got a hold of Golden 
Earring’s legendary “Radar Love” single at the mere age of five. In his teen 
years, he also frequented the dark side of the speaker: along with his friends, 
he’d be seen rocking out in a hardcore/crossover band which would later go on to 
spawn Chronical Diarrhoea and the avant-gardists of Bohren & der Club of 
Gore. 
Christian’s first concert was the Monsters Of Rock Festival back in 1988, where he 
witnessed Iron Maiden, Kiss, Anthrax, Testament and many others work their 
magic. This experience has stayed with him ever since, shaping his work 
endeavors as well as his downtime. The two rock admirers know each other since many years and became instant friends. Their first collaboration was MAKE 
MUSIC TV, a well-established video streaming service for concerts, documentaries 
and a lot more.










 When setting up the project there are some hurdles to overcome  Platform development will be based on Make Music TV mature streaming and content technology - but still we have to develop some more fantastic features in order to bring the greatest performance to you. If we have to face challenges during the development, the launch of RockZone may be delayed. 
 Content sourcing is a crucial thing. We always try to find the best and greatest concerts - still some of the licenses will be not available or to expensive. So not every concert on our wishlist might be on the platform at the beginning. Nevertheless we will have enough fabulous content to show in any case.

If we don’t succeed
     reaching our goal, we will still get you access to some of the best concerts
     and documentaries. Maybe we will not have as many concerts from the start.
     






If you are contributing or you know people who might be interested in the RockZone perks, just send them a link via mail or Facebook to share the idea and campaign.  Tell your friends about RockZone and the fabulous perks via your Facebook, Instagram, Tumblr or Twitter accounts! 
 Please use the Indiegogo share tools!   Thanks for reading the whole thing!
Do not read the next line:
You little rebel! We like it!

story:
Short Summary

Hey, everyone, it's time for new music!  

In April, I'll be heading out west to Dallas,Texas to record an EP with producer Salim Nourallah, whose credits include producing several Old 97's records.  

This EP will be my second solo release following an extended period fronting the rock band Joe Buck, Jr.  I'm excited to be working with Salim on this project as I am a fan of both his own records and the records that he has produced.  

Not too long ago, after many years of playing in a rock band, I began my journey as a solo singer/songwriter.  It's a bit of an odd transition going from rock band to solo acoustic guy.  The challenges of performing solo are numerous (no blaming the drummer when something goes wrong on stage), but so too are the rewards.  Moving from a band to solo performer has forced me to re-examine, and relearn to some extent, how I go about doing what I do.  Performing solo requires different skills than performing with a group, and I enjoy the challenge of continuing to learn and develop those skills.  

In 2013, I released my debut solo CD "A Place in the Sun"and began traveling around the Mid-Atlantic region playing mini-tours as often as I could.  Did I mention that music isn't my full-time job, just my full-time passion?  I am an educator by profession.    

Anyway, it's time for new music again.  I'm excited about the new songs for the EP and can't wait to get into the studio.  I've always scrimped and saved to record and release records/CDs in the past, and although I will be doing that again, I am also asking for your help this time around.  Specifically, I am seeking your help to offset the additional costs of making this record associated with travel, hiring studio musicians, and paying for studio time in a land far, far away.


If you aren't familiar with my music, check out the video below.  It's song called Norfolk Southern that appeared on my first solo release "A Place in the Sun" (2013).


What I Need & What You Get

Recording and releasing new music is costly.  Here's what your contributions will help fund:

Travel Expenses

Studio Time 

Studio Musicians

In exchange for your support, I've created some perks--everything from digital and physical copies of the new EP, tickets to the EP Release Show, an invitation to an exclusive listening party long before the EP is released, up to personal house concerts in your home for you and your friends and family.

Browse a little and see what interests you.  Every contribution is important!


Other Ways You Can Help

Thanks for your support!  Please spread the word to your friends, family, and colleagues.  Share this campaign on your social networks.  Talk it up at work.  Mention it at cocktail parties.  Put a sign out on the lawn.  Shout it from rooftops.  You get the idea.  I won't be able to reach my goal and make this record unless people know about this campaign.  The people most likely to contribute are people who know me and my music.  If you know those people, please spread the word!

story:
The Man With The Boots

My name is Rob Halligan. I'm a singer/songwriter. 

Over the last ten years I've been creating music with the underlying message of hope, building bridges and finding diamonds in the dust. After losing my dad in the World trade Centre on 9-11 I decided to use music to turn that tragedy into something positive. I've worked with various charities using my songs to tell their stories and raise awareness of their work. That's taken me to places like Bangladesh, Ethiopia and South America as well as projects closer to home. 

I even got to sing on BBC1 and Radio2! I've toured as a one man show all over the UK and beyond and now, for my next album, I'd like to try something a little different.

Wherever I go I try and play for whatever-you-can-afford. I'd like to carry on doing that, making music available to whoever wants to hear it for whatever they can afford and I'd like to tour this next album with a band. 

But here's the big deal...

We're going to be raising money for Global Care's Lent Appeal, an emergency medical fund aimed at providing emergency help for some of the worlds most vulnerable kids. When I was in Bangladesh I met an 8 year old girl. As we talked it was obvious she was in some pain. The interpreter told me it was her appendix and that she'd been like this for two weeks. When I asked why she hadn't been to hospital he told me her parents couldn't afford it. The cost? £60. We paid it and that night she had a successful operation. This was the seed that would start the Emergency Medical Fund.


The last show we did raised over £1000 for the fund. 

By joining this campaign you'll enable us to get out on the road as a four piece band still playing for what a venue or promoter can afford, whether that's a stadium, arena, school, music club, pub or house concert. It means we have more chance of covering the costs of travel, food and a bed for the night as well as the odd broken guitar string. We'll also be raising money and awareness of Global Care and their amazing work.

Getting the Boots Walking

Our target is £7500. That covers the essentials like transport, food and accommodation and something for promotion - posters and flyers, enough for a 15 date tour and a target of £700 per show raised for Global Care. 

For your hard work in helping us along the way there's a host of rewards from  name-checks on posters, free downloads, CD's and T-Shirts to gig's in your living room or stadium (if you happen to own one)!

If we don't make the goal, the money that is raised will still be used for live dates, just not as many as we hoped. 

The Impact

Apart from helping raise more money for Global Care's Lent Appeal, we'll be able to take the music and message to people who wouldn't normally get to hear it. One of the great things about playing on a "whatever-you-can-afford" basis is that folks who would otherwise not get to hear live music get the chance to go to a full on show. My music is all about sharing some positive hope and the more that can happen the better. We start to see a changed society.

Over the years I've played numerous events in such a variety of venues, from slums in Ethiopia and homeless shelters in Hull to audiences full of dignitaries and main stages at big festivals. Some events have helped raise money for good causes and some have helped raise the hopes of people stuck in a dark place. 

Music has the ability to break down walls and build bridges. Part of this touring project is to do just that. 

In the past 10 years I've helped raise over £50,000 for various causes. This is something new and I'd love you to be a part of it.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you like the sound of this then please donate whatever you think you can. If you can't then please use the sharing tools on this page to let people know about what we're doing. 

You can also go and like my Facebook page and keep up with what's happening. It's www.facebook.com/halliganmusic or follow me @rhalligan on twitter.com
