story:
Juan Trigos
DeCachetitoRaspado

Comic-Hemofiction Opera in two Acts 
Libretto by Juan Trigos Synister

Following successful performances in Europe and Mexico, the Comic-Hemofiction opera DeCachetitoRaspado (CheekToStubbledCheek) will receive its United States premiere on October 28 and 29, 2015, at Georgia State University’s Rialto Center for the Arts.  This performance, co-produced by PromoMusica International of Houston, Texas, and Bent Frequency, a contemporary chamber music ensemble based in Atlanta, Georgia, will feature an international cast which includes performers from Italy, Mexico, Puerto Rico, the United States, and Venezuela.


PROJECT DESCRIPTION

This performance of DeCachetitoRaspado is a co-production of PromoMusica International of Houston, Texas, and Bent Frequency, a contemporary chamber music ensemble based in Atlanta, Georgia. The cast includes: composer and conductor Juan Trigos; stage director Luis Martín Solís; scenographer Luciano Trigos; mezzo-soprano Amy Sheffer; baritone César Torruella; soprano Daniela D’Ingiullo; tenor Esteban Cordero; co-choreographers, actresses and dancers Daniela Arroio and Anna Mariscal; the Zeitgeist Chorus directed by Deanna Joseph; and Bent Frequency.  In the weeks preceding the opera’s United States premiere, rehearsals will take place in Houston, Texas, for the majority of the cast, who will then fly to Atlanta, Georgia, to join the Zeitgeist Chorus and Bent Frequency.  This schedule will allow us to involve the local communities of both cities by arranging interviews with, and lectures by, the artists.

WHY THIS PROJECT?

Our goals in pursuing this project are:

  • To promote Mexican culture
  • To pay homage to women
  • To celebrate the 50th birthday of an important living composer.

WHY WE NEED YOUR SUPPORT

Thirty artists, thrilled to share with you their passion for music and the arts, are involved in this production, some of them talented young artists whose careers are being launched by this endeavor.  So far, we have raised $60,000 to cover airfare, lodging and meals, publicity, rental fees, and a significant portion of the artists’s compensation.  Your support will enable us to design and build the stage, make costumes, and pay the remaining portion of artists’ fees, at an estimated cost of $10,000.

ABOUT THE OPERA

DeCachetitoRaspado is a Comic-Hemofiction opera created by two extraordinary Mexican artists:  Juan Trigos, composer and conductor; and Juan Trigos Synister [Senior], novelist, playwright and librettist.  Through their works, both artists engage with culturally relevant and significant social themes, such as absence, alcohol and drug abuse, and women’s roles in the household and in society, opening a door to their conscience, urging us to reflect and to peek into the depths of our own.

ABOUT OUR PRODUCERS

PromoMusica International is a recognized producer and publisher of music and artists manager.  For more information on PromoMusica International, visit:  http://www.promusint.com 

Bent Frequency, based in Atlanta, Georgia, and hailed as “one of the brightest New Music ensembles on the scene today” by Gramophone magazine. Bent Frequency’s artistic vision is a result of the close collaboration among its Artistic Directors, Jan Berry Baker, Stuart Gerber, and Tania Maxwell Clements. For more information on Bent Frequency, visit: http://www.bentfrequency.com 


This project is made possible 
thanks to the support of

BECOME PART OF THIS PRODUCTION 

BY MAKING A DONATION AND BY SHARING THIS PAGE WITH YOUR FRIENDS.


THANK YOU FOR YOU SUPPORT!!!




MORE ABOUT DECACHETITORASPADO
AND THIS PRODUCTION….


Interview by Tom Moore on OPERA TODAY


WHAT IS HORROR-HEMOFICTION?

Horror-Hemoficción (Horror-Hemofiction) is a literary movement of search invented by Juan Trigos Synister, father of the composer. It reflects the characters in a multitude of mirrors in which they contemplate, frightened, the thousand faces of their personal infantilism. The protagonists, human children, play at being serious adults, but are murderers or full of lies. In every novel, play, or short story, infantile cruelty invades. Perhaps, someday, spiritual awakening will lead to maturity, which would mean plenary responsibility from which all characters created by Juan Trigos Synister—precisely because they are human, that is to say, children—run away. Horror-Hemoficción, always in jest, profound and amusing literature, opens doors to the personal conscience of the author and, by expansive reflection, is road towards the intimate knowledge of the reader who is capable of peeking into his or her own depths.


LIBRETTO BY JUAN TRIGOS SYNISTER 
SYNOPSIS

The central theme in the opera DeCachetitoRaspado (CheekToStubbledCheek) is the absence that the characters, Juansonrisa and Primancianita, fill up by projecting their imaginings. She is sterile, so she gives birth to two siamese sons who accompany them in all their theatrical improvisations. The story begins with the introduction of these beings of invention speaking about a baptism —imaginary as well—to which the president who has governed Mexico at diverse stages of the country’s life keeping the same criminal tendencies, will attend. Same imposing personality in collusion with the Church. There will be baptism with piñata-fractured heads. Instead of pulque, beer will run; instead of friends, compadres. Padrino (Godfather) will take requests. They have also invited the dead, Catalina and Antonia, fictitious portraits of Primancianita, to dance during the celebration. These illusory deceased are Juansonrisa’s lovers and also his victims, for he strangles them daily. Primancianita is hooked with Padrino-Presidente (Godfather-President) and wants to have sex with him. But the man of state is politically and carnally chaste. Tall. Güero (blond). Puts hands behind his back. Reads The Holy Bible. Goes to church after taking off his cassock. After washing his hands well. AfterPraying. AfterThinking of his madrecita santa (saintly mother). There is confusion between the real wedding of the protagonists and the imaginary wedding with Señor Presidente (Mister President) and with the baptism party to which a nonexistent priest attends. Honeymoon in Cuernavaca. Primancianita affirms she was a virgin before marriage, and shows her red panties as proof. There is comic singing to virginity, as to the garter that will attract the love of our Señor Presidente. There is singing to the nation and the religious inquisitorial party, rambunctious institutional party, party that has ruled the country for many decades. The opera concludes when Padrino-Presidente (Godfather-President) says that no one goes to the theater. What remains—beyond their fictional infidelities, beyond social conventions, beyond the games in which they pretend wanting to die and having wishes of killing one another—is the taste of the true love these two alcoholics feel for each other.


THE ARTISTS


JUAN TRIGOS
COMPOSER & CONDUCTOR

Juan Trigos is a very active conductor and composer, creator of the concept Abstract Folklore. In his musical production are clearly distinguished two fundamental aspects: vocal music (opera and sacred) and instrumental music with a notable predilection for the concertante forms. His works has been performed worldwide. Among the most significant latest commissions his Symphony N.3 “Ofrenda a los muertos” for the Houston Symphony Orchestra (2013).


JUAN TRIGOS SYNISTER
PLAYWRIGHT (LIBRETTIST)

Creator of the aesthetic literary movement Hemofiction, literature of search which reflects on the bleeding of the consciousness in multiple mirrors, where it contemplates with horror the thousand faces of personal infantilism, process which endures desolation and anguish, indispensable symptoms on the road to individuation, path of ascension towards human. His best-known works include La Llorona, La Leyenda de Don Juan Manuel, La Diabólica Santa de la Tijeras, Callejón de las ratas, Mamá es loca o está poseída and La Culpa.


LUIS MARTÍN SOLÍS
STAGE DIRECTOR

This internationally renowned stage director has directed plays of William Shakespeare, Maurice Maeterlinck, William Golding, Suzanne van Louhizen, Ad Bond, Luis Buñuel, Hugo Hiriart, Maribel Carrasco, LEGOM, Juan Villoro, Jorge Ibarguengoitia, and Octavio Paz, among others. He directed operas by Donizetti, Gilbert and Sullivan, Rossini and Vivaldi. He also directed contemporary operas as well as La muerte pies ligeros, Paso del norte, and El conejo y el coyote by Victor Rasgado, the last one performed in the Smithsonian National Museum of the American Indian in Washington, D.C. Some of his works have been performed in the United States, Canada, Switzerland, and Colombia. For the sixth year he is guest conductor at Middlebury College in Vermont (2009-14). He is also author of the books People talking alone, Interdisciplina escénica II, Theater for Puppets and two editions of the magazine Máscara.


LUCIANO TRIGOS
PAINTER (SCENE & COSTUMES)

Following the tradition of the Mexican Muralism, Luciano Trigos recently painted El Gigante, a 753 sq. ft. mural commissioned by the “Don Quijote Iconographic Museum” of Guanajuato, Mexico. His paintings are a product of lateral, germane vision. Plastic cells are born, they grow and reproduce inside original, abstract forms and at the same time, follow a kind of autonomous development.


THE PERFORMERS


    

PRIMANCIANITA 
AMY SHEFFER (MEZZOSOPRANO)

Since 2006 has been guest soloist in several Festival, Summer Programs and Theaters in Europe and United States, as well as, Bel Canto Institute (Florence, Italy), Opera in the Ozarks, Inspiration Point (AR), University of Wisconsin-Madison Opera, Le Chiavi Institute, Texas Music Festival (Houston, TX), University of Houston Moores Opera Center (Houston,TX). Among the others concert programs and opera productions, Rossini's La Donna Del Lago and Guillaume Tell , Bach's Cantata 106, Mozart's The Magic Flute, Puccini's Gianni Schicchi and Suor Angelica,  Offenbach''s Les Contes d'Hoffmann,  Into the Woods, Floyd 's Cold Sassy Tree, Menotti's The Consul. 

JUANSONRISA
CÉSAR TORRUELLA (BARITONE)

Originally from Puerto Rico, he sang as a guest soloist in Austria, Puerto Rico and the United States. He has participated at concerts and opera productions performing works by Schubert (Mass N.2 in G Major), Beethoven (Symphony N.9 and Choral Fantasy Op.80), Michael Haydn (Requiem), Bach (Magnificat), Puccini (Gianni Schicchi, Boheme, Tosca, Turandot), Rossini (La Cenerentola, L'italiana in Algeri, Il Barbiere di Siviglia), Donizetti (L'elisir d'amore, Don Pasquale), Offenbach (Les Contes d’Hoffmann), Verdi (Falstaff, La Traviata), Mozart (Le Nozze di Figaro, Cosí fan tutte, Don Giovanni Die Zauberflöte), Floyd (Cold Sassy Tree), Ravel (L'heure Espagnole), Ullmann (Der Kaiser von Atlantis), F. Morreno Torroba (Luisa Fernanda), Britten (Albert Herring), Lehar (Die Lustige Witwe), Rota (Il cappello di Paglia di Firenze), Poulenc (Les Dialogues des Carmelites) and the world premier of Rafael Hernández's Cofresí. 


SIAMES I
DANIELA D'INGIULLO (SOPRANO)

Active in the international field, has been guest singer in various theaters and festivals in Europe, United States, Mexico and Costa Rica. Among the most important commitments she has been guest soloist in Mexico with the Symphony Orchestras of Aguascalientes, Puebla, Guanajuato and, in Costa Rica, with the Heredia Symphony Orchestra. She has specialized in XXth-XIth Centuries Music, especially in Juan Trigos vocal music. By this composer she sang the opera DeCachetitoRaspado, Cantatas N.2 and N.3 “Phos Hilaron” (N.3 also recorded with the Guanajuato Symphony Orchestra, Quindecim 2014), and last April 17, 2015, she premiered, with the Boca del Río Philharmonic Orchestra (Mexico), "Nezahualcoyotl Icuicahuan" for soprano and orchestra with texts in Nauatl language by the Aztec poet Nezahualcoyotl.


 

SIAMES II
ESTEBAN CORDERO (TENOR)

Puerto Rican tenor Esteban Cordero is in the early stages of a promising career. A winner of the Metropolitan Opera National Council Auditions in Puerto Rico and a finalist in the New Orleans Region, Mr. Cordero appeared as a soloist with the Israel Chamber Orchestra and the Coro Nacional de Puerto Rico, and is a frequent guest soloist of the Orquesta Sinfónica de Puerto Rico. He has been invited twice to participate in the prestigious International Summer Opera Institute in Tel Aviv and the Prelude to Performance summer program. 


CO-CHOREOGRAPHER & MUERTA I (ACTRESS/DANCER)
DANIELA ARROIO

CO-CHOREOGRAPHER & MUERTA II (ACTRESS/DANCER)
ANNA MARISCAL


ZEITGEIST CHORUS
DIRECTOR DEANNA JOSEPH 
Dr. Deanna Joseph is director of choral activities at the Georgia State University School of Music, where she conducts the University Singers and leads the master’s program in choral conducting. Dr. Joseph’s research in the area of 19th century choral-orchestral performance-practice has led to invited presentations on the topic at several division conferences of the American Choral Director’s Association and at the national convention for the National Collegiate Choral Organization.  She holds conducting degrees from the Eastman School of Music, where she was awarded the Walter Hagen Conducting Prize.

BENT FREQUENCY, based in Atlanta, Georiga, and hailed as “one of the brightest New Music ensembles on the scene today” by Gramophone magazine, is a ground-breaking chamber music ensemble who’s vision is to redefine the traditional music experience, ushering it from strict formality to the fresh air of contemporary artistic expression and experimentation.  Founded in 2003, Bent Frequency brings classical avant-garde and alternative music to life through adventurous programming, the promotion and commissioning of New Music, and a creative synthesis of music and current day media.  Bent Frequency’s artistic vision is a result of the close collaboration among its Artistic Directors, Jan Berry Baker, Stuart Gerber, and Tania Maxwell Clements.


OUR VOCAL COACH
ANA MARIA OTAMENDI

Pianist, coach and conductor. Since her orchestral debut at age twelve, Ana María has performed as a soloist and collaborative pianist at important venues and with renowned orchestras in Austria, Panama, Brazil,  the United States, Spain, Italy, and Venezuela. After finishing her two-year tenure as Studio Artist at the prestigious Houston Grand Opera Studio, she is now a Visiting Professor at the University of Houston, as well as Music Director, pianist and conductor for different programs at HGOCo.

story_txt:
Juan TrigosDeCachetitoRaspado

Comic-Hemofiction Opera in two Acts Libretto by Juan Trigos Synister

Following
successful performances in Europe and Mexico, the Comic-Hemofiction opera DeCachetitoRaspado (CheekToStubbledCheek) will receive its United States premiere on October 28
and 29, 2015, at Georgia State University’s Rialto Center for the Arts.  This performance, co-produced by PromoMusica
International of Houston, Texas, and Bent Frequency, a contemporary chamber
music ensemble based in Atlanta, Georgia, will feature an international cast
which includes performers from Italy, Mexico, Puerto Rico, the United States,
and Venezuela.
PROJECT DESCRIPTION
This performance of
DeCachetitoRaspado is a co-production of PromoMusica International of
Houston, Texas, and Bent Frequency, a contemporary chamber music ensemble based
in Atlanta, Georgia. The cast includes:
composer and conductor Juan Trigos; stage director Luis Martín Solís; scenographer Luciano Trigos; mezzo-soprano
Amy Sheffer; baritone César Torruella; soprano Daniela D’Ingiullo; tenor
Esteban Cordero; co-choreographers, actresses and dancers Daniela Arroio and Anna Mariscal; the Zeitgeist Chorus directed by Deanna Joseph; and Bent
Frequency.  In the weeks preceding the
opera’s United States premiere, rehearsals will take place in Houston, Texas,
for the majority of the cast, who will then fly to Atlanta, Georgia, to join
the Zeitgeist Chorus and Bent Frequency. 
This schedule will allow us to involve the local communities of both
cities by arranging interviews with, and lectures by, the artists.
WHY THIS PROJECT?
Our goals in
pursuing this project are:

To promote Mexican culture


To pay homage to women


To celebrate the 50th
birthday of an important living composer.


WHY WE NEED YOUR SUPPORT
Thirty artists,
thrilled to share with you their passion for music and the arts, are involved
in this production, some of them talented young artists whose careers are being
launched by this endeavor.  So far, we
have raised $60,000 to cover airfare, lodging and meals, publicity, rental
fees, and a significant portion of the artists’s compensation.  Your support will enable us to design and
build the stage, make costumes, and pay the remaining portion of artists’ fees,
at an estimated cost of $10,000.
ABOUT THE OPERA
DeCachetitoRaspado is a Comic-Hemofiction opera
created by two extraordinary Mexican artists: 
Juan Trigos, composer and conductor; and Juan Trigos Synister [Senior], novelist,
playwright and librettist.  Through their
works, both artists engage with culturally relevant and significant social
themes, such as absence, alcohol and drug abuse, and women’s roles in the
household and in society, opening a door to their conscience, urging us to
reflect and to peek into the depths of our own.


ABOUT OUR PRODUCERS

PromoMusica International is a recognized producer and
publisher of music and artists manager.  For
more information on PromoMusica International, visit:  http://www.promusint.com 

Bent Frequency, based
in Atlanta, Georgia, and hailed as “one of the brightest New Music ensembles on
the scene today” by Gramophone magazine. Bent Frequency’s artistic vision is a result of the close collaboration among its Artistic Directors, Jan Berry Baker, Stuart Gerber, and Tania Maxwell Clements. For more information on Bent Frequency, visit: http://www.bentfrequency.com 








This project is made possible thanks to the support of

BECOME PART OF THIS PRODUCTION 





BY
MAKING A DONATION AND BY SHARING THIS PAGE WITH YOUR FRIENDS.

THANK YOU FOR YOU SUPPORT!!!






MORE ABOUT DECACHETITORASPADO AND THIS PRODUCTION….









Interview by Tom Moore on OPERA TODAY







WHAT IS HORROR-HEMOFICTION?
Horror-Hemoficción (Horror-Hemofiction) is a literary movement of search invented by Juan Trigos Synister, father of the composer. It reflects the characters in a multitude of mirrors in which they contemplate, frightened, the thousand faces of their personal infantilism. The protagonists, human children, play at being serious adults, but are murderers or full of lies. In every novel, play, or short story, infantile cruelty invades. Perhaps, someday, spiritual awakening will lead to maturity, which would mean plenary responsibility from which all characters created by Juan Trigos Synister—precisely because they are human, that is to say, children—run away. Horror-Hemoficción, always in jest, profound and amusing literature, opens doors to the personal conscience of the author and, by expansive reflection, is road towards the intimate knowledge of the reader who is capable of peeking into his or her own depths.



LIBRETTO BY JUAN TRIGOS SYNISTER SYNOPSIS

The central theme in the opera DeCachetitoRaspado (CheekToStubbledCheek) is the absence that the characters, Juansonrisa and Primancianita, fill up by projecting their imaginings. She is sterile, so she gives birth to two siamese sons who accompany them in all their theatrical improvisations. The story begins with the introduction of these beings of invention speaking about a baptism —imaginary as well—to which the president who has governed Mexico at diverse stages of the country’s life keeping the same criminal tendencies, will attend. Same imposing personality in collusion with the Church. There will be baptism with piñata-fractured heads. Instead of pulque, beer will run; instead of friends, compadres. Padrino (Godfather) will take requests. They have also invited the dead, Catalina and Antonia, fictitious portraits of Primancianita, to dance during the celebration. These illusory deceased are Juansonrisa’s lovers and also his victims, for he strangles them daily. Primancianita is hooked with Padrino-Presidente (Godfather-President) and wants to have sex with him. But the man of state is politically and carnally chaste. Tall. Güero (blond). Puts hands behind his back. Reads The Holy Bible. Goes to church after taking off his cassock. After washing his hands well. AfterPraying. AfterThinking of his madrecita santa (saintly mother). There is confusion between the real wedding of the protagonists and the imaginary wedding with Señor Presidente (Mister President) and with the baptism party to which a nonexistent priest attends. Honeymoon in Cuernavaca. Primancianita affirms she was a virgin before marriage, and shows her red panties as proof. There is comic singing to virginity, as to the garter that will attract the love of our Señor Presidente. There is singing to the nation and the religious inquisitorial party, rambunctious institutional party, party that has ruled the country for many decades. The opera concludes when Padrino-Presidente (Godfather-President) says that no one goes to the theater. What remains—beyond their fictional infidelities, beyond social conventions, beyond the games in which they pretend wanting to die and having wishes of killing one another—is the taste of the true love these two alcoholics feel for each other.

story:
Who we are

Opera Parallèle is San Francisco’s contemporary opera company. Our M.O. is right in our name: we work in parallel with creative artists and with arts and community organizations to make operatic art that’s not only enjoyable, but meaningful to 21st-century audiences. Each of our acclaimed productions is visually beautiful, and each features deeply immersive elements that take audiences directly into the experience. We believe opera is for everyone, we like to break boundaries, in short, we are not your grandmother’s opera company!

Our next project

For our next project, a new production of Peter Maxwell Davies’ operatic mystery thriller The Lighthouse, we’re pushing the boundary of the operatic experience through fabric artistry and physical artists literally engrained into the narrative of the piece. They will create movement throughout the sets and setting of the opera, bringing the ocean, fog, and even a sea monster, to vivid life. This design element is integrated deeply into the audience experience in this production, and your support for this campaign will allow us to realize it fully.

What this campaign will support

We’re hoping to raise $15,000 to support this immersive fabric-based physical environment for The Lighthouse. This sum will pay for design fees, and for construction of the fabric art and the technical means to bring it into our production.

Opera Immersion

Last June, we held our first-ever Opera Hackathon, in which teams of creative hackers and makers developed tools for creating the murky, stormy world of The Lighthouse in smells, sounds, and visuals. Funds raised over our goals would support an immersive experience in which theater-goers are brought into the sensory world of the opera the minute they walk through the door of the venue.

In May 2015, for our production of Tarik O’Regan’s opera Heart of Darkness (like The Lighthouse, performed at San Francisco’s Z Space) created an immersive experience in the theater lobby and in the performance space, through the use of a massive art installation, complete with giant elephant tusks, which were then brought into the theater to become a mainstay of the opera’s setting. In this new project, we plan to build on that immersive environment, to go even deeper, as fabric art and use of technology bring our audiences even more directly into the artistic experience.

Thanks for supporting!

Opera Parallèle will continue to forge a path that creates unforgettable impact through art. Please help us widen and extend this path through your support of this project, and by telling your friends!

story:
Summary

In summer of 2014 while filming the Drama TV show for Starz Network “Flesh & Bone” I traveled to Miami to start the writing process for my new EP with my friend writer/producer Chris Rodriguez. The project was then called “HAVE IT ALL”. 

In July 2015, my new dance single mix "Heart After Dark" reached the #6 spot on the Music Weekly pop chart and #1 on the Kings of Spins radio chart in the UK. Thanks to the success of this track I have been working closely with Producer Mark Eddinger (Warner/Interscope/Sire/Universal) on developing the sound direction and planning a solid strategy for my career. Since then Mr. Eddinger has taken over the project and introduced me to world renowned artists, musicians, writers and producers including Grammy Award ™ winning producer and engineer Jason Corsaro (Duran Duran, Madonna), drummer phenomenon Steve Ferrone (Average White Band, Chaka Khan, Eric Clapton, Tom Petty & The Heart Breakers, Duran Duran), singer Curtis King Jr. (Bruce Springsteen, Duran Duran) and co-writers Benjamin Samama and Rob Farren.

With money that I made as a dancer in Phantom of The Opera on Broadway, we started working on a new track, finding a very unique and strong new sound for the project. Unfortunately, financially our project came to a halt. Now I am at a crossroad and need some help with accomplishing the task of completing this project. I have also renamed the project after all the obstacles I have encountered. Today I call this EP “MUST” since no matter what, I always have a relentless conviction that I MUST make it happen and finish my EP. All I know is that the new songs and opportunities I have right now are here for a reason, there for I MUST find a way to do this! 

My main goal is to record this new material, create a PR campaign for it, create a video and mini stage show and get out there. I grew up on stage and I can’t wait to be able to share my love for the arts & music with the world. I hope you can feel my passion and conviction in making this happen, and together with you I KNOW IT CAN!

Anything is possible! You can make it possible!

Risks & Challenges

The only challenge that is standing in my way to complete this project is financial.

Since 2009 I have invested every spare dollar I have earned from performing and working on the Broadway stages on my own career. That money has helped me reach this point and enabled me to build a network and find the amazing group of world renowned artists and business minds I'm working with right now; This talented group of people is so excited about this project have already proved their success in the music & entertainment world. These highly sought after and highly paid individuals have all agreed to come together and make this project happen for pennies on the dollar of what they are usually paid because of their strong belief in me and my music and pure love for it. I can’t fail them now! This is all happening for a reason! Because of their belief and generosity we will be able to create 4-5 new tracks fully produced and mastered to highest of music industry standards. We can then begin the journey of releasing it worldwide and working out my live show and finding international labels and distribution support. My last dance single remix 'HEART AFTER DARK' reached #6 spot on the Music Week UK Commercial Pop Charts and # 1 on the Kings of Spins Radio Chart in the UK market, while also being picked up for licensing worldwide with labels including Lifted House in Scandinavia, Drizzly Music in Germany, Austria and Switzerland, Tommy Boy Entertainment / Deepstate in North and South America and Freaktone in the UK. 

That’s the result on my very first formal campaign. I can't imagine what will happen when we finish this entire EP with these amazing new songs. One thing for sure is the sky is the limit and that I will never quit! We MUST make it happen!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • You can help by getting the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • You can post the video for this campaign on your social media pages like Twitter, FaceBook, Instagram and blogs and help me spread the word, you can talk to other friends who might be interested in music any little mention and kind word will help me propel this into reality.

And that's all there is to it.
story_txt:
Summary

In summer of 2014 while filming the Drama TV show for Starz Network “Flesh & Bone” I traveled to Miami to start the writing process for my new EP with my friend writer/producer Chris Rodriguez. The project was then called “HAVE IT ALL”. 
In July 2015, my new dance single mix "Heart After Dark" reached the #6 spot on the Music Weekly pop chart and #1 on the Kings of Spins radio chart in the UK. Thanks to the success of this track I have been working closely with Producer Mark Eddinger (Warner/Interscope/Sire/Universal) on developing the sound direction and planning a solid strategy for my career. Since then Mr. Eddinger has taken over the project and introduced me to world renowned artists, musicians, writers and producers including Grammy Award ™ winning producer and engineer Jason Corsaro (Duran Duran, Madonna), drummer phenomenon Steve Ferrone (Average White Band, Chaka Khan, Eric Clapton, Tom Petty & The Heart Breakers, Duran Duran), singer Curtis King Jr. (Bruce Springsteen, Duran Duran) and co-writers Benjamin Samama and Rob Farren.
With money that I made as a dancer in Phantom of The Opera on Broadway, we started working on a new track, finding a very unique and strong new sound for the project. Unfortunately, financially our project came to a halt. Now I am at a crossroad and need some help with accomplishing the task of completing this project. I have also renamed the project after all the obstacles I have encountered. Today I call this EP “MUST” since no matter what, I always have a relentless conviction that I MUST make it happen and finish my EP. All I know is that the new songs and opportunities I have right now are here for a reason, there for I MUST find a way to do this!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Caducus in the studio now!

  • Hello! We are Caducus, a metal band from Southern IN/Louisville, KY. It is extremely exciting to announce that we are back in the studio. This time recording our first full length album "Fallen".  This album is truly going to showcase all the hard work we've been putting into our music over the last year. Chuck and I welcomed two new extremely talented musicians into our band, another Chuck and Logan. They have been instrumental to the progress we have made. We are still an independently funded band and we need your help to make this album as incredible as we know it can be. We also want to be able to share it with as many people as we can. That is why we are starting this campaign, to help us meet the production costs, video costs and also the tour expenses of bringing our music to you, our friends and fans. It is very important to us that everyone who loves our music feels that this album is as amazing as it can possibly be. By contributing even a little bit to our campaign, you will be helping us achieve our dream, and hopefully be helping us create something that you will love as much as we will.

What we're asking and what we're offering!

  • We are setting our funding goal at $6,000 to try to cover everything that we will be doing in the next few months. Most of this will be going to production cost of the album, initial cost for cds and online distribution and our new collection of band merchandise. We also need to cover video expense for our very first video that everyone keeps asking for! 
  • We are not asking for your help without offering something for it! We have perks for donations. Starting with simply ordering a pre-sale CD. This actually benefits you more than us, you donate $10 for the pre-sale CD and provide your mailing info. Once the CDs arrive we ship yours out first, and we cover shipping. The perk packages will include more as the donation amount goes up.
  • We are setting up this campaign as a flexible funding campaign, so even if we don't reach our goal your money will still go towards our project. Indiegogo will just raise the % they keep. So let's reach our goal, so more of your donations go towards our album!

Other Ways You Can Help Us!

  • Even if you can't contribute to our goal, you can still help us reach it! Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Use the Indiegogo share tools, share and spread it around Facebook for others to see what we're working on and how they can contribute. Let's get people involved and talking about it, and when we release the album in May we'll have something Everybody will be talking about!

story:
UPDATE: We have addded a GoPro Version!

----------------------------------------

Thank you for watching!

      

What does it do?

 

             

 

It completly changes the way slow motion videos have been done. Welcome the era of 360 degrees self-centered videos.

As easy as 1,2,3: Pop your phone into the Sky Surfer,  swing it around yourself and record it in slow motion: Magic!

Running, skateboarding, hiking, group videos, any situation can be mind-blowing with the Sky Surfer centriphone video rig.

 

 

                 

                  

 

Every detail perfected*:

It is the best: designed to endure every condition, from the highest summits to the hottest desert:

- You can record the person spinning the Sky Surfer and the landscape itself! It's just a matter of changing the attachment in 2 seconds. Sky Surfer is uniquely designed for BOTH orientations.

-  Impact absorbing ABS plastic: Your phone has never been more protected.

-  New design: Sublime aerodynamic shape for super stable on-fly recording.

-  Quick attachment system. Aligned rope (you will be perfectly CENTERED on the video) and handle. Everything carefully crafted.

- Light and strong, very strong. 

 

 

                

 

Timeline

 

The past 2 months has been an endless cycle of design → fabricate → test → break → repeat. The result is the refined prototype you see now. Our goal in the next 2 weeks is to send all the Sky Surfers, so the action can begin!

Handle:

            

                  Tested, analysed and then tested; Because we value perfection:

 

 

             

 

Specifications

Iphone 6 version (Body without handle or rope):

 Width: 5.12 in / 13 cm                                                                                                                  Height: 5.51 in / 14 cm                                                                                                                Lenght: 2.95 in / 7.5 cm                                                                                                            Weight: 2.1 ounces / 55 grams 

             

Any Questions? Contact us!   And the best thing yet:

* If the campaing doesn't reach minimal funding of 20% of goal, production will not be started. No centriphones will be designed and sent.

story:
About Me

I'm a musician,sound artist and curator living in Brighton, England. My material is diverse but usually pivots on the connections between music and non-music and their significance within atmospheric and emotional soundworks. I'm inspired by events in my life and the lives of others, circumstance, understanding, failure of understanding and wide range of psychological and geographical environments.

Earlier this year I was asked by a festival in South Africa if I would like to perform / install at this year's edition. They also expressed keen interest in having Lost Property, the arts collective I co-run and curate within, become involved in the future of the festival. South Africa is fairly neglected in the global experimental / improvised music network and I'm passionate about redressing this. Here's my chance to get moving. It's also personal (see below).

Contributions to this project will fund my international and internal travel, plus accommodation and living costs for my stay, during which I'll be conducting research and meeting artists, venue owners and facilitators to bring this into the realms of possibility. And of course delivering my contribution to the festival as an artist. All being well, 2017/18 could see the fruits of this labour - the start of a lasting creative exchange between the UK and South Africa.

It's Also Personal

To me, South Africa isn't just any other country. There are no secrets surrounding its turbulent history, and this history is something to which I have a personal link. My father was an anti-Apartheid protestor, eventually (so the story goes) being asked to leave the country due to his behaviour in opposition to the government. He came to England and met my mother, and I was born. He died when I was seven, taking a lot of secrets with him. Given the emotional shock that still keeps my mother distanced from her memory of him, I have nobody to really properly talk to about him as, besides my sisters, there are no other Mackenzies living in the UK - they all live in SA.

I've long wondered whether my creative pursuits would get me there, and now it looks like they could. I plan to spend some of my time there seeing famiy, learning about my father's life, seeing the places he grew up and visited, and through the experience learning about myself, attempting to fill the gap that I've always felt. The prospect of going back there potentially every year as a result of the success of the exchange is something I could never have imagined.

Lost Property

I co-founded Lost Property to organise the crtically acclaimed Fort Process festival in 2014. Since then we have been passionately active in creating memorable events in the outer reaches of music and visual / performance art. These have included a concert to celebrate the 80th birthday of contemporary composer Terry Riley, and an event to mark 100 years since the emergence of the Dada art movement.

Whilst continiung our domestic events which promote the work of the established and emerging practitioners alike, we're working to expand our international connections and opportunities for learning. Our development in these areas is exciting and aims to connect communities and inspire minds in the name of sonic and visual expression.

I'm thrilled to be presented with a chance for Lost Property to become involved in such a project. Any extra funds raised will contribute to future visits to SA and the costs involved with bringing our visions to the country, and theirs back to us.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially to this, please don't worry. It's not in everyone's interest and I know money can be an issue for many people (increasingly so, it seems). Passing this on to someone who would be keen can help, so can the more magical practice of well wishing, and beams of supportive energy.

story:
Hello music fans and friends of Hard N' Heavy Radio

Mike Bertoli created Hard N' heavy Radio in 2011, being joined by DJ Big John as co-owner in 2012. Their leadership has kept the station running with all of the expenses of royalties, servers, internet costs, repairs and such coming out of their own pockets.

Since 2011, the station has been able to exist as a labor of love, playing both popular and independent artists while providing opportunities for up and coming DJs to hone their radio skills. Over the years we have forged a family of DJs that work hard to bring you a large variety of music while providing entertaining programming to listeners in over 75 countries.

Now we need your support to continue on air.

Our operating expenses have significantly increased.  We pay royalties on the music we play for you and as our listener base has increased so has the costs of bringing our large library of music to our audience. 

Our annual budget is small but it has become more than Mike can do all on his own.We need a minimum of $1500 dollars to continue at the level we are at to run for another year. We are hoping that with your help, we can do this together.

If friends and fans can each give just a little, together we can make sure that Hard N' Heavy Radio can continue to play the best in hard rock and heavy metal as well as rising independent stars.

Please help us, a little goes a long way and together we can keep a gem of a station on the air for another year.

Thank you,

Bryce Van Patten - DJ Man In Black - Hard N' Heavy Radio

story:
Kaos Skola Festival 22.+23. July 2016
                                                    Horn - Sweden

A few words about the next Kaos Skola Festival :) All of those who joined us last year, have an idea of what to expect already, but we are hoping to see many new faces.

A bit about us: We are a small family, we live in the beautiful South of Sweden and we simply thought that we should use the freedom and space for something amazing and one of a kind, to bring creative people together and simply enjoy a good time. Music had to play a big role, it should be family-friendly, rather hyppyish, and some good food (100 % vegan) was on the plan…and that's exactly what we did. Our Expectations were totally topped, the Kaos Skola Festival 2015 was absolutely brilliant, wonderful and we can't resist repeating it.

All that not just for fun but for a good cause? Impossibe - nah…totally possible! We donated all profits to 2 charitable causes (an amazing 1200,-). And this will, of course, also be the case at the next festival. Maybe we can even top the amount? If you want to enter your organisation as a recipient of the profits, feel free to get in touch!

About the location: We have a yard of 5000 square meters, which offers a lot of space for many activities. It is quiet but not completely cut off. A 3 minute walk gets you to the lake for a nice swim.

Accommodation: Camping in our yard, on the neighbour's lawn, at the lake or in the forest. The choice is yours. We will also improve the sanitary facilities but please don't expect 5 stars ;)

Also: Dogs will be present, be prepared.

And: Kids until 12 yrs are free!


                                                          *** Music ***

 *** MATZE ROSSI *** JAWKNEE MUSIC *** TIGERYOUTH *** JOHN ALLEN***

                    *** MARCEL GEIN *** MATES *** AND:I *** CHAPLIN ***

*** ANDREAS LIEBERT *** CATCH: firefly *** NICOLE CARTER CASH ***

                        *** STEVEN& STANLEY *** FREDDY FUDD PUCKER ***

                   ***LAUREN TUFNELL *** PHIL HUTZON *** *** BEN BARRITT ***

                                                 *** HERR LEHMANN ***

                                         *** ANDISOLO *** How I left ***

                           Kaos Skola Festival 22.+23. Juli 2016
                                               Horn - Sweden

... ein paar Worte zum nächsten Kaos Skola Festival :) Diejenigen, die letztes Jahr dabei waren wissen ja schon in etwa was es zu erwarten gibt, wir hoffen aber auch auf viele neue Gesichter.

Erstmal zu uns: Wir sind eine kleine Familie, wohnen im schönen Südschweden und haben uns irgendwann gedacht, dass man das Stückchen Freiheit und Platz nutzen sollte um was Verrücktes zu tun, interessante kreative Menschen zusammen zu bringen und einfach eine gute Zeit zu verleben. *** Musik *** sollte eine grosse Rolle spielen, es sollte familienfreundlich sein, eher hippiemässig, noch dazu war gutes Essen geplant ( 100% vegan )... tja, also haben wir das einfach mal gemacht, unsere Erwartungen wurden auch noch total übertroffen, das Kaos Skola Festival 2015 war absolut genial, wunderschön und wir können garnicht anders als es zu wiederholen.

Und dann noch was Gutes tun? Geht nicht- klar, geht! Wir haben im letzten Jahr den kompletten Gewinn an 2 gemeinnützige Vereine gespendet ( immerhin 1200,- ), das wird auch dieses Jahr der Fall sein, und vielleicht wird es dann ja auch ein wenig mehr. Vereine dürfen sich auch gerne bei uns melden, für dieses Jahr sind noch nicht alle Begünstigten ausgewählt.

Zur Umgebung: Wir haben ein Grundstück von 5000qm2 was auf jeden Fall Platz für einige Aktivitäten lässt, es ist ruhig gelegen, aber nicht völlig abgeschieden, in 3 Minuten ist man beim See wo man wundervoll baden kann.

Unterbringung: Entweder auf unserem Grundstück oder auf Nachbars Weide zelten ist möglich, man kann auch am See zelten oder im Wald, das steht jedem frei. Wir werden auch die sanitären Anlagen etwas verbessern, man darf aber dennoch keine 5 Sterne erwarten ;)

Sonst: es werden einige Hunde anwesend sein, da muss man mit zurecht kommen :)
Und übrigens: Kinder bis 12 Jahre feiern umsonst mit!

Music had to play a big role, it should be family-friendly, rather hyppyish, and some good food (100 % vegan) was on the plan…and that's exactly what we did. Our Expectations were totally topped, the Kaos Skola Festival 2015 was absolutely brilliant, wonderful and we can't resist repeating it.All that not just for fun but for a good cause? Impossibe - nah…totally possible! We donated all profits to 2 charitable causes (an amazing 1200,-). And this will, of course, also be the case at the next festival. Maybe we can even top the amount? If you want to enter your organisation as a recipient of the profits, feel free to get in touch!About the location: We have a yard of 5000 square meters, which offers a lot of space for many activities. It is quiet but not completely cut off. A 3 minute walk gets you to the lake for a nice swim.Accommodation: Camping in our yard, on the neighbour's lawn, at the lake or in the forest. The choice is yours. We will also improve the sanitary facilities but please don't expect 5 stars ;)Also: Dogs will be present, be prepared.And: Kids until 12 yrs are free!                                                          *** Music *** *** MATZE ROSSI *** JAWKNEE MUSIC *** TIGERYOUTH *** JOHN ALLEN***                    *** MARCEL GEIN *** MATES *** AND:I *** CHAPLIN ****** ANDREAS LIEBERT *** CATCH: firefly *** NICOLE CARTER CASH ***                        *** STEVEN& STANLEY *** FREDDY FUDD PUCKER ***                   ***LAUREN TUFNELL *** PHIL HUTZON *** *** BEN BARRITT ***                                                 *** HERR LEHMANN ***                                         *** ANDISOLO *** How I left ***                           Kaos Skola Festival 22.+23. Juli 2016                                               Horn - Sweden ... ein paar Worte zum nächsten Kaos Skola Festival :) Diejenigen, die letztes Jahr dabei waren wissen ja schon in etwa was es zu erwarten gibt, wir hoffen aber auch auf viele neue Gesichter.Erstmal zu uns: Wir sind eine kleine Familie, wohnen im schönen Südschweden und haben uns irgendwann gedacht, dass man das Stückchen Freiheit und Platz nutzen sollte um was Verrücktes zu tun, interessante kreative Menschen zusammen zu bringen und einfach eine gute Zeit zu verleben. *** Musik *** sollte eine grosse Rolle spielen, es sollte familienfreundlich sein, eher hippiemässig, noch dazu war gutes Essen geplant ( 100% vegan )... tja, also haben wir das einfach mal gemacht, unsere Erwartungen wurden auch noch total übertroffen, das Kaos Skola Festival 2015 war absolut genial, wunderschön und wir können garnicht anders als es zu wiederholen.Und dann noch was Gutes tun? Geht nicht- klar, geht! Wir haben im letzten Jahr den kompletten Gewinn an 2 gemeinnützige Vereine gespendet ( immerhin 1200,- ), das wird auch dieses Jahr der Fall sein, und vielleicht wird es dann ja auch ein wenig mehr. Vereine dürfen sich auch gerne bei uns melden, für dieses Jahr sind noch nicht alle Begünstigten ausgewählt.Zur Umgebung: Wir haben ein Grundstück von 5000qm2 was auf jeden Fall Platz für einige Aktivitäten lässt, es ist ruhig gelegen, aber nicht völlig abgeschieden, in 3 Minuten ist man beim See wo man wundervoll baden kann.Unterbringung: Entweder auf unserem Grundstück oder auf Nachbars Weide zelten ist möglich, man kann auch am See zelten oder im Wald, das steht jedem frei. Wir werden auch die sanitären Anlagen etwas verbessern, man darf aber dennoch keine 5 Sterne erwarten ;)Sonst: es werden einige Hunde anwesend sein, da muss man mit zurecht kommen :)Und übrigens: Kinder bis 12 Jahre feiern umsonst mit!

story:
Aloha! Thank you for taking the time to visit this campaign!

My  name is Jasmine Crowe and I'm a singer and musician from Hawaii now living in sunny California. :) I grew up surrounded by music starting on violin at age three and began writing my own songs on piano and guitar as a teen. I started recording music at a young age and learned the ropes of music production as I grew more experienced with songwriting and with the music industry after moving to Los Angeles.
I've self produced all of my releases so far which you can check out here:
http://jasminecrowemusic.com
http://itunes.com/jasminecrowe
Recently I've been featured in Music Connection Magazine, as the SingerUniverse Vocalist of the month, TAXI artist of the month and won several songwriting awards, placing in this year's American Songwriting Awards, UK Songwriting Contest and USA Songwriting Competition.
All of the support I've received for my music has meant so much to me! I love painting with sound and strive to make art and write meaningful songs that connect with people all around the world.
As an independent artist, all my songs are written, played, arranged and produced in my home studio by yours truly and with my partner and drummer Josh Carey. The only aspect of the production we don't do is mixing and mastering. As a musician, I pour my heart and soul into every song. It takes time, practice and dedication to the craft. Musicians don't become musicians for the money, we do it as a labor of love first and foremost and as a way to connect with others. Music is food for the soul.
Because of streaming and the accessibility of music on the internet, it is getting more and more difficult to make a living as an independent musician and songwriter. The gift I get as a musician is the the connection made with someone from a song that touched their heart.
With your help I'll be able to finish these new songs and continue making music to share with the world! 
THE PERKS!
It costs around $500 to mix one song and $200 to master. For the production of my new songs I need to raise around $1,500 for the three songs I have yet to mix and $600 to master. If I do not reach my goal, all funds raised will still go towards production costs and will help me immensely!
I deeply appreciate every donation so as a thank you, here are some perks!
$2 - You'll get a download of my newest single DEADBEAT BOYFRIEND coming out this month!


$5 - You'll get a download of DEADBEAT BOYFRIEND + a personalized signed thank you card!
$10 - Song Downloads
You'll get downloads of all my current single releases + the new songs to be released on my physical EP.
$20 - Song Downloads + Cover Song!
You'll get downloads of all my current single releases + the new songs to be released and I'll perform your favorite cover in a video!
$25 + $5 shipping - Copy of NEW EP Signed!
For $25 + shipping you'll get a signed physical copy of my EP once it's released + immediate downloads of all current single releases!
$50 - Signed EP + Song Downloads + T Shirt!

As a thank you for your contribution you'll get all of my songs as downloads, a signed copy of my EP mailed to you, and you'll get a T shirt with your favorite JC album art design!

Choices include the JC Music Logo T, Phoenix Rising, Purple Heart, or Lightning In A Bottle design!

Sizes include Women's or Men's S, M, L, XL

$100 - Signed New Album + Song Downloads + Cover Song + T Shirt!

As a huge thank you from the bottom of my heart, you'll get the Mahalo package!

-A signed personalized thank you card

-All of Jasmine's songs as downloads

-Jasmine's new EP Release signed and mailed to you!

-A video of the cover song of your choice!

-2 TShirts with the design of your choice (Women's & Men's Sizes S, M, L, XL) OR one T Shirt and a mug!

Logo Design

Phoenix Rising Design

Lightning In A Bottle Design

Purple Heart Design

Other Ways You Can Help

I know not everyone has the financial ability to donate, but there are other ways you can help! Share this campaign with your friends and family on Facebook, spread the word on Twitter, watch my videos on youtube, and if you like what you hear, Like my FB page! 

http://youtube.com/jasminecrowemusic

http://facebook.com/jasminecrowemusic

Mahalo, xoxo Jasmine

story:
Off record label:

Since 2007, Off has released more than 110 physical and digital musical projects.

On the top of another 15 coming releases, this year sees 4 main big projects which need money to finish the recordings, mixing, mastering, printing and promoting.

To be able to bring those amazing musics to more people and in the best possible way, Off needs more funds than the previous years, therefore this crowdfunding. 

 What we need:

 3500 euros in order to finish some of the recordings, some masterings and above all to help promoting the Artists.

1: Warped Dreamer: a quartet with Arve Henriksen, Stian westerhus, Jozef Dumoulin and Teun Verbruggen

2: Aerobe: a quartet with Andrew Claes (Stuff - Brzzvil), Adriaan Van de Velde, Owen Biddle (The Roots) and Zach Danziger (too many to write, see here http://www.drummerworld.com/drummers/Zach_Danziger.html )

3: Drexel: an electro duo with Markest Tate and Laurent Stelleman

4: Dim Lighting: a avant jazz trio from chicago with musicians from the Tortoise scene

 Why you:

4 precious projects that are too good not to arrive to your ears in the best possible manner. 

Off is becoming a well known label trying to bring original music from all over the world but still has to battle more and more against streaming and illegal downloads more and more.

That's the reason we need you to support us even more this year

 Be a part of Off:

Raising funds will help Off to overcome better the non stop shrinking cd market by bringing beautiful finished objects and by doing the proper promotion to help the Artists to have a better coverage of their music.

In helping us and them, you will be a part of their futur success.

 If you cannot help with a direct contribution:

Pass the word, help Off to become ever more well known all over by asking your friends to help and by asking them to visit the Off site to have a better understanding of what we do:
www.off-recordlabel.blogspot.com

story:
I Set The Sea On Fire : Studio Album Fund

We're trying to raise money so we can record our debut studio album in January. We've raised around 2 thirds of the money needed, but really need help funding the rest. After the success of Tastes Like Funk, we really want to bring you more music to the same standard we're really happy with. 

What we're about...

We're I Set The Sea On Fire (Billy, Pete, Meg & Josh). We've got the tracks together to record our first full length album, and we're really proud of the songs. We just need a little help funding the recording. 

All the money raised will go towards paying for a studio for a week. As some of you know, this can be very expensive and on top of university & living costs, we just don't see it being possible in the near future.

Please dont think your moneys going to waste, we've been a band for around 5 years, and we are extremely passionate about music, and take the band very seriously. Over then years, we've opened for various successful bands, most notably Buzzcocks. We've also played many festivals & prestigious venues around the UK. 

If you've got the money, we'd really appreciate anything you can give, but if not we're musicians, we know what its like to be skint. Thanks for all your support so far, and we wont let you down. 

Billy, Pete, Josh & Meg (ISTSOF) x

story:
I am a world renowned square dance caller and singer/songwriter, calling square dances since 1972 and writing songs since 1981 and was nominated by Tennessee Songwriters Association International for their 2015 Horizon award as a songwriter and won the 2011 Ozzie Awards Most Entertaining Caller award.

The original songs for this cd are co-written by myself and several top Nashville songwriters.  My singing/songwriting and square dance calling passion is to bring great lyrics and great melodies and great musicianship creating tapping toes and smiling faces with my baritone voice on great musical recordings.  Your generous contribution will be instrumental to bringing hours of fun to your ears and the ears of many others.  Tell your friends.  Post this project on Twitter & Facebook via the share tabs on this project site.

Preview all 13 songs at www.newsongsbymike.com

Check out the perks!  How does a private 1 hour concert sound?  Entertain your club or a handful of close friends.  We have several contribution award levels.  Check 'em out!

People who know me know this project will be a great success.  They have my prior cds which contain 3 songs which simply will not die.  Bradley The Brown Nosed Reindeer, originally released in 1992 is still being played by Dr. Demento and recently resurfaced on YouTube as one of the 20 best humorous songs of the 2015 Christmas holiday season.

Big John (The Path Out Back) is a parody I wrote about pushing over an outhouse at midnight on Halloween, a fictional story based on many spoken personal stories I've heard is still being constantly requested in live performance.

Close Enough To Touch, a love song I co-wrote and recorded has been picked up several times by publishers and newbie singers at Tennessee Songwriters Pitch-A-Pro nights.

You Changed The Stakes, a song appearing now to be a definite add to this new cd and currently available for your listening preview at www.newsongsbymike.com has also been picked up many times at Pitch-A-Pro nights.

13 songs x $750 per song estimate = $9750

1000 cds with wallet style jackets & photo book + postage X $5 each = $5000

You may call me on my mobile if you wish to speak to me personally.  If you get a voicemail message beginning "You have reached the redneck hotline..." just leave a message and I will return your call as soon as possible.  480-204-0110

You can also email me at arizonacaller@gmail.com and check out my comprehensive web site at www.arizonacaller.com or www.azcaller.com

story:
#DreamTeam

The Dream Team is the cohesion of singer/songwriter Alicia Sky, director Brad Etter, and producer/manager Julia Barbie.


  • Valley Girl Anthem is a fun pop culture song I wrote about girls in LA & The Valley, and the funny things we say. I happen to be a Valley Girl and spent many of my 8 Angeleno years living in Sherman Oaks.  The song pokes fun at today’s fame & selfie obsessed society in a playful way. I teamed up with my producer friend Anton (Mannton) to collaborate and came up with a catchy dance pop song you may potentially hear in West Hollywood clubs like The Abbey or even featured in the star-studded reality shows of Young Hollywood. - Alicia Sky


Director of Photography & Camera: " In order to capture the shots the director wants, we need the best DP possible for him to work with, along with the right camera to follow Brad's vision for Valley Girl Anthem." - JuliaBarbie


  • Valley Girl Anthem is a bright, colorful video set in the 1960s Valley, hybridizing 60s style with modern fashion. It follows a girl (Alicia) who has a strong ambition to rise into many forms of fame - singer, actress, model, etc. Every morning, she is motivated to realize these dreams by looking at a vision board over her bed. By the end of the video, she has become every single one of her vision board images - the singer on stage, the actress strutting the red carpet, and the high fashion model featured in a big campaign. The verses are a sequence of comedic, slapstick-y scenes that contrast nicely with the sophisticated bridge and final chorus, in which Alicia has risen to a new level of herself but still retains the valley girl within. - Brad Etter


  • Locations: "As the producer of this project I feel it's extremely stressful to both the artist and crew to shoot guerrilla style. We need the money for location fees, permits, and insurance to do this safely and do it right. " - JuliaBarbie

  • Hair/Makeup/and Wardrobe have such an impact on "Valley Girl Anthem". The countless different looks on the artist and extras in the video are everything. We need a min of 2 MUAH and ideally a wardrobe stylist to put together the outfits for each scene for the artist.


What We Need

  • We need to raise a minimum of $3000-5000 to make this vision come to life.

  • This is where the money is going: Director of Photography, lenses, equipment & camera rental, permits, locations, insurance, lighting, crew, hair/makeup, wardrobe, and craft services.

  • Extra money raised will go towards marketing the video to gain maximum exposure.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, here are other ways you can help:

  • Share this campaign on Facebook!

  • Follow The Dream Team on Facebook

  • Download Alicia's songs on iTunes

  • Have a possible hot spot location space to donate Contact Producer JuliaBarbie.

#DreamTeam Our Latest Projects:


We Found Love" Covered by Alicia Sky


"Beautiful Disaster" (Original) - Alicia Sky

story:
Short Summary

The International Bohém Ragtime & Jazz Festival is based in Kecskemét, Hungary. The festival has been run by award-winning Bohém Ragtime Jazz Band and its leader, Tamás Ittzés since 1992 thus we are celebrating our 25th jubilee in 2016. We invite some of the very best Ragtime and Classic Jazz performers of the world every year and this year we have a special selection of those who had been the most popular over the previous 24 years. (Performers include singer Catherine Russell from New York, the Bratislava Hot Serenaders from Slovakia, "Queen of Ragtime" Mimi Blais from Canada, a 6-piece Festival All Stars (of Dutch, French, Norwegian and Hungarian jazz musicians) and two of the top jazz bands of Hungary: Hot Jazz Band and the host Bohém Ragtime Jazz Band.)

The event was the very first of all jazz festivals to provide live streaming for the entire festival in 2009 and has been offering this free service since then. We want to continue this tradition but our festival budget is too limited to offer it this year, too. However, with your help it could be easily done again and we would LOVE to show you and other jazz lovers one of the greatest and friendliest festivals (labels of such have been very common by both performers and audience members).

What We Need & What You Get

The overall cost for recording and streaming the whole festival (including the DVD production, sound and film editing, composers' rights, cover design etc.) is about 2000 EUR (about 2200 US dollars). It's not much (Hungary is still a cheap country compared to many others) but it is beyond the festival's budget this year. (FYI: the festival's complete budget without the online streaming is 35,000 EUR / over 38,000 USD.) We'd love to provide this service free for as many as possible but we need to secure ourselves in advance that's why we need your help. If we gain 1500 EUR from Indiegogo we can gain the rest from DVD sales on the spot.

You can contribute amounts from 20 to 100 EUR and besides providing the webcast, we'll send you recordings and stuff. You can even get the WHOLE festival recorded so you don't have to watch it live.

If we do not reach our goal of 1500 EUR then we take whatever we gain and use it for the webcast. In this case we are losing money but we are hoping for the best and trust that this will not be the scenario.

The Impact

People who watched our live streaming webcasts in previous years were raving about it. Since Hungary is far for many and since the auditorium holds only 600 people, live streaming is the only way to share this great music and the ambiance of the festival with many jazz lovers. We hope that this year you'll be one of those who are joining us from their living-rooms or even beds to enjoy some GREAT music.

Some comments of our earlier live streamings:

"I thoroughly enjoyed watching the festival live from my home in St. Louis! The quality of performers and bands was marvelous. Thank you so much for making this service available."

"Unbelievable. It is truly a thrill to be in San Anselmo California, USA and listen to wonderful live CLASSICAL AMERICAN MUSIC being played in Hungary. This is utterly marvelous."

Risks & Challenges

The risk is that we will not reach our goal of gaining 1500 EUR fund. Then we have to pay for the difference but we are very much hoping that you and other ragtime and jazz lovers will help us in providing this free  service for the worldwide jazz community. At the same time it is a challenge to gain the necessary amount in such a short time but again, we trust that you like and appreciate our work. Our budget only could be finalized in the very last minute that's why advertising some extra features of the festival (such as online streaming) have not been taken care of earlier.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you like our goal and would be happy to see the festival in your home but cannot contribute financially, please, notify your friends and if you use any of the internet social media, use the Indiegogo share tools! Thank you very much for your contribution of any way!
story_txt:
Short Summary The International Bohém Ragtime & Jazz Festival is based in Kecskemét, Hungary. The festival has been run by award-winning Bohém Ragtime Jazz Band and its leader, Tamás Ittzés since 1992 thus we are celebrating our 25th jubilee in 2016. We invite some of the very best Ragtime and Classic Jazz performers of the world every year and this year we have a special selection of those who had been the most popular over the previous 24 years. (Performers include singer Catherine Russell from New York, the Bratislava Hot Serenaders from Slovakia, "Queen of Ragtime" Mimi Blais from Canada, a 6-piece Festival All Stars (of Dutch, French, Norwegian and Hungarian jazz musicians) and two of the top jazz bands of Hungary: Hot Jazz Band and the host Bohém Ragtime Jazz Band.)
The event was the very first of all jazz festivals to provide live streaming for the entire festival in 2009 and has been offering this free service since then. We want to continue this tradition but our festival budget is too limited to offer it this year, too. However, with your help it could be easily done again and we would LOVE to show you and other jazz lovers one of the greatest and friendliest festivals (labels of such have been very common by both performers and audience members).
What We Need & What You Get
 The overall cost for recording and streaming the whole festival (including the DVD production, sound and film editing, composers' rights, cover design etc.) is about 2000 EUR (about 2200 US dollars). It's not much (Hungary is still a cheap country compared to many others) but it is beyond the festival's budget this year. (FYI: the festival's complete budget without the online streaming is 35,000 EUR / over 38,000 USD.) We'd love to provide this service free for as many as possible but we need to secure ourselves in advance that's why we need your help. If we gain 1500 EUR from Indiegogo we can gain the rest from DVD sales on the spot.
You can contribute amounts from 20 to 100 EUR and besides providing the webcast, we'll send you recordings and stuff. You can even get the WHOLE festival recorded so you don't have to watch it live.
If we do not reach our goal of 1500 EUR then we take whatever we gain and use it for the webcast. In this case we are losing money but we are hoping for the best and trust that this will not be the scenario.
The Impact
 People who watched our live streaming webcasts in previous years were raving about it. Since Hungary is far for many and since the auditorium holds only 600 people, live streaming is the only way to share this great music and the ambiance of the festival with many jazz lovers. We hope that this year you'll be one of those who are joining us from their living-rooms or even beds to enjoy some GREAT music.
Some comments of our earlier live streamings:
"I thoroughly enjoyed watching the festival live from my home in St. Louis! The quality of performers and bands was marvelous. Thank you so much for making this service available."
"Unbelievable. It is truly a thrill to be in San Anselmo California, USA and listen to wonderful live CLASSICAL AMERICAN MUSIC being played in Hungary. This is utterly marvelous."
Risks & Challenges
 The risk is that we will not reach our goal of gaining 1500 EUR fund. Then we have to pay for the difference but we are very much hoping that you and other ragtime and jazz lovers will help us in providing this free  service for the worldwide jazz community. At the same time it is a challenge to gain the necessary amount in such a short time but again, we trust that you like and appreciate our work. Our budget only could be finalized in the very last minute that's why advertising some extra features of the festival (such as online streaming) have not been taken care of earlier.
Other Ways You Can Help
 If you like our goal and would be happy to see the festival in your home but cannot contribute financially, please, notify your friends and if you use any of the internet social media, use the Indiegogo share tools! Thank you very much for your contribution of any way!

story: I am raising money to record, release and produce a 12 song CD called "Beauty Beyond Borders". In this CD we go through the various epoch of music ranging from classical music to jazz and to finally Caribbean/Latino fusion. Six of the songs are from the classical repertoire and the other six songs are written by me. This is the first time I am professionally releasing my written work. The funds are being used to pay for the preparation, promotion and release of the CD. I have been singing in the subways for the past 10 years.I would like to take my act above ground so that I can reach more people. I am honored and blessed by the support and positive feed back I receive from the travelers in the New York City subways. I want to share my gifts to the world. I've been investing in my career since the age of 15.  It's very expensive when there are so many specialized people you have to pay. So far I've invested $650 towards this project. I can't do it alone however, I need your help because I want to do this well.  There are perks to your various contributions. Your support will help produce a high quality project. In life we can tune into many soundtracks. Support this soundtrack, it will take you higher.

story:
In 2013 I started my journey as an artist, I recorded my first ep with the help of some of my friends and released it in March 2014. The support and enthuasiam that was shown towards the ep gave me the opportunity to play Bunbury Festival in the city I am based in (Cincinnati,Ohio) I consider myself to be extremely fortunate to have gotten that opportunity, I recently also got the opportunity to work with a couple producers I have looked up to as an artist in Nashville, the Producers are Matthew Hoopes (Relient K) and Mel Washington (formerly in All Get Out). I am in need of your help to make this dream a reality. The producers are willing to work with me because like you they believe in the songs. I am positive that with your help and support we will be able to continue on this exciting journey.

Here is the budget breakdown of where the $5000 would be going.


(Ep Recording= $3600)


Engineering/studio costs: $200/day x 5 days = $1000

Mixing & Mastering: $150/song x 5= $750

Drumming: $100/song x 3= $300

Producing: 300/song x 3 = $900

Album Artwork: $200

CD Duplication: $450



(Rewards/Delivery: $1020)



T-shirt Printing: 50= $470

Posters printing: 20= $120

Care Package 10x15=$150

USPS Delivery costs= $400



Total= $4,620


Indiegogo 8% of goal= $369.60


Grand Total: $4,989

story:
Hello!

Let me introduce myself!

Vadim Tcherkashin aka Kalilaskov AS : 

http://www.kalilaskov.as

https://soundcloud.com/kalilaskov-as

I am started to produce my own music 15 years ago, after i moved with my family to Israel from past USSR in 1996.
After very short time, when my music been released on some good EU Psychedelic labels, i got very fast promoted with my music and early got my first international bookings in 2004.
It's was amazing  10-11 years of non stop parties and travelings all over the world!
Big thanks to all people, friends worldwide who danced my music and and showed support all this time!
At the moment i am again back to Israel, where i am happy with what i am have and i am back again to write music after 3 years of delay in production.
(some changes in life and personal stuff)...
-- It's is a bit hard to back to psy scene after such long delay,but all is possible, because music never die and it is soundtrack of your mind!
As well i want to try new styles and directions in such deep music world!
Psytrance music production was really good basement for me in production, i am more than sure ill continue with psy and other styles of EDM music.
It is the best feeling in life to play your own creation in front of thousand people! =-
Music industry not really bring big amounts of money to artists this days, specially for PsyTrance producers..."
As i see lot of new stuff came out for to make really quality electronic music.
So i am started to build new studio to continue to make people happy with my music.
Almost all from equipment i need i have already : just one monster brain is missing in my small home studio.  

Virus TI Desktop - Synth


and i ask for some help from my friends, fans and all electronic music lovers!

here is some bio of me in case you dont know me by my past music releases!


English Bio :

www.kalilaskov.as

Owner at "Ohm Ganesh Pro"

www.ohmganeshpro.com

He was born in the USSR near Chernobyl and after the infamous atomic disaster in the region he moved to Israel with his family.

In Israel Vadim fell in love with psychedelic trance and eventually decided to pursue his own solo project. Around the same time the nickname Kalilaskov first appeared. Initially it was only a name used by Vadim's close friends to address him (translated as "the kind one" from Belorussian). But later Vadim adopted this name as his permanent alias and added AS to it, which stands for Atomic Station. Thereby Kalilaskov AS was officially born.

It did not take long for the global psytrance community to take notice of the young musician and his unique music. The very first release came out on the French Nabi Records and after that multiple compilation releases followed on some of the best labels in the world.

Kalilaskov's best of came out in 2008 on Digital Drugs Coalition under the title "Killas"

and incorporated Vadim's most renowned compilation tracks. Today Kalilaskov AS is signed to the world famous Russian-Australian giant Blitz Studios and his first full length solo album is to come out very soon!!!

At present Kalilaskov AS is playing all over the world at various indoor and outdoor events, club parties and festivals! Catch him near you :)

Stay tuned!

-----

Hebrew Bio :

www.kalilaskov.as

Vadim - Kalilaskov

הוא נולד בברית המועצות ליד צ'רנוביל ולאחר האסון האטומי 
הידוע לשמצה באזור הוא עלה לישראל עם משפחתו
1996

בישראל ואדים התאהב בטראנס פסיכדלי והחליט לבסוף להמשיך פרויקט הסולו שלו

בערך באותו הזמן את הכינוי "Kalilaskov"
הופיע לראשונה

בהתחלה זה היה רק שם בשימוש על ידי חברים הקרובים של ואדים לפנות אליו (בתרגום כמו "סוג אחד" מהביילורוסית)

-----
Russian Bio :

Kalilaskov AS

Произрастая из глубин израильского андеграунда, Kalilaskov AS является одной из восходящих молодых фигур на психоделическом небосклоне. Рожденный в России, он перебрался в Израиль в 90-х годах, где и проживает по сей день. В 1998 году он очень быстро увлёкся электронной музыкой, когда и продемонстрировал публике свои первые психоделические эксперименты. Проект Kalilaskov AS стартовал в 2000 году и в течение 5 лет масса времени и сил было затрачено на создание оригинального звучания и синтез немыслимых эффектов. Его треки выходили на сборниках Nabi Records, Hypnotica Records, Psyshark Records, Moonsun Records.

story:
Short Summary

Phil Hayden founded the 1st known handbell choir in Colombia in 1984, at the Colombia-Venezuela Institute in Medellin, a four year college. In August they celebrate 30 years of ringing, and for this occasion, Phil wants to add 2 octaves of choir chimes to their set of bells, and to allow them to start a children's chime choir.

What We Need & What You Get

The goal is a two octave set of choir chimes, mallets for the entire four octave handbell choir, and assorted replacements parts for the Schulmerich bells.  Contributions of at least $50 will get a handwritten thank you note from a current ringer, and $100 contributions will get a thank you card signed by the entire current handbell choir. All gifts, though, will be gratefully appreciated!

The Impact

Medellin, Colombia, has suffered tremendous violence through the past several decades, yet the resiliant populace has a deep, deep love for music, both classical, sacred and Colombian folk music. Public concerts by the Handbell Choir at the Adventist University of Colombia feature both classical, sacred and Colombian folk music, arranged for bells. It is loved by all who hear this special ensemble.

Risks & Challenges

Phil's goal is to purchase these chimes, mallets, and replacement bell parts, even if the campaign's goal is not reached. However, contributions received will reduce his personal indebtedness in this endeavor.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please Share our campaign on Facebook, or other social media, even if you can't contribute financially.  Thanks so much!
