story:
Breve reseña

ENG.-The “Ensamble Moxos” is about to recording their fifth CD that will bear the title “La Cosecha” (The harvest), with the subtitle “Recogiendo nuestros frutos” (Reaping our fruits), referring to the ten year career, which has combined its artistic activity with scholarly research, rescuing thousands of old scores from the missionary era that were scattered about the most hidden recesses of the jungle and pampas of Moxos and other works of the oral tradition that the ensemble revive, appealing to their creative and interpretive resources. All of these are included in their records and performances. 

ESP.- El "Ensamble Moxos" está a punto de grabar su quinto disco que llevará el título"La Cosecha", con el subtítulo "Recogiendo Nuestros frutos", refiriéndose a la carrera de diez años, que ha combinado su actividad artística con la investigación académica, el rescate de miles de viejas cuentas de la época misionera que fueron esparcidos por los rincones más ocultos de la selva y las pampas de Moxos y otras obras de la tradición oral que el conjunto revivir, apelando a sus recursos creativos e interpretativos. Todos ellos están incluidos en sus registros y actuaciones.

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

ENG.- We need to fund the costs of recording, editing and design of our 5th album, besides the costs that need to get 7000 copies to sell and so support the social project of the school of Music in San Ignacio de Moxos.
This contribution not only allows us to witness to our culture and identity, but also to retain the free musical education of over 200 children and youth receive in the School each year.

We offer exclusive perks, that transport us to the experience of the living culture and magic of the Baroque Missions in San Ignacio of Moxos. Links for download our  music, as well as original souvenirs,  Custom certificates thanks, CDs and much more.

ESP.- Tenemos que financiar los costos de la grabación, edición y diseño de nuestro quinto álbum, además de los costos que deben obtener 7.000 copias para vender y así apoyar el proyecto social de la escuela de Música de San Ignacio de Moxos. Esta contribución no sólo nos permite dar testimonio de nuestra cultura e identidad, sino también para retener la educación musical gratuita de más de 200 niños y jóvenes reciben en la Escuela cada año.

Ofrecemos Perks exclusivos, que nos transportan a la experiencia de la cultura viva y la magia de las misiones barrocas en San Ignacio de Moxos. Enlaces para descargar nuestra música, así como recuerdos originales, certificados de agradecimiento personalizados, CDs y mucho más.


El impacto

ENG. With the sale of their albums, the “Ensamble Moxos” sustains the Music School of San Ignacio, where about 200 children and teenagers from low-income, mostly indigenous, receive free musical education. In fact, the ensemble is composed of the very young teachers of the School and its most outstanding students. 
The moxeños have maintained for centuries its authentic and extraordinary, hidden and ignored cultural events. Twenty years ago when we witnessed the latest generation of musicians, violinists and singers School of Music and the Assembly Moxos emerged through them several generations of musicians are being trained and their music, their culture is rescued and reinvigorated. The moxeños today write their own history with music and have a place in the world.


ESP.- Con la venta de sus discos, el "Ensamble Moxos" sustenta la Escuela de Música de San Ignacio, donde mas de 200 niños y adolescentes de bajos recursos, en su mayoría indígenas, reciben educación musical gratuita.
De hecho, el conjunto se compone de los muy jóvenes maestros de la escuela y sus alumnos más destacados.
Los moxeños han mantenido por siglos sus auténticas y extraordinarias manifestaciones culturales, ocultos e ignorados. Hace veinte años cuando presenciábamos a la última generacion de músicos, violinistas y cantores surgió la Escuela de Música y el Ensamble Moxos, a través  de ellos varias generaciones de músicos están siendo formados y su música, su cultura es rescatada y revalorizada. Los moxeños hoy escriben su propia historia con música y tienen un lugar en el mundo.

Riesgos y desafíos
ENG.- Ensamble Mopos  organizes biannual tour to several European countries are invited. These tours and concerts allow the sale of CDs, thus ensuring sustainability.
ESP.- El Ensamble MOXOS organiza giras bianuales a varios países Europeos donde son invitados. Estas giras y conciertos permiten la venta de los CD's y así garantizamos la sostenibilidad del proyecto.


Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

ENG.- If you can not help financially, we would appreciate if you could share our campaign in all your networks using the tools IndieGoGo provides.

That will enable us to reach more people and have possibilities to fulfill this dream.
ESP.- Si no puedes ayudarnos económicamente, te agradeceríamos que pudieras compartir nuestra campaña en todas tus redes, utilizando las herramientas que INDIEGOGO nos brinda. 

Eso hará que podamos llegar a mas gente y tengamos posibilidades de cumplir este sueño.

This contribution not only allows us to witness to our culture and identity, but also to retain the free musical education of over 200 children and youth receive in the School each year.
We offer exclusive perks, that transport us to the experience of the living culture and magic of the Baroque Missions in San Ignacio of Moxos. Links for download our  music, as well as original souvenirs,  Custom certificates thanks, CDs and much more.

ESP.- Tenemos que financiar los costos de la grabación, edición y diseño de nuestro quinto álbum, además de los costos que deben obtener 7.000 copias para vender y así apoyar el proyecto social de la escuela de Música de San Ignacio de Moxos. Esta contribución no sólo nos permite dar testimonio de nuestra cultura e identidad, sino también para retener la educación musical gratuita de más de 200 niños y jóvenes reciben en la Escuela cada año.Ofrecemos Perks exclusivos, que nos transportan a la experiencia de la cultura viva y la magia de las misiones barrocas en San Ignacio de Moxos. Enlaces para descargar nuestra música, así como recuerdos originales, certificados de agradecimiento personalizados, CDs y mucho más.
    El impacto
 ENG. With the sale of their albums, the “Ensamble Moxos” sustains the Music School of San Ignacio, where about 200 children and teenagers from low-income, mostly indigenous, receive free musical education. In fact, the ensemble is composed of the very young teachers of the School and its most outstanding students. The moxeños have maintained for centuries its authentic and extraordinary, hidden and ignored cultural events. Twenty years ago when we witnessed the latest generation of musicians, violinists and singers School of Music and the Assembly Moxos emerged through them several generations of musicians are being trained and their music, their culture is rescued and reinvigorated. The moxeños today write their own history with music and have a place in the world.

ESP.- Con la venta de sus discos, el "Ensamble Moxos" sustenta la Escuela de Música de San Ignacio, donde mas de 200 niños y adolescentes de bajos recursos, en su mayoría indígenas, reciben educación musical gratuita. De hecho, el conjunto se compone de los muy jóvenes maestros de la escuela y sus alumnos más destacados.Los moxeños han mantenido por siglos sus auténticas y extraordinarias manifestaciones culturales, ocultos e ignorados. Hace veinte años cuando presenciábamos a la última generacion de músicos, violinistas y cantores surgió la Escuela de Música y el Ensamble Moxos, a través  de ellos varias generaciones de músicos están siendo formados y su música, su cultura es rescatada y revalorizada. Los moxeños hoy escriben su propia historia con música y tienen un lugar en el mundo.
    Riesgos y desafíosENG.- Ensamble Mopos  organizes biannual tour to several European countries are invited. These tours and concerts allow the sale of CDs, thus ensuring sustainability.ESP.- El Ensamble MOXOS organiza giras bianuales a varios países Europeos donde son invitados. Estas giras y conciertos permiten la venta de los CD's y así garantizamos la sostenibilidad del proyecto.



Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar  
ENG.- If you can not help financially, we would appreciate if you could share our campaign in all your networks using the tools IndieGoGo provides.
That will enable us to reach more people and have possibilities to fulfill this dream.ESP.- Si no puedes ayudarnos económicamente, te agradeceríamos que pudieras compartir nuestra campaña en todas tus redes, utilizando las herramientas que INDIEGOGO nos brinda. 
Eso hará que podamos llegar a mas gente y tengamos posibilidades de cumplir este sueño.

story:
After seven CDs and three DVDs, we are so excited to create this newest CD! Why a Muzical Zoo? Just like a zoo with all kinds of animals, there are ALL kinds of songs -  animal song favorites with influences from all over the World. Performed in more than 500 live shows on Pacific Northwest stages, most have never been recorded! Here are the song titles to give you the idea. Which will be YOUR favorite?

                                           

The original songs on this CD are of many different styles—folk, jazz, world, and rock—all of which take different instruments to give them their sound. It takes a zoo of instruments to create these different sounds! 

  • With so much children's music being produced with electronic sounds, we  are committed to using real instruments. Is that a REAL ukelele? YES! Trumpet? YES! Accordian? Of Course!!
  • Each musician comes into studio and adds their own special talent, making this CD full of authentic sounds of the highest caliber. 

Our goal for this fundraiser is to create an opportunity for family and friends to participate in the making of the CD, Muzical Zoo. 

Whether you want to buy a signed CD, have your child sing on the CD, or simply make a donation, we have many ways for you to be involved.  And all of these ways help us reach our goal: To make 1,000 copies of the VERY BEST CD for children!
  • All funds go toward costs to make 1,000 CDs.
  • What ARE the costs? They include 40+ hours of recording the musicians, 30+ hours of post production, mastering the CD, artwork, and the CD replication.


                       

                                                        London Bridge Studio

A Seattle recording studio, owned and operated by producers Jonathan Plum, Geoff Ott, and Eric Lilavois, London Bridge Studio provides a creative and dynamic recording environment with state-of-the-art technology and expert staff. Seattle's surge to musical prominence in the late 80s and 90s stemmed in large part from albums recorded at London Bridge. We are thrilled to join the many amazing musicians who have recorded here!



Who are Lisa and Linda? We are:

  • Identical twins, music educators, composers, and performers who produce move-along, sing-along live shows for children
  • Winners of a Parents Choice Gold and multiple Communicator Awards 
  • Dedicated to inspiring the unlimited potential of every child through music

                                          

                                 Vocals, Keyboard, Songwriter, Arranger, Producer 

Lisa is a voice/performance coach and Director of LGMusic with multiple studios in the Pacific Northwest region. Lisa also composes for several genres of music, and leads songwriting workshops with noted Northwest composers. She is an active board member of The Pacific Northwest Chapter of the Grammys, and serves on several NARAS committees. Lisa is also the footage coordinator and lead video editor for Music Shine Media, LLC.

                                        

                        Vocals, Piano, Keyboard, Flute, Songwriter, Arranger, Producer

Linda’s arrangements and original works are featured on Music Shine Media’s seven CDs and three DVDs. As a flutist, Linda was a winner of a National Flute Associate Masterclass Competition, a Miami University Concerto Competition, and spent a week in seminar with the master French flutist Marcel Moyse. In addition to producing and performing with her twin sister Lisa, Linda plays flute in the Washington Wind Symphony and performs and arranges for the Elle Flute Trio.

www.lisalindashine.com

                                                  


OUR AMAZING MUSICIANS WHO WILL PLAY ON THE CD

Casey Macgill • Piano, Trumpet, Ukelele

Casey blows a lyrical jazz cornet, and his most unique instrumental voice is a 6-string tenor ukulele. Casey's career stretches from Los Angeles (Mood Indigo, feature films "Frances" and "Swing Shift") to Spokane, Washington (The Spirits of Rhythm and the neo-swing classic CD "Jump") to Broadway (The musical "Swing") and finally to Seattle where he released three CDs with his Seattle band, The Blue 4 Trio. 

Andrew D.B. Joslyn • Violin/Fiddle

Seattle-native composer, orchestrator, and violinist Andrew Joslyn is a contributing songwriter and composer for the four-time Grammy award winning album, “The Heist,” has performed on the Tonight Show with Jay Leno, toured with folk legend Judy Collins, and has had his work performed by ensembles nationwide. His formative years were spent studying classical music.  

Nova Devonie • Accordian

Nova has been performing on accordian locally in her hometown of Seattle since her early days with the cowgirl supergroup, Ranch Romance with whom she recorded three CDs for Sugar Hill Record. She can be heard playing with swing-a-billy outfit Jo Miller & Her Burly Roughnecks, an "all Buck Owens, all the time" band,  The Buckaroosters, alt-country band The Rolling Blackouts, and duo Miles and Karina.

Ramon Salumbides • String Bass

Ramon Salumbides started studying the double bass seven years ago under Barry Lieberman and is now a tenured member of the Yakima Symphony Orchestra. Ramon has also appeared with Sammamish Symphony Orchestra, Thalia Symphony, Seattle Metropolitan Chamber Orchestra, Seattle Collaborative Orchestra, Seattle Symphony Orchestra (Tiny Tots Series), Maui Pops Orchestra, and the Olympic Ballet. 

Alex Westcoat • Drummer

Alex is most recently known for his successful run as the drummer for the internationally touring Indie band, Pickwick. Lisa and Linda have been highlighting Alex as their drummer for their duo Let Your Music Shine! with Lisa & Linda for nearly 20 years, and on their many stages in the Pacific Northwest. On this CD, he adds his amazing talents to many styles of music.

The Trio: Julie Werth on clarinet, Judy Lawrence on bassoon, and Becky Miller on French horn.   

Children's Voices: Brittany Goss, Hannah Rae Harris, Sophia Mason, and Eleanor Lily Drews   

Children's Choir: To be recorded on Sunday, October 4, 2015, 11am-1pm. 

              

It is our sincere JOY to have the opportunity to work with such fine musicians, studio engineers, and artists to create this new CD for children.

Thank you for joining in the creation of "Muzical Zoo"

www.lisalindashine.com

story:
About Kate Tombaugh and "It Just Takes One"

Hi, my name is Kate Tombaugh! Thanks for visiting my campaign page to raise funds for "It Just Takes One," a one-woman musical revue with my original script set to the tunes of Rossini, Mozart, Irving Berlin, Cole Porter, Stephen Schwartz, and so many more! 

After 2 workshops, and a 6-show premiere in Bloomington, IL in 2013, I've revised the script and layout, have my own traveling set and costumes, and am now ready to take the show on the road! 

This show is very near and dear to my heart; I wrote the script based on my personal experiences starting a career singing opera, all the while learning to find myself and figuring out the world of dating in between. With a strong background in music and outreach, I have witnessed the ability to really make a difference with music through intimate and heartfelt performances. I'm honored to share a small slice of my own story partnered with gorgeous musical selections spanning the eras. 

Your donation today will help make "It Just Takes One" a first-rate production, from the traveling set to the costumes and lighting and sound, and will ensure future productions of this charming and at-times-poignant show. Additionally, funding will help me benefit the communities I visit. In Cincinnati, I will be donating 10% of all profits raised to the Cincinnati Children's Hospital Medical Center Charitable Care Fund; I will meet with highschool and college-aged students in both Streator, IL and Cincinnati, OH who are interested in learning more about pursuing a career in music. 

Truly, any donation, great or small, will make a difference! Thank you for your support. 

Breakdown of funding

I have really worked to make "It Just Takes One" a fully-sustainable show, while keeping costs at the lowest overhead possible. 

Here is the breakdown of expenses associated with the show: 

FLAT RATE COSTS:

Cost of Set: $900

5 flats, 4 platforms, 10 blocks, 1 set bed; I was only charged for the building materials. Additionally, I have a secondary light-weight set-up for homes and very small venues made of PVC piping and curtains. This cost includes those materials, plus the paint, canvas, hinges, glue, and lumber for the large set. 

Commissioned Work: $200

I have commissioned living composer, Ann Jacobs, to write an original composition to be used for the finale bow music. 

Custom-made Traveling Trailer: $4,500

This trailer is custom-built to haul the show's set and accessories, featuring a fully-functional, streamlined and water-tight design. The above cost includes building materials, brake lights, license plate, and a portion of the labor costs to build the trailer. (Remaining costs for labor was donated by Larry Tombaugh. See "In Kind Donations" below). 

Costumes: $300

I was able to keep costs down by using mostly my own existing performance wardrobe for costumes for the show. However, with the help of the very talented costume designer Brianna Fristoe, I will have several "adapted" pieces to better facilitate quick costume changes and a few pieces that have been "upgraded" for the stage. 

Theatrical Body Microphone: $322

This E6i Omnidirectional Headworn Microphone Earset allows me hands-free movement while onstage, and expedites all those quick changes behind stage-once it's set in place, no fussing or fidgeting needed. The version is adaptable to hook up to the various sound systems available at the venues.

Sound Recording Costs : $750 

CD Production Costs: $800

We will be making a CD recording of "It Just Takes One" for promotional purposes and for future sales. Additionally, donors giving $500 and more will automatically receive an autographed CD. The CDs will be professionally duplicated and manufactured and available for sale.

Lighting: $600

I purchased a pack of stage lighting equipment that includes 8 PAR 38 cans, a dimmer system, stage setter controller, 2 cables, 2 dimmers, 4 colored gels, and a truss-style lighting stand that can stand alone or connect for professional and very stable mounting. This set allows flexibility for growth and more in-depth lighting as we continue producing in the future. 

ROLLING COSTS (these costs will recur for each additional show; below are the total sums for the shows in Streator, IL and Cincinnati, OH): 

Licensing costs: $130-$150 per show

13 of my 26 musical compositions and excerpts require per song per show licensing fees. Many of these licensing fees are supporting living composers. The remaining 13 pieces are public domain. 

Pianist Fees: $1100 

I have found two extremely talented pianists in Nancy Pounds (IL) and Stephen Variames (OH) who are adept in all the musical styles and terrific collaborators. This cost includes their sum engagement fees, plus all the rehearsal expenses while preparing for the two state openings. 

Sound Technician Fees: TBD

Lighting Technician Fees: TBD

Advertising Costs: $600

This includes the fees for: hiring a graphic designer to custom create all the promotional materials for both the Streator and Cincinnati shows, the printing costs for posters, handouts, and postcards, mailing costs, and fees for advertising in the local newspapers. 

FUTURE "WISH LIST" COSTS:

*Ellipsoidal Spotlight to be added to lighting setup ($200-$400) 

*LED Lightbulbs for 8 Par Cans (more sustainable and long-lasting) ($22x10=$220)

*Lawyer fees for assistance with creating non-profit 501-c3 status ($1,500) 

* Fees for filing and establishing a non-profit with the US government ($400-$600) 

* For now, I will be borrowing a truck or hauling the show trailer, set pieces, and lighting equipment behind my 2004 Honda Accord. In the future, I hope to own a reliable truck or van with good hauling power for these performances of "It Just Takes One" and other future productions. ($8-$15,000+)

IN-KIND DONATIONS:

Choreography: 

Jill Marconi donated her time and talents to create and teach me a tap dance segment for one of the pieces in my show. 

(worth $150)

Set-Building:

Larry Burash designed a terrific set and built it from scratch, only charging me for the materials needed for building. Many hours of planning and labor were donated for this project. 

(worth $600+)

Storyline Editing:

Kathy Tombaugh donated 20+ hours in editing this show, and a lot of patience was donated in the process. 

(worth $600+)

Set Trailer:

Larry Tombaugh donated a portion of the labor to build the show's set trailer. 

(worth $2,000)  

"It Just Takes One" Theme Song: 

Living composer Steven Weimer wrote an original composition for the "It Just Takes One" theme song. 

(worth $200)

Promotional Materials:

Mary Wargo at Commercial Fast Print discounted for promotional materials. 

Housing:

Many thanks to Ann Ellison and Drew and Lindsey Dolan for free housing during the Cincinnati stints for rehearsals and performances. 

Lighting and Sound Mentors:

Many thanks to Kregg Barney, Michael Hughes, Larry Burash, Rick Arkels, Alexandra Pontone, and Ian Garrett for so generously sharing their knowledge and recommendations for lighting and sound to ensure I purchased the best possible systems for my goals, while helping me save money. 

Family and Friends:

Endless amounts of in-kind donations were gifted me by my very supportive family and friends. 

Your impact

I sing because I want to make a difference, I like helping people, and I hope to entertain, reach, and inspire audience members. In creating "It Just Takes One," I'm hoping to do just that and I believe the show will serve a great purpose and benefit the communities I visit. 

The risks & challenges of "It Just Takes One"

In a one-person operation, one of the greatest challenges is finding future venues and getting the word out about this great show. 

I aim to visit college campuses and performing arts high schools with "It Just Takes One" as a joint residency with the university's school of music. In residency, I would offer Q&A sessions, master classes, and presentations about a career in music, tailored to each individual school's needs. Through these offerings, I hope to present options and help students brainstorm more ways to create viable and rewarding music careers. 

I'm also interested in bringing "It Just Takes One" to various communities and theaters!

If you have any suggestions, or would like to see the show come to your area, please email Kate directly at: kate@katetombaugh.com

Other ways you can help

Aren't able to donate today? 

You can still help by: 

1) Spreading the word about this campaign and "It Just Takes One" 

2) Promoting the shows in IL (Aug 28-30) and in OH (Sept 17-20) 

Any questions on how to help? Email Kate directly at: kate@katetombaugh.com


NEWS ARTICLES ABOUT "IT JUST TAKES ONE"

http://www.mywebtimes.com/life/this-show-is-now-my-own-entity-streator-native-tombaugh/article_834446b5-d7e4-5d33-a7cc-c724fa51d380.html

(worth $600+)
Set Trailer:
Larry Tombaugh donated a portion of the labor to build the show's set trailer. 
(worth $2,000)  
"It Just Takes One" Theme Song: 
Living composer Steven Weimer wrote an original composition for the "It Just Takes One" theme song. 
(worth $200)
Promotional Materials:
Mary Wargo at Commercial Fast Print discounted for promotional materials. 
Housing:
Many thanks to Ann Ellison and Drew and Lindsey Dolan for free housing during the Cincinnati stints for rehearsals and performances. 
Lighting and Sound Mentors:
Many thanks to Kregg Barney, Michael Hughes, Larry Burash, Rick Arkels, Alexandra Pontone, and Ian Garrett for so generously sharing their knowledge and recommendations for lighting and sound to ensure I purchased the best possible systems for my goals, while helping me save money. 
Family and Friends:
Endless amounts of in-kind donations were gifted me by my very supportive family and friends. 
Your impact

I sing because I want to make a difference, I like helping people, and I hope to entertain, reach, and inspire audience members. In creating "It Just Takes One," I'm hoping to do just that and I believe the show will serve a great purpose and benefit the communities I visit. 
    The risks & challenges of "It Just Takes One" In a one-person operation, one of the greatest challenges is finding future venues and getting the word out about this great show. 
I aim to visit college campuses and performing arts high schools with "It Just Takes One" as a joint residency with the university's school of music. In residency, I would offer Q&A sessions, master classes, and presentations about a career in music, tailored to each individual school's needs. Through these offerings, I hope to present options and help students brainstorm more ways to create viable and rewarding music careers. 
I'm also interested in bringing "It Just Takes One" to various communities and theaters!
If you have any suggestions, or would like to see the show come to your area, please email Kate directly at: kate@katetombaugh.com
    Other ways you can help Aren't able to donate today? 
You can still help by: 
1) Spreading the word about this campaign and "It Just Takes One" 
2) Promoting the shows in IL (Aug 28-30) and in OH (Sept 17-20) 
Any questions on how to help? Email Kate directly at: kate@katetombaugh.com


NEWS ARTICLES ABOUT "IT JUST TAKES ONE"
http://www.mywebtimes.com/life/this-show-is-now-my-own-entity-streator-native-tombaugh/article_834446b5-d7e4-5d33-a7cc-c724fa51d380.html

story:
Grow Vegetables Underground All Year Long!

My name is Everett Mincher.  I've lived in Austin, Texas for a little over 5 years.  I moved to Austin chasing opportunity,  and I think I've found a way to give back to the community at the same time.  I have been intrigued with an idea since I saw it on Facebook a few years ago.  It was called a Walipini.  It is a Peruvian technique developed in the 1980s that enabled farmers to grow vegetables in a plastic covered pit year round.  Their idea was simple:  Dig a pit with sloped sides on the face of a south sloping hill, cover it in plastic and grow vegetables in it.  My idea is to take the walipini and apply the same thought process of utilizing passive geothermal power to hot, arid climates as opposed to cold, high elevations. This is possible because the ground temperature can be used to cool a structure if the air temperature is hotter than the local ambient ground temperature.  This cooling effect will also cut water loss from evaporation.  Lucky for me, I'm in Austin Texas and it is both arid and hot.  I want to start a small scale industrial walipini, putting my knowledge of landscaping with my love of plants and fresh food.  This will put fresh, local produce within walking distance of thousands of Austinites.  It will also be carbon negative, and oxygen positive.  Another positive side product will be high quality soil, since I will be using the Bokashi compost fermentation technique.  The main effect of this project will be a beautiful place for neighbors to gather and get their veggies at a fraction of the cost of any store.  


WE NEED LAND!

Rather than leasing land, I prefer to use land that is not suitable for permanent construction, that is also not otherwise being used.  Keeping overhead low is key to this project getting off the ground.  After that, it can fund many, many more and eventually set up free satellites in impoverished or disaster stricken countries.  I do have a couple places in mind.  If I have my preference, it will go in the middle of a densely populated neighborhood in the 78704 zip code.


We also need quite a bit of equipment including a skid steer or mini excavator (or both) and the materials to do the actual construction of the underground garden, including thousands of landscaping and retaining wall stack blocks.  I have to plan to possibly employ solar power, as some building sites don't have power accessible.  Also, equipment such as shovels and gloves will be necessary.  If we go the route of veggie delivery, we need a vehicle.  We also require a web presence with the ability for customers to place orders and a shopping cart.

$15 donation: That will buy five stack block, or two retaining wall block.  The Walipini is scalable, but a certain size is needed for an adequate cooling effect during the hottest summer months.

$30 donation:  This will buy a high quality hand tool or four retaining wall blocks.

$45 donation:  This will buy block to make a section of a planter one block wide.

$75 donation:  This will buy materials to make one roof truss from reclaimed chain   link fence.

$105 donation:  This will cap eight feet of planter retaining wall, or build one linear foot of retaining wall.

$150 donation:  This will cover 42 square feet of walkway.

$300 donation:  This will fully fund one linear foot of the walipini construction.



Risks

At this point I'd like to point out two of the major costs in having a greenhouse.  One being electricity.  The cost of heating a greenhouse in the winter gets outrageous.  Utilizing the warmth of the earth at this latitude will eliminate that cost. Of course when you have a greenhouse, you run the risk of your plants catching diseases, and pests.  I can fight this by using bokashi method fertilization to keep the soil healthy, but the risk is still there. Note that the bokashi fertilizer will be made on-site from food waste, another major cost saver. Using predator insects helps with the pests, along with directly spraying with a castile soap/water mix, which is another way to save money and to keep from using chemicals. Daily monitoring of the garden will help, but no one is perfect.  Another risk is flooding, as a lot of the property I have in mind is in the flood plain.  But lucky for me, the stack blocks I plan to build the structure from can be re-stacked, and the plants can be re-grown. There is also the risk of neighborhoods not wanting a greenhouse, or the City of Austin not jiving with my idea.  I plan to do more research as time and money allow, but I know Austin well enough to say they would accept the idea with open arms.  If not, I will be seeking property outside of city limits and leaning towards a web based veggie delivery service.


Lend a hand!

Hey, if you can't lend a hand financially, just share my idea so we can get the ball rolling!

story:
Debut Album

I have been writing and singing my own songs since I was a teenager. This is my first solo album... come and join with me to get it launched!

Why This Project?

I was sat over lunch with a long-time friend in January 2015, when he leaned forward and asked me, “...So where’s your solo album?”

His question got me thinking… I’ve recorded in collaborative projects, but hadn’t done a solo project. In the next few days I thought through his challenge and felt the whisper of God, prompting me that now is the time.

This album will capture the journey I’ve been on for the last few years. A journey that I’ve walked as part of an incredible wider community, where God has met us and transformed us. It’ll be filled with songs about learning to walk with the Father as His children, free from shame. Songs that share the renewing work of Holy Spirit in our lives. Songs where we respond; sitting in the wonder of our unshakeable and awesome God.

It’ll be a mix of songs - some that have become declarations for our home church to sing, some that we’ve sung in our living room after dinner with friends, and some that come from intimate encounters where God has met me.

We Need Your Help

I can’t do this project alone! I’ll be putting the record together with a great team of friends. Many people have expressed a desire to help get this started, and we would love you to join in!

Together, we’re planning to raise $15,000 in 30 days. This will cover the recording process from start to finish:

  • Pre-production, Recording and Producing with the wonderful Producer Andre Antonio in Kelowna, BC (travel will not be covered by this campaign!)

  • Studio time (the fun part)

  • Hiring additional instruments and artists (to add some je ne sais quoi)

  • Mixing the album (getting all those instruments in balance)

  • Mastering the album (so it sounds really great in your car)

  • Promo & releasing the album (hurrah)

...and eventually a full album!

Anything raised above the project goal will go towards making more songs and spreading the word :)

What You Get

Your contribution will go straight towards making this album a reality… which is so exciting!

The neat thing about crowdfunding platforms such as indiegogo, is that you get great perks for being part of this project.

Everyone who donates will immediately get fresh music, starting with my brand new single called “Keep Me Leaning”. (Check out the campaign rewards list for full details of all the perks you can get).

My heart is that everyone who listens to this album will meet with God’s transforming presence. That you’ll encounter the same truths that have changed me and my community, and brought the Kingdom into our lives. That you can find breakthroughs like the ones that have inspired these songs.


Thanks SO much!


Jonathan and team :)

story:
Pre order our  long awaited new album, we are so excited about it being "born" and getting out !

PRE ORDER /DONATE, GET SOME GREAT VALUE GIFT PERKS ,HELP THE PROJECT BE  EVEN BETTER

We've come from S.Florida to Nashville (where else !) and are  working really  hard on the "Highways and Byways" album and expect it to be available by December , its been a long wait as we started it last year at the same time as our "Redemption" album. We're pouring everything into it financially as an OFFERING TO OUR KING and we're inviting you to participate simply by pre ordering it  and taking advantage of the great value gift perks. This is the way we can afford to spend longer in the studio making it even better quality  so this album can give YHVH  glory in the marketplace

 If you were one of the wonderful people who pre ordered or donated last year on the previous campaign then the long wait will soon be over and we look forward to shipping the cd's out to you.

As the name suggests "Highways and Byways" is about taking the wedding invitation out to the world as we feel the time is short. This album isn't  direct "worship songs" like our previous CD's but they are songs about Him in a more subtle way that the world will listen to. We've found that "pre-believers" can't really get excited about worship yet so they need help getting there.

Studios are very expensive ($50 an hour) and it takes much longer than you might think to make a quality 11 song album. Our previous albums have cost $5 -$7,000 each (but YAH provides ! )

Last years two album fundraiser raised an awesome  $9000 ($4000 via indiegogo and the rest via our website)  which was enough to complete "Redemption" for $7000 and start on this one, but we put this one on hold because we wanted it to way exceed our previous albums. Now the time  is right and we have an awesome studio to work in (ATM Studio in Spring Hill) with our good friend Ricky Armentrout engineering and co producing with us.
We hired a pro rhythm section for a few songs (they were on Taylor Swifts first album !)

Keep in touch for updates, videos  and song tasters !

Thank You for partnering with us and helping our music get to the world !

If you would rather send a check (which we encourage for larger donations)  or paypal then please message

story:
What we started

Non-consensual behavior is a problem at kinky & BDSM events. Last year professional pervert and sexual health educator Maxine Holloway worked with the BDSM & kink, and sex worker community to initiate the ASK FIRST Campaign. The goal is to create awareness about consent in public spaces. The campaign consists of fashionable stickers and temporary tattoos that read, “ASK FIRST,”  as well as a tumblr blog for anyone to post stories, thoughts, and photos regarding consent in public spaces.

Last year we successfully fundraised to get 2000 stickers and tattoos printed and distributed at last years Folsom Street fair. Not only were these simple stickers a wonderful reminder, but they served as an tool when people were negotiating pervy acts and getting permission to take a photograph.

The ASK FIRST campaign keeps growing! Since inception these stickers & tattoos have been all over the Bay Area, Los Angeles and New York City.

Check out the Eros Media Blog to learn more about the ASK FIRST origin story, PLUS tips to help you be an asking expert the Folsom Street Fair:

How we want it to grow...

Let's take the ASK FIRST Campaign to the NEXT LEVEL. The Folsom Street Fair has generously donated a booth to ASK FIRST. But I need your help to build it and fill it!

Over 400,000 Bay Area kinksters, pervy visitors and wide-eyed tourists attend Folsom every year. Let’s cover them with consent!

Our Goals:

  1. Arm the guests of Folsom with at least 10,000 ASK FIRST stickers and temporary tattoos
  2. To fill the booth with a team of babes ready to inform and illustrate just how good consent can look. This will entail:                                                                                -3 interactive BDSM performances                                                                                      --An ASK FIRST photo-booth where you can get your photo taken with your fav Bay Area kink & porn performers. 
  3. Provide tangible take away information about how the BDSM community can stop perpetuating rape culture

What this will cost:

  • Folsom Street Fair Booth Space - donated
  • Booth Structure - $150
  • 2000 temporary tattoos - $425
  • 10,000 stickers - $1000
  • ASK FIRST Banner - $50
  • Printing of literature & consent tips - $150
  • Water and snacks for booth volunteers- $100
  • ASK FIRST performance artists - $400
  • This video to be produced & edited - $100
  • Photographer for ASK FIRST photo-booth - $100
  • Total: $2475
*any funds raised that surpass the above amount will be used to get more ASK FIRST products to events around the nation

The Impact

Non-consensual behavior much too pervasive in our society, In the united states someone is sexually assaulted every 107 seconds. Unfortunately when abuse happens at kinky events it is often shrugged off as “part of the deal,” It’s time to stop ignoring this issue, start recognizing what widespread problem we have, and do something about it.

Your contribution, of any size will help define the direction of kink and sex culture in the bay area in a positive way. Let’s step up as a community to let everyone know that non-consensual behavior of any kind is not permitted in BDSM and kinky spaces. 

Press

"Maxine Holloway Wants Folsom Attendees to Ask First. Here’s How You Can Help Her Message." By Chris Hall


Siouxsie Q talks about the importance of Folsom, how to act right and ask first:


Other Ways You Can Help

PLEASE SHARE this campaign all over your social networks! You can easily use the indiegogo share tools.

Stop by the ASK FIRST booth at the Folsom Street Fair. Get a sticker or tattoo, check out the performances, and get your photo taken with some babes!

Connect with the ASK FIRST tumblr http://askfirstcampaign.tumblr.com/ Always taking tumblr submissions

We encourage you to make ASK FIRST paraphernalia freely available at your events around the globe. If you would like to use the ASK FIRST logo or would like help funding your stickers, feel free to contact Maxine Holloway at: ms.maxineholloway@gmail.com

*Campaign video production & editing by Jesse James XO

*ASK FIRST sticker design thank you to Courtney Trouble XO

And that's all there is to it.

story:
In the current political horror show, do you need some laughter? Some encouragement? Perspective? Inspiration? Would you like new original songs and song parodies to sing along with as you march and petition and Get Out the Vote and Resist?  Will you help me make RiZe Up, my new full length album?

I’m Roy Zimmerman, and I’ve been bringing the sting of satire to the struggle for social justice for over twenty years. My entire professional career has prepared me for this moment in history, and I’m so excited to make this new album with your help. RiZe Up will be my 10th album as a solo performer, and this time we’re pulling out all the stops!

We envision this album as a big Americana romp akin to Bruce Springsteen’s The Seeger Sessions. It’s Folk, Country, Pop, Rock, Broadway, Cajun, Dixieland standing on the shoulders of Pete and Woody and Odetta and Phil Ochs and Tom Lehrer and, yes, even Weird Al.

Half the songs will be the parodies that have garnered tens of millions of views on social media. 

The other half will be new originals we’ve penned over the course of the Trump Era. These originals grew directly out of the touring we’ve done over the last 10 years - visiting all the most Progressive people -- the Blue Dots -- in all the contiguous 48 states. These songs rose up out of our conversations with you - they are grass roots, people-driven, struggle-inspired.

Crowdfunding IS a popular uprising. It's the way independent voices get heard these days. Indie musicians create these projects ourselves now -- we write, arrange, record, mix, master, design, manufacture and promote albums like RiZe Up.  And, unlike Trump, we actually do hire the best people.

Many of you know that we lost our beloved recording engineer Jory Prum in 2016 to a tragic motorcycle accident. We were at a loss about how to make the next record until we had the inspiration to return to LA where we started making records in the first place and to enlist the services of lots of people we love  ...

We will be recording basics at Mark Linnet’s studio where we recorded The Foremen albums for Warner Bros Records and Mickey’s Comedy for Kids for Disney Records. You’ve seen Mark on the big screen as The Beach Boys’ recording engineer in Love and Mercy. In real life, Mark has worked extensively with The Beach Boys and countless other music legends and has won 3 Grammy Awards.

We’ll record overdubs at Marty Rifkin’s studio. Even before The Foremen, Melanie and I had an alternative country band called The Twang, and Marty was our co-producer on those records. Going for The Seeger Sessions' sound will be an organic fit for Marty as he played dobro and steel for Bruce on The Seeger Sessions World Tour.

For background and harmony vocals we’re so proud to be bringing in our dear friend, the mighty Laura Love. A folk luminary, Laura is also an author, activist and all around magical person. 

On bass will be our dear friend and sideman extraordinaire Denny Croy, the original bass player for The Foremen. On drums will be our son Sam “The Clock” Zimmerman. Rounding out the vocals will be the dueling baritones of our son Joe Zimmerman and our nephew Jon Brockway. My wife and writing partner Melanie Harby will add lead guitar, mandolin and banjo.

This is a big project and a big ask. Will you help us make this album? We’ve chosen flexible funding, so no matter how much we raise, we will still make a record. But if we can get full funding, or, better yet, if we can rise up and over full funding, we can bring in the amazing Soggy Po Boys for that big brass section sound.

Will you help us raise the funds to  break the brass ceiling? Every little bit helps!  If you would like to contribute to the RiZe Up campaign, simply click the pink 'Back It' button at the top of this page to the right of the video. Then you will be able to enter the amount you’d like to donate. 

We’ve also put together a number of fun perks for you to peruse and choose from on the right side of this page. The more we raise, the better we can promote this album and the greater impact it will have.

We'll be posting updates and adding new perks as we go along. We head to the studio in June and will  be releasing RiZe Up in September, just in time to catch the Big Blue Wave into the midterm elections.

Making this record will be a total labor of love with the people we love and with the help of our beloved friends and fans. Will you join the Rize Up family by making a donation or choosing a perk today?  Let's RiZe Up together!

*******

"Roy's lyrics move beyond poetry and achieve perfection." -- Joni Mitchell

"Lyrical brilliance. Just excellent." --  "Weird Al" Yankovic

"Zimmerman displays a lacerating wit and keen awareness of society's foibles that bring to mind a latter-day Tom Lehrer." -- Los Angeles Times

"I congratulate Roy Zimmerman on reintroducing literacy to comedy songs. And the rhymes actually rhyme, they don't just 'rhyne.'" -- Tom Lehrer

"Zimmerman is a guy on the left skewering folks on the right with rapier-sharp lyrics ... underneath the caustic satire is a man who is surprisingly optimistic." -- Sing Out! Magazine

"You're brilliant. Just brilliant!" -- Terry Jones, Monty Python

"Splendidly acerbic." -- Gene Weingarten, Washington Post Magazine

"The best musical satirist working today." -- The Bay Area Reporter 

"I have long been a huge fan. Thanks for your wonderfully witty songs - really quite Tom Lehrer-esque." -- Richard Dawkins

"Bobby Kennedy meets Bobby Dylan" -- The Marin Independent Journal

"...this was no ordinary man. This was Roy Zimmerman, a unique type of superhero who possesses the power to nearly coax urine from the unwilling bladders of his audience members (via laughter). He delivered some of the smartest satirical songs that I'd ever heard." -- Jeff Penalty, lead singer of The Dead Kennedys

"Without a doubt, Roy Zimmerman is among the most important political commentators of the last few decades, and in the end, it's the music that unites and disarms. With music this good and humor this insightful, there is good reason to be optimistic." -- No Depression Magazine

"Original. Unique. Brilliant. Prolific. Talented. Insightful. Witty. Consistent. Versatile. He simultaneously inspires me and makes me laugh my ass off." -- Paul Krassner

"I opened a few shows for Roy Zimmerman in Florida. I thought then, as I think now, that he might be the most brilliant song maker alive.  -- Grant Peeples

"Roy Zimmerman has a rare gift for songwriting." -- San Francisco Chronicle

"One of the funniest, most musical and meaningful comedians you'll ever experience."

-- Ed Pearl, the Ash Grove

story:
Short Summary

Here's part of a Music Video for one of the songs on the album...

I want to give back to the community, so I am teaming up with Music For Relief to get a good portion of all the money I raise into the hands of people who really need it, the survivors of the horrible California fires who have lost their homes. 

About 6 years ago I had a minor little heart attack (at a very young age)... and that got me thinking... mostly about seeing my daughter grow up and being there for her, but also leaving a little legacy for her. So I've put together this album of songs she's heard through her lifetime. "Life's Too Short" is a song I wrote after a friends mother passed away... it's uplifting and poignant.  "My Heart Jumped A Mile High" is a funny song about being too shy to ask a waitress out on a date.  "Gentleman Jack" is about dealing with a break-up.  "Beyond Repair" is about a goodhearted woman who's emotional scars are deep and they keep her from letting anyone in too close.

Those are just a few of the great songs on this album, but more important you'll be helping people who need it now.

For those who can't afford to help out even for as little $'s as I'm asking... Please forward this campaign to those who you think can. Use the share tool! And share!

Also, feel free to go to my website GBLambmusic.com and listen to the music first or at SoundCloud or CDbaby or itunes, I think you'll want it.  But if not, then feel free to just donate to the relief effort.

story:
The Nitty Gritty

Hey, guys! My name is Calvin Winbush, I perform under the name Calvin The II. I've been playing music all of my life, but 5 years ago I stepped out to be a music artist. Since then I've performed around the world and have been able to work with an AMAZING team of artist/musicians/dancers and directors. As an actor I've appeared in some amazing productions such as "Whiplash," "Nashville," "New Girl," and "Straight Outta Compton" as well as a ton of music videos.

Recently, both of those world collided when I appeared as the guitarist in the critically-acclaimed music video "This is America" by Childish Gambino.

 

The video was more successful than I ever would have imagined and made it possible for me to release my first official single as a recording artist, "Keepa"! (You can hear it playing under the main campaign video). However, with any music release, you need to have a strong visual to help carry the song further and really make an impact. Which is why we're asking for help to shoot this video.

This is huge to me because after being on set working on so many talented artist's music videos, I'm finally getting the chance to do one of my own! It's literally a dream come true and I DON'T take it for granted. When I first became an artist, I had NO idea what I was doing and put a lot of time and effort into a project that didn't go anywhere. I remember being so drained and disappointed to the point that I almost quit music all together.

This is a LOT different now that I have a great team of people to help guide me, which is a blessing. Having an amazing music video of my own allows me the opportunity to establish myself as a serious artist as well as ensure the success of the single "Keepa." It can not only open up relationships, but also touring  and festival opportunities for myself and my entire team.

In short, this video, just like "This is America" can help change our lives forever!

 

The Deets

The great thing about being in "This is America" is that I've been cemented in history as a character in one of the most interesting and thought-provoking music videos of all time. The challenging thing about it is.... the bar is set SO dang high for my own video now!!! 

I'm not dumb and would in NO way try to compete with "This is America," but what I also won't do is shame Donald, Hiro, Fam, Jason and everyone else who worked on that production by releasing something that is sub par, lol. They taught me better than that!

By calling in favors and making a ton of phone calls to my producers, director my director and myself have come up with an awesome treatment and humble budget of $8,000 for "Keepa".

The funds from this campaign will go towards equipment as well as compensating the cast and crew and feeding them. Some of the items include, but are not limited to:

  • DP and Camera Equipment (Arri Alexa Mini)
  • Lens Kit (Cooke Lenses)
  • Lighting Kit
  • Color Correction
  • Location Fees
  • Insurance
  • Filming Permits
  • Catered Food for Lunch
  • Hair and Makeup
  • Set Decorations
  • Wardrobe
  • Stylist
  • Grips/AC/Gaffer/ AD
  • Dancers

I think my favorite part of constructing this campaign has been thinking up the perks! Lol, I have some amazing supporters so I wanted to be sure the perks were as interesting as you guys are!


The Vision


The Song

The song "Keepa" came to be in December. I had just performed for Cricket Wireless and got a little TOO excited and damaged my vocal chords. I was upset, and then out of nowhere, a producer I had been trying to work with for THE ENTIRE YEAR hits me up and says, "Hey, let's go to the studio!" I tried to get out of it because at that point all I could do was hum and grunt.

That music producer was Mike Dupree and thankfully he persisted. I go to the studio and in two hours, "Keepa" was born. The reason why I'm singing so low and smooth in it is because that's ALL I could muster out, but it ended up working.

The song is a love letter to women who come into your life and instantly let you know they're someone who you shouldn't let go of easily. From the moment we're born until the day we die, guys are molded by the women in their lives. This song celebrates the moment we realize how amazing the women in our lives really are.

That being said, it makes me proud that the crew for the music video is mostly women. From the producer to the creative director to the graphic designer and the talent, this music video wouldn't have happened without all of the amazing women involved.

 

The Squad

What makes me confident enough about this song and music video to ask you guys for help is my AMAZING team that helped me to get here. They are some of the most talented group of individuals I've ever met. For whatever reason, I'm able to call these people and tell them my crazy ideas and they put their professional resources together for my sake, lol.

 

Director: Jon Primo

Jon Primo has been a passionate about film-making since a child. He studied at the Academy of Art University in San Francisco, California  where he majored in directing and minored in screenwriting. Since then he has directed a series music videos for major and independent labels. Along with short films, commercials and a feature film. He brings nothing but passion and creativity to each project he tackles.
Calvin: Jon is a true artist and visionary. Not only does he know more about cameras and lenses as ANYONE I've met, he's also know's how to use them, WELL! One of most charming and humble human beings I've ever worked with!

 

Music Producer: Mike Dupree

Hailing from Kansas City, Missouri, Mike Dupree has crafted hits for the likes of Kendrick Lamarr, Snoop Dogg, T.I., TechN9ne, Trey Songz and many many more. In addition to producing, he's also one half of the amazing group, No Coincidence.

 

Creative Director/Choreographer: Reyna Joy Banks

A celebrity dancer of 19 years, and now also a full-time CEO of FHG Entertainment, founder of a non-profit organization called “2 LIVVV” building homes for artist/talent and tours to CULTIVATE, CONNECT, CREATE and CATAPULT them globally. She has performed with legends such as, Beyoncé, Ne-Yo, BBD, Justin Bieber, Toni Braxton, and Chaka Khan, to name a few. Banks was blessed to showcase her talent nationally on award shows multiple times such as the BET Awards, Grammys, Billboard Awards, Dove Awards and with appearances as lead dancer/actress on Nickelodeon's hit show "Victorious," “Bunheads” and more.

Calvin: To put it frankly, Reyna and her non-profit, 2 LIVVV are one of the BIGGEST reasons this is happening! 2 LIVVV has not only helped to make this possible with their resources, but also time, consulting and flat-out MOTIVATING me to keep going! She's a walking blessing.

 

Producer: Janelle Pearson

Janelle Renee Pearson is a native Texan turned Californian turned New Yorker.  She graduated  from NYU’s Tisch School of the Arts where she studied under Alec Baldwin and Delroy Lindo. In 2015, years of experience, both in front of and behind the camera, led Janelle to writing, producing and acting in her first short film, The Untimely End of Ms. Xiang, which has been nominated and won an award for “Best Short” in the Orlando Urban Film Festival, as well as “Best Short” in the online LA based Variety Film Festival. You can check out her series "No Chill" exclusively on Elizabeth Banks' platform WhoHaHa.com. 

Calvin: Janelle will outwork and out-hustle just about anyone on the face of the earth. Also, she's an amazing actress/director. She's basically the Olivia Pope of producing. When she agreed to come on board for this project, I was BEYOND revealed because to me that meant that no matter WHAT happens, everything is going to work out because she has it handled.

 

Graphic Designer: Angela Kane

Artist-Content Creator and Founder of ASCNDUPWRD. Whose purpose is to assist in Facilitating the Dreams of others. Currently traveling for work but based out of LA.

I met Angela while doing the open mic circuit in LA and from the moment I met her she's been one of the most consistent and hard-working human beings I've ever met!

 

The Testimony

I'll never get enough of shouting out my team. Anyone who ever did more than they were required to for any part of my dream is a vital part of my team and I appreciate you with all my heart. I once tried to do things on my own and had no success, but once I found people who believed in me, everything changed. For people to give their hard earned time and money towards my ideas means a lot to me and if that's you, you're OFFICIALLY a part of my team!

With that being said, while I appreciate everyone who gives, I really want each of you to know that this is about more than just money or a music video shoot. My biggest goal in this is building a relationship with all of you where I'm able to provide quality entertainment and earn your trust so that I can continue to work with amazing people, do amazing work and inspire others.

I've ABSOLUTELY been in positions where I literally didn't have a dollar to my name and with a negative bank account balance. So if you honestly can't spare $5, I COMPLETELY understand. I would ask that instead of cash, that you share this with as many people as possible. If you're able to email this campaign to your mailing list, and post it to your social media several times, that can be BETTER than giving a small donation because it can hit multiple people!

After the first couple of days, the noise about this campaign might start to dwindle, but by commenting, sharing hashtags and reposting, it can go a LONG way!

Thank y'all!

When she agreed to come on board for this project, I was BEYOND revealed because to me that meant that no matter WHAT happens, everything is going to work out because she has it handled. 
 

Graphic Designer: Angela Kane
Artist-Content Creator and Founder of ASCNDUPWRD. Whose purpose is to assist in Facilitating the Dreams of others. Currently traveling for work but based out of LA.
I met Angela while doing the open mic circuit in LA and from the moment I met her she's been one of the most consistent and hard-working human beings I've ever met!

 
The Testimony
I'll never get enough of shouting out my team. Anyone who ever did more than they were required to for any part of my dream is a vital part of my team and I appreciate you with all my heart. I once tried to do things on my own and had no success, but once I found people who believed in me, everything changed. For people to give their hard earned time and money towards my ideas means a lot to me and if that's you, you're OFFICIALLY a part of my team!

With that being said, while I appreciate everyone who gives, I really want each of you to know that this is about more than just money or a music video shoot. My biggest goal in this is building a relationship with all of you where I'm able to provide quality entertainment and earn your trust so that I can continue to work with amazing people, do amazing work and inspire others.I've ABSOLUTELY been in positions where I literally didn't have a dollar to my name and with a negative bank account balance. So if you honestly can't spare $5, I COMPLETELY understand. I would ask that instead of cash, that you share this with as many people as possible. If you're able to email this campaign to your mailing list, and post it to your social media several times, that can be BETTER than giving a small donation because it can hit multiple people!After the first couple of days, the noise about this campaign might start to dwindle, but by commenting, sharing hashtags and reposting, it can go a LONG way!
Thank y'all!

story:
A Bold Concept Album

We live in an America where children shoot each other.  As a former broadcast journalist, Producer Peter Vadala believes that media is a big part of the problem, but that it goes much deeper.

"It was never like this," Vadala says. 

The story behind the Fall Concept Album is about a girl who falls through a hole in the ice, into an androgynous underworld where men aren't men, so women can't be women.

But Vadala promises a happy ending.  "The story elates listeners we've heard from on every level, because It's a concept album, in the truest sense."

And Vadala would know, because he brings a lifetime of combined performing arts experience to the project.  Grammy-nominated Fall music producer and orchestrator Carl Marsh calls it musically interesting.

And so while this Indiegogo campaign is a humble one, with the aim of finishing a demo recording which you see in the video, it's one small step toward telling the much larger story.

"Art can do what political bickering and Fake News can't," Vadala says.  "The people who write and announce the news are really great at regurgitating infinite quantities of insidious trivia, but they lose focus of what it all means, and with it, their sanity.  If we're not careful, we'll become just like them.

"Free from the shackles of the Fake News anchor desk, I can tell a true story that brings out the very best in my audience, and in myself.  Without the cheesy news music, and the odd folks at the Associated Press,  I can write better news music, for instance, as a composer, lyricist, director.  As a storyteller, in this medium, I can tell a truer story all around.

"I hold everybody on my team to only the highest standards of excellence - most of all, myself.  Because content - is for milk cartons.  We here at the Fall Concept Album create contentedness."

What We Need & What You Get

We need your help with a very simple goal - to cover some modest cost over-runs from our recent demo recording in Berlin.  We'll show our thanks by sharing the exclusive demo recording of the Fall Concept Album's titular song with you, for your contribution of $10 or more.  But wait!  There's more!  

  • You also get a free copy of the Waltz demo when you claim the $10 perk!
  • We're taking your requests right now!
  • Our total costs to finish the demo are only about $1,200
  • The ambitious concept album spans the most diverse variety of popular music ever, all while telling a consistent story from beginning to end.  You'll start to hear that in the two demo songs, where within the span of about four minutes each, the music spans the genre spectrum from an orchestral waltz all the way to muted punk rock, with an emphasis on cutting-edge, Broadway-busting style storytelling and character arc.
  • We went all the way to Berlin, Germany to conduct the recording because that's where opera appreciation still thrives.  Sashell Beck recorded the demo pro bono.  Vadala auditioned many sopranos you've heard of from the pop world, however, he realized that in a project spanning both opera and pop, and everything in between - that it would be much easier to train a conservatory opera singer to sing pop than to go the other way around.  The recording session was expensive in that regard, but worth it.

Putting the "Culture" Back In Pop Culture

  • You'll help raise the bar of popular culture in America, and by extension, the world.  Musically, morally, spiritually, really in every way that culture can be edified.
  • You'll help remind the world why sexy - real sexy - that is, authentic masculinity and femininity - is important; and moreover, why authentic femininity is worth cherishing and edifying.
  • Peter Vadala says he believes that by creating the right kind of art, perhaps, just perhaps, he says that perhaps children won't shoot each other as they do now, in this highly triggered world we live in.  Vadala attributes those triggers to media conditioning, and he says this work will help to reveal how and why media conditions people, citing C.S. Lewis:  “A man with an obsession is a man who has very little sales resistance"(Mere Christianity).

  • When you hear the full songs, you'll understand why Broadway and Hollywood are buzzing about the Fall Concept Album.

Risks & Challenges

The goal is very clear.  The demo recording is completed in its entirety.  And when Blackbird Music Studio, finishes mixing the demo, we'll show our thanks by passing along a copy to you if you for claiming the perk!

Thanks again!

You guys are amazing.  We couldn't do what we do without you.

story:
Enso – all things connected in the endless cycle of energy.

Anima – one soul within the cycle.

Enso Anima is a band that writes and plays a unique blend of progressive and experimental music, rooted in post-hardcore and branching out to a wide range of styles and genres. Originally from New York, Enso moved to Sacramento in late 2016 to join the vibrant community of talented, passionate and groundbreaking artists that composes the Sacramento music scene, and we’ve been blessed to have been welcomed into that scene and made hundreds of fans since we began playing shows to strangers in late April 2017.

It is this long journey from being best friends jamming in a basement after school, to becoming a band with hundreds of fans who will stop at nothing to achieve our dream, that forms the heart and soul of our first record, Instability.

This is an album that covers a lot of sonic and thematic ground, an album that speaks to both heartache and inspiration, loss and discovery, destruction and renewal. The genres explored range from blues to punk, folk to metal, post-rock and even jazz, while staying rooted in the signature character of Enso’s brand of post-hardcore. Styles range from richly textured atmospherics to jarring stutter-step rhythms, saucy grooves to delicate intertwining melodies, while the compositions run the gambit from dense prog-rock epics, to whole songs built on four chords.

To fully realize our vision for this album, we knew that we had to hire the best. Recorded at The Panda Studios in Fremont, CA (www.thepandastudios.com); tracked, edited, mixed and co-produced by Jeremy "The Wizard" Wurst of Coyote Face Recording (www.coyotefacerecording.com); mastered by the illustrious Troy Glessner of Spectre Studios (www.facebook.com/spectremastering) who's brought to life such classics as Underoath's They're Only Chasing Safety and Emery's The Question; and with stunning album art by the insanely talented Abby Lessick (www.abbylessick.com), a sample of which is featured above, Instability has exceeded our highest expectations, and we're tremendously excited to share it with you!

However, hiring the best has also proven to be extremely expensive, totaling well over $10K, and has all but exhausted our monetary resources. We always have and always will invest everything we have into our music, but we need your help to complete the last few steps to releasing the record! We're asking for $2,500, which would:

  • offset $1,500 worth of mixing and production fees
  • cover all $650 in mastering fees
  • cover $350 for distribution of CD's and incentive fulfillment

Any additional funds above and beyond our goal will be put towards the rice-and-beans fund for our upcoming Winter tour through the Pacific Northwest! In addition, we're offering certain donation incentives, many of which are exclusive to those who support our campaign! Everyone who donates any amount will get a free download of our first single from the record, Steam (to be released on November 2nd). Some other IndieGoGo exclusives are:

  • behind the scenes footage from our upcoming music video
  • Enso will cover your favorite anime theme song
  • Enso will write a song about you (content and genre of your choice)
  • Tyler (our bassist) will get a tattoo of your choice 
  • Whitney (our rhythm guitarist) will make a homecooked meal for you and a friend
  • and of course... a blow-up clown, with a blend of all of our faces on it... if you're into that sort of thing!

Enso’s aim in creating Instability is to bring fans of diverse backgrounds together through our common humanity, the spirit of adventure and feelings of wonder and curiosity which lie somewhere within each one of us. We’ve crafted this record to appeal to folks of many musical tastes by giving each a sample of what they already love, then gently coaxing them to explore, to embrace new knowledge, experience and growth.

This is not only our mission statement with this record, but an integral part of how we function as a band. In a live setting we craft our setlist, stage presence and dynamics to suit a wide range of shows and crowds, often making fans who have never heard of post-hardcore, and even folks who don’t much enjoy rock music in general! One of our greatest joys is to begin playing to a room of people chatting casually, and to finish our set holding the audience in rapt attention, transfixed by the changes simultaneously taking place in the music they hear, and within themselves.

Creating this album has been one of the most monumental challenges of our lives, and we are extremely close to being able to share this labor of love with the world. The recordings are complete, the mixing and mastering have been honed to precision and exacting detail, the album art and design are nearly complete, and we are poised to order CD's and distribute these songs all across the world. All that remains is your contribution which makes all of that possible!

Lastly, even if you can't contribute monetarily, you can still help out by spreading the word about this campaign, the album and our upcoming tour. Every time you tell your friends and loved ones, every time you share this campaign on social media, you make an invaluable contribution to the success of our dream. We couldn't have gotten this far without you, and we're honored and grateful to receive your contribution, even if this is your first time hearing about Enso Anima and you've just read to the end of this post.

Because YOU are Enso Anima. And we are not alone.

- Nick, Tyler, Shane and Whitney
