story:
"Something Old, Something New"

I’ve been involved in music production for the last 45 years, and thanks to generous sponsorship have been able to dedicate my time and efforts to countless musical productions. I am a singer, song-writer, arranger-producer who has discovered in Jesus the answer to every question and situation encountered over the years. I have dedicated myself to spreading His message of love and  truth, and am now  embarking on a new project that I foresee will strengthen and comfort others, even those who have not yet discovered the wealth in His teachings and incomparable love.

 

1A - "Something Old, Something New" Project ... Short Explanation  [4:07] (same as video above)

 

 

Overview and Explanation of the Project -- A quick to-the-point explanation of this project

 

1B - "Something Old, Something New" Project ... complete explanation  [7:00]

Same video as above, but fuller explanation

 

1C - Proyecto "TESOROS NUEVOS Y VIEJOS ... Explicación en Espanol (6:11):

Explicación del nuevo proyecto de Jerry Paladino -- "Tesoros Nuevos y Viejos" (Spanish explanation

 

I'm calling this campaign  "Something Old, Something New," based on Jesus' observation that anyone instructed in the teaching of the kingdom He came to present is like a homeowner “who brings out of his treasure things new and old,”--or like "the owner of a general store who can put his hands on anything you need, old or new, exactly when you need it…”

 

So to explain the 2 parts:

"SOMETHING OLD":

With this project I want to update or upgrade—make culturally relevant—some of the beautiful songs believers who lived before our present day sang. Today we may know them as HYMNS--they were contemporary in their day but have now passed into the background generally, and are mostly sung in more conservative Christian circles these days. Some of these amazing messages and melodies have managed to move on into our present day, but there are many that have not, and I find that a real shame. I think we’re incomplete without the expressions and thoughts from other believers who have gone before us, and that it is a wealth that needs to be preserved.

Many of these songs have truly enriched my spirit and enhanced my walk with Jesus over the years, even rescuing me on a number of occasion from severe testing and difficult situations I found myself in. So I want to give them room to speak to us again at this time in our history, to  give us strength and courage to move ahead in spite of the tough places we find ourselves in. This is the MAIN THRUST of the project, since these songs are already written.

 

"SOMETHING NEW":

I love to write or receive new messages drawn from my own personal growth and day to day life for Jesus. I’ve offered many of them on my music site jerrypaladino.bandcamp.com, alongside other beautiful ‘gems’ that I have found in my travels and life abroad. I sense in the depth of my being an on-going commission by Him to continue writing and receiving new songs based on all I’m learning and experiencing—I have a list of themes and topics which grows by the day, and at this moment I have at least 8 songs in the pipeline in both English and Spanish that I'd like to get out and into finalized recordings. 

 

 

THE OVER-ARCHING GOAL:

I plan to focus on recording 10-12 traditional hymns over the next 10 months, accompanied by a few new songs of my own composition. I’ll be shooting for a balance of releasing 1 new composition for every 3 hymns recorded if possible. I have a unique opportunity to travel and ‘test’ them on audiences around the world in my musical ministry, which is one reason why I’m spreading the timetable over 10 months--part of these next 10 months I'll be away from home, using in that public ministry this material along with the other treasures you find on my site. 

 

YOUR CONTRIBUTION:

  • will help make this project possible, for which I am so very grateful. It’s thanks to sponsorship over the years that I have been able to dedicate my time and energies into producing a steady flow of music, songs, and albums…It hasn’t always been a rushing river of production, agreed--sometimes it’s gotten down to a small stream or steady trickle, but at least it has been constant over the years, and I am extremely grateful for that. [you'll find them on met music site]

 

Specifically your gift will allow me to:

  • Focus on this project rather than spend time in other non-related fund raising operations. [Even preparing this Crowd-funding appeal has taken more than a week of effort, and precious time away from the Studio.]
  • Use other musicians and singers to embellish these recordings

  • Cover the cost of programs, equipment, and other on-going studio expenses.

 

I’m setting the goal of $6000 to over expenses for the next 10 months…after paying a percentage to this great platform that handles the crowd-funding and the finance transfers, that will leave me with $500 a month to pay for it to become a reality.

Recordings of these hymns will first be done in English; then a Spanish version will be done as well, which will allow me to share this awesome material in 2 languages…Once the tracks are finished in 10 months (the goal), it will be much quicker to finalize Spanish versions—the instrumentation and basic mixing will be done.

 

The Impact?

  • I believe these songs will be a strength to you personally, something you can grab hold of and use to get you through tough times, or to just generally lighten your load or lift your heart. They have helped me and others, and I believe they will help you even when you need it.
  • I believe they will be good for others, some whom you will meet and others whom you will never see. Imagine, you can give something to help people you may never meet ...
  • I also believe that ‘whatever you spend He will repay’—that has been my personal experience over the years any time I have given or witnessed others give of what they gave towards a worthy cause or need.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you can't contribute, but you can still help:

  • Share this campaign with people in your social media, word of mouth, etc. [use the Indiegogo share tools!]
  • If you are a praying person, please join me and others in praying this through to completion. There are always MANY obstacles to any endeavor, ESPECIALLY the important and worthy ones...

 

 

Perks

REWARDS AND INCENTIVES (2:16) - Explanation of Rewards and Incentive for those who participate in this project 

I saved this for last, as I’m not too fond of gimmicky rewards and incentives, though I know it’s part of how things are done on this site and others--but I don’t want to spend a LOT of time on that aspect of things, so I’m making these ‘perks’ pretty limited and basic. Anyway, I truly believe that God will BLESS anyone who helps, and that any perks HE provides will be MUCH better anyhow.

If you’ve ever visited my music site then you know that all my music has been available for free since the beginning…I’m a firm believer in ‘freely you have received, freely give.’ I do offer CDs at any events I participate in, but on my website you can get everything that's there for free or with a donation of your choice. Therefore (as a PERK) I will not be offering free digital downloads of the album upon completion…that will be offered to any and all, whether they choose to donate or not. So if you find that missing in the list of PERKS, that’s the reason why.

  • I WILL  be offering PRE-RELEASES, sent to you before they hit any of the sites I’ll be putting them on.
  • I will mail physical CDs of the HYMNS ALBUM upon completion to some; multiple copies of the CD for those who give more.
  • For the most generous donors, I can also offer on-line meetings, chats, virtual concerts, mini-concerts in your home, or concerts in your city, or yet-to-be-decided-between-us requests that you may come up with.

 

MY BACKGROUND for those who DON’T know me:

MY BACKGROUND, and SONG BITS (6:37) - My story in brief, and SONG SNIPPETS showing some of my music & what's available for downloading

I have been songwriting since age 16; went looking for truth around age 18 during the hippie movement, found it at age 20, at which point I turned my life over to Jesus. I went to work for Him fulltime, leaving family, country & career to bring His truth to the peoples of this big beautiful world: I never looked back, never regretted that decision.

Over the years as a volunteer and missionary in many different countries, I’ve had the privilege to rub shoulders and work with many gifted musicians, singers and songwriters, and in those encounters I discovered many lovely gems—songs that touched me & moved me personally, helped me through some very difficult periods, or were key in sharing my faith or Jesus’ teachings with those who didn’t yet know Him, or who wanted to know Him better. I have recorded quite a few of those and you can find them on my website: jerrypaladino.bandcamp.com.

 

P.S. TO ALL (1:15)


A BIG thanks to my family, friends, and followers of my music productions: through the years you have all helped make my music ministry possible and my musical dreams come true for which I will be ETERNALLY grateful to you--Thank you for helping make it happen! May God indeed bless you in response to your generosity. 

If you want to discuss another way of donating to this cause, please contact me directly at my email: jerrypaladinomusic@gmail.com.

I have dedicated myself to spreading His message of love and  truth, and am now  embarking on a new project that I foresee will strengthen and comfort others, even those who have not yet discovered the wealth in His teachings and incomparable love. 1A - "Something Old, Something New" Project ... Short Explanation  [4:07] (same as video above)


 

 
Overview and Explanation of the Project -- A quick to-the-point explanation of this project 1B - "Something Old, Something New" Project ... complete explanation  [7:00]Same video as above, but fuller explanation 1C - Proyecto "TESOROS NUEVOS Y VIEJOS ... Explicación en Espanol (6:11):Explicación del nuevo proyecto de Jerry Paladino -- "Tesoros Nuevos y Viejos" (Spanish explanation I'm calling this campaign  "Something Old, Something New," based on Jesus' observation that anyone instructed in the teaching of the kingdom He came to present is like a homeowner “who brings out of his treasure things new and old,”--or like "the owner of a general store who can put his hands on anything you need, old or new, exactly when you need it…” So to explain the 2 parts:"SOMETHING OLD":With this project I want to update or upgrade—make culturally relevant—some of the beautiful songs believers who lived before our present day sang. Today we may know them as HYMNS--they were contemporary in their day but have now passed into the background generally, and are mostly sung in more conservative Christian circles these days. Some of these amazing messages and melodies have managed to move on into our present day, but there are many that have not, and I find that a real shame. I think we’re incomplete without the expressions and thoughts from other believers who have gone before us, and that it is a wealth that needs to be preserved.Many of these songs have truly enriched my spirit and enhanced my walk with Jesus over the years, even rescuing me on a number of occasion from severe testing and difficult situations I found myself in. So I want to give them room to speak to us again at this time in our history, to  give us strength and courage to move ahead in spite of the tough places we find ourselves in. This is the MAIN THRUST of the project, since these songs are already written. "SOMETHING NEW":I love to write or receive new messages drawn from my own personal growth and day to day life for Jesus. I’ve offered many of them on my music site jerrypaladino.bandcamp.com, alongside other beautiful ‘gems’ that I have found in my travels and life abroad. I sense in the depth of my being an on-going commission by Him to continue writing and receiving new songs based on all I’m learning and experiencing—I have a list of themes and topics which grows by the day, and at this moment I have at least 8 songs in the pipeline in both English and Spanish that I'd like to get out and into finalized recordings.   THE OVER-ARCHING GOAL:I plan to focus on recording 10-12 traditional hymns over the next 10 months, accompanied by a few new songs of my own composition. I’ll be shooting for a balance of releasing 1 new composition for every 3 hymns recorded if possible. I have a unique opportunity to travel and ‘test’ them on audiences around the world in my musical ministry, which is one reason why I’m spreading the timetable over 10 months--part of these next 10 months I'll be away from home, using in that public ministry this material along with the other treasures you find on my site.  
YOUR CONTRIBUTION:
will help make this project possible, for which I am so very grateful. It’s thanks to sponsorship over the years that I have been able to dedicate my time and energies into producing a steady flow of music, songs, and albums…It hasn’t always been a rushing river of production, agreed--sometimes it’s gotten down to a small stream or steady trickle, but at least it has been constant over the years, and I am extremely grateful for that. [you'll find them on met music site]
 Specifically your gift will allow me to:

Focus on this project rather than spend time in other non-related fund raising operations. [Even preparing this Crowd-funding appeal has taken more than a week of effort, and precious time away from the Studio.]

Use other musicians and singers to embellish these recordings
Cover the cost of programs, equipment, and other on-going studio expenses.
 I’m setting the goal of $6000 to over expenses for the next 10 months…after paying a percentage to this great platform that handles the crowd-funding and the finance transfers, that will leave me with $500 a month to pay for it to become a reality.Recordings of these hymns will first be done in English; then a Spanish version will be done as well, which will allow me to share this awesome material in 2 languages…Once the tracks are finished in 10 months (the goal), it will be much quicker to finalize Spanish versions—the instrumentation and basic mixing will be done. The Impact?
I believe these songs will be a strength to you personally, something you can grab hold of and use to get you through tough times, or to just generally lighten your load or lift your heart. They have helped me and others, and I believe they will help you even when you need it.
I believe they will be good for others, some whom you will meet and others whom you will never see. Imagine, you can give something to help people you may never meet ...
I also believe that ‘whatever you spend He will repay’—that has been my personal experience over the years any time I have given or witnessed others give of what they gave towards a worthy cause or need.
 Other Ways You Can HelpMaybe you can't contribute, but you can still help:

Share this campaign with people in your social media, word of mouth, etc. [use the Indiegogo share tools!]
If you are a praying person, please join me and others in praying this through to completion. There are always MANY obstacles to any endeavor, ESPECIALLY the important and worthy ones...
  PerksREWARDS AND INCENTIVES (2:16) - Explanation of Rewards and Incentive for those who participate in this project I saved this for last, as I’m not too fond of gimmicky rewards and incentives, though I know it’s part of how things are done on this site and others--but I don’t want to spend a LOT of time on that aspect of things, so I’m making these ‘perks’ pretty limited and basic. Anyway, I truly believe that God will BLESS anyone who helps, and that any perks HE provides will be MUCH better anyhow.If you’ve ever visited my music site then you know that all my music has been available for free since the beginning…I’m a firm believer in ‘freely you have received, freely give.’ I do offer CDs at any events I participate in, but on my website you can get everything that's there for free or with a donation of your choice. Therefore (as a PERK) I will not be offering free digital downloads of the album upon completion…that will be offered to any and all, whether they choose to donate or not. So if you find that missing in the list of PERKS, that’s the reason why.
I WILL  be offering PRE-RELEASES, sent to you before they hit any of the sites I’ll be putting them on.
I will mail physical CDs of the HYMNS ALBUM upon completion to some; multiple copies of the CD for those who give more.
For the most generous donors, I can also offer on-line meetings, chats, virtual concerts, mini-concerts in your home, or concerts in your city, or yet-to-be-decided-between-us requests that you may come up with.
 MY BACKGROUND for those who DON’T know me:MY BACKGROUND, and SONG BITS (6:37) - My story in brief, and SONG SNIPPETS showing some of my music & what's available for downloadingI have been songwriting since age 16; went looking for truth around age 18 during the hippie movement, found it at age 20, at which point I turned my life over to Jesus. I went to work for Him fulltime, leaving family, country & career to bring His truth to the peoples of this big beautiful world: I never looked back, never regretted that decision.Over the years as a volunteer and missionary in many different countries, I’ve had the privilege to rub shoulders and work with many gifted musicians, singers and songwriters, and in those encounters I discovered many lovely gems—songs that touched me & moved me personally, helped me through some very difficult periods, or were key in sharing my faith or Jesus’ teachings with those who didn’t yet know Him, or who wanted to know Him better. I have recorded quite a few of those and you can find them on my website: jerrypaladino.bandcamp.com. P.S. TO ALL (1:15)A BIG thanks to my family, friends, and followers of my music productions: through the years you have all helped make my music ministry possible and my musical dreams come true for which I will be ETERNALLY grateful to you--Thank you for helping make it happen! May God indeed bless you in response to your generosity. If you want to discuss another way of donating to this cause, please contact me directly at my email: jerrypaladinomusic@gmail.com.

story:
ENGLISH FOLLOWED

? מי אנחנו

אנחנו "בין הקולות"- להקה משיחית ישראלית. הקמנו את הלהקה בשנת 2011 עוד כשהיינו בני 15.

.באותו הזמן התחלנו לכתוב ולהלחין שירים שאותם הקלטנו בבית

בשנת 2015 הוצאנו את האלבום  הראשון שלנו "ענף עץ שבור".  מאז האלבום הראשון הרבה השתנה: התגייסנו לצבא, סיימנו את השירות הצבאי, הופענו עם השירים מהאלבום, וגם צילמנו קליפ לשיר שלנו  "שוב״

Who are we?

We are Bain Hakolot (Between the Voices), a Messianic Israeli band. We founded the band in 2011 when we were at the age of 15.  At the time we started writing and recording our songs at home and were limited to using the built in microphone on our computer. 
In 2015, with your help, we published our first album "Anaf Etz Shavour".

We have done a lot since our first album. We joined the IDF (Israeli Defense Force), completed our military service, performed and filmed our first video clip- "Shuv".

 

 במהלך התקופה הזאת גם כתבנו שירים חדשים, שירים שמשקפים את האמונה שלנו כגברים צעירים בזמן  השירות הצבאי. שירים שאנחנו רוצים לחלוק עם כולכם כי אולי הם רלוונטים גם לכם

While serving in the IDF we found the time to write new songs. Songs that we feel represent our faith as young men during military service. Song we want to share with you and hoping you will be able to identify with. 

 

 

המסר שלנו

  אנחנו רואים את המוזיקה כדרך לדבר עם אנשים על הקשיים בחיים האלה והתקווה שיש באמונה. להציף  את ההתמודויות והנסיונות שכל אחד מאיתנו עובר, ולמצוא את הזהות האמיתית שלנו בישוע

Our Message

ֿWe see our music as a way of talk to people about the difficulties in life and the hope we have in our faith. To share the struggles and trials that each of us go through as we find our true identity in Christ.  

 

האתגר

 לא נצליח לממן את הפרוייקט החדש לבד בכוחות עצמנו. אנחנו רוצים שגם האלבום הזה יהיה איכותי ואפילו טוב יותר מהראשון. וזו הסיבה שאנחנו מבקשים את עזרתכם.

אחרי חישובים והערכות על העלויות הכרוחות בהוצאת האלבום החדש, הגענו אל הסכום.$14,000

:פירוט עלויות

:כך נשתמש בכסף שנגייס

:עליות הכרחיות

תופים-$ 2,000

בס- $ 600

נגנים(4)-1,100$

מקהלה-300$

מיקס/מאסטר-4,000$

אומנות כריכה-300$

הדפסה-2,300$

 

10,600$
 ———————————————————
:שאיפה

חולצות-100$

אוכל/דלק-700$

אומנים(2)-6,000$

קליפים-5,500$

 

11600$

 22,200 $ :סה״כ

The Challenge

 

We will not be able to fund this album by ourselves. We want this album to be even better then our first album, and that's the reason we are asking for your help!
The budget we've come up with is $14,000 to cover the most basic expenses of recording.  

 

Budget Breakdown

The money we raise will be spent as follows:

musts's:

Drums- $2,000
Bass- $600
Musicians (4)- $1,100 
Choir- $300
Mix/ Master - $4000 
Cover art- $300 
Printing- $2,300

 $ 10,600
———————————————————

Strech goal:   
T-shirts -   $ 100
Food/Gas- $ 700
Artest (2) -  $ 6,000
Music videos  -  $  5,500

 $ 11,600

  over all: 22,000$

story:
THE RETURN

I Am Abomination returns after a six year hiatus with the three founding members: Nick Sampson (Guitar), Phil Druyor (Vocals), and Brandon Good (Bass). Writing and recording drums on this album will be our good friend Chris Turner of the band "Oceans Ate Alaska."

After years of silence we are extraordinarily excited to show you what we have been working on. We are ready to bring you a full-length concept album entitled "Passion of the Heist II." This album is a direct sequel to our 2011 EP "Passion of the Heist," and our first new release since 2012. But we do need your support to make this a reality!

We are hard at work writing and recording this album currently. And we are excited for you to hear our first new single from Passion of the Heist II "Ultraterrestrial." 

 

 

In order for us to record the other nine new songs on the album we need your help. We're doing this album without any record label support or outside funding. We want to create a partnership with you, our fans, and together we can build the rest of this album from the ground up. And as you have heard from the other bands whom have crowdfunded albums it is not cheap to do so. 

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET

The process of writing, recording, and releasing an album is incredibly expensive. It's something we simply cannot afford to properly do without help. Further down we have a breakdown of the budget in its entirety. We want to be as transparent as possible about where your contributions will be going. 

If by chance we exceed our goals then we already have plans to where the extra funds will be heading. We think these are all things that you will be as excited about as we are! We will be announcing our stretch goals in the coming days.

*Black Friday Deals Now Available In Limited Quantities*

THE IMPACT

By you partnering with us and helping make Passion of the Heist II you be taking a part of a revolution in the music industry. Instead of a corporation controlling when and how the music you consume is created, you get to take control. We, the band, and you, the fans, get to create a partnership and make this album the way we want to make it. 

We know this will be the greatest album we have created yet. We know that with your support we won't have to take any shortcuts like we have in the past. We know you be excited about where your funding goes during the process of this albums creation and release. We know that we can do this together.

PASSION OF THE HEIST II

Passion of the Heist II is a conceptual album that directly follows the story from the original Passion of the Heist. In the original EP you followed the story of a man being abducted by extraterrestrials and transformed into their leader only to lead an invasion against humanity. The album ended when the invasion began. 

This new album tells the story of the invasion from two distinct characters perspectives. Half of the songs are from the perspective of the character from the original EP (The Ultraterrestrial), and the other half of the songs are from a new characters perspective. This character is a desperate and broken man who vows to save humanity. 

Musically this is our most progressive and challenging album to date. We are writing the songs to fit the story of the lyrics. We are trying to create a cinematic experience through an audio outlet. And of course we're making this our heaviest, shreddiest, most soulful, and powerful album to date.

We plan on having some friends perform guest spots throughout the album. So there will also be some vocals and instrumental work spread throughout the album from other artists that you already know and love. Not to mention that Chris Turner from Oceans Ate Alaska will be writing and recording all of the drums on the album! 

Passion of the Heist II is going to be our most ambitious album to date. And we cannot wait to partner up with you for its creation! 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

We know that not all of you can currently spare the money to help fund this album. But that does not mean that you cannot take a part in the partnership of its creation. Spreading the word to as many people as possible can be just as powerful as helping fund it.

So please SHARE, SHARE, SHARE!!! You can share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, by word of mouth, letting websites and other news outlets know about it, or by simply screaming from the top of the nearest mountain. 

Every single time you let someone know about this it can help bring us that much closer to accomplishing our goals.

THE BUDGET

Below you will find our estimations of all of the expenses that are going into the creation of this album. And as many of you know, Nick Sampson is a full-time music Producer; so these rates are heavily discounted compared to what most bands would typically have to spend. Brandon is also a full-time Graphic Artist, so these rates are also heavily discounted. The three of us live in different parts of the country (Nick is in Detroit, Phil is in New Orleans, and Brandon is in Portland) so there are some unavoidable travel expenses as well. 

EXPENSES: 

  • Production Expenses = $15,000 (Production, Mixing, Mastering, Studio Gear, Studio Musicians, Studio Rental Fees, Engineering, Etc.)
  • Artwork Expenses = $1,800 (Album Art, Merchandise Designs, Ad & Marketing Designs, Packaging Design, Etc.)
  • Video Expenses = 1,750 (Indiegogo Video, Music Visualiser, Ads & Marketing, Etc) 
  • Other Expenses = $1,600 (Travel, Time Away From Day Jobs, Per Diems, Etc.)
  • Cost of Goods = $3,570 (Merch, CDS, Vinyl, Tablature Books, Warehouse Fees, Fulfillment Fees, Etc.)
  • Marketing Expenses = $1,200
  • Campaign Fees = $3,080 (11%) (Indiegogo takes 5%, Credit Cards take 3%, Backerkit takes 3%)
  • Grand Total = $28,000

NICK SAMPSON CUSTOM BUILT GUITAR

For all backers who spend $45.00 or more you automatically get entered into a raffle. The winner of this raffle will receive a custom-made/hand-built guitar from Nick Sampson. These guitars are designed and built from scratch by Nick.

A video of Nick playing one of his custom guitars can be found in this campaigns video section. 

All guitars claimed will be serialized and marked with campaign specific inlay. If anyone has serious inquiries about claiming one of these limited guitars send an email to nick@sampsound.com

*Production of the guitars will start after the release of the album*

Video Expenses = 1,750 (Indiegogo Video, Music Visualiser, Ads & Marketing, Etc) 

Other Expenses = $1,600 (Travel, Time Away From Day Jobs, Per Diems, Etc.)

Cost of Goods = $3,570 (Merch, CDS, Vinyl, Tablature Books, Warehouse Fees, Fulfillment Fees, Etc.)
Marketing Expenses = $1,200

Campaign Fees = $3,080 (11%) (Indiegogo takes 5%, Credit Cards take 3%, Backerkit takes 3%)
Grand Total = $28,000

NICK SAMPSON CUSTOM BUILT GUITAR
For all backers who spend $45.00 or more you automatically get entered into a raffle. The winner of this raffle will receive a custom-made/hand-built guitar from Nick Sampson. These guitars are designed and built from scratch by Nick. 
A video of Nick playing one of his custom guitars can be found in this campaigns video section. 
All guitars claimed will be serialized and marked with campaign specific inlay. If anyone has serious inquiries about claiming one of these limited guitars send an email to nick@sampsound.com
*Production of the guitars will start after the release of the album*

story:
Our Campaign:

We are the members of Legendary Skies, an instrumental rock band from Austin, Texas. We released our debut album in 2015, were fortunate to tour, and came back with determination to create a meaningful second album.

We wrote, re-worked, rehearsed, and scrutinized this music over many months until we had a collection of songs we could be immensely proud of.

Our goal now is to share this collection with you and ask for your support to help our band go further.

Why We Are Campaigning:

We decided to start a crowdfunding campaign to offer our supporters unique experiences and bundles that go beyond a digital download. Our perks have expanded as well, adding specially crafted songs around your story, or covers of your favorite songs in the style of Legendary Skies!

With our fundraising goal met, we will still be one step closer to realizing our vision of releasing our sophomore album, Navigation.

The Impact:

As a small, indie band, we truly rely on your contributions to be able to release music. Your funds go to more than just a CD and a T-Shirt. They help Legendary Skies forge new opportunities and motivate us to create new music.

In our 2015 fundraiser, generous support from friends and family allowed us to go above our fundraising goal of $10,000. Meeting that goal was a huge milestone for Legendary Skies, and it allowed us to give Novarupta a stand-out debut. With your help, we aim to achieve the same for Navigation.

The Challenge:

Releasing an album is costly and has its risks. Being able to crowd fund allows us to effectively allocate our resources in an a effort to maximize our album release. Crowdfunding also allows us to offer unique perks that facilitate a deeper connection with those who are supporting us.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you decide to contribute, we are immensely grateful for your support. If you feel uncomfortable contributing,  there are other ways you can help. Please share our campaign through Facebook or Instagram. Face-to-face mentions will help us as well!

Please like us on Facebook and Instagram to see all news about our campaign and album release. We are excited for you to experience Navigation.

story:
Just another radio station? Definitely NOT!

Local radio in the UK has changed over the past 10 years.  After a series of mergers, acquisitions and takeovers it seems the idea of a local radio station all the family can enjoy are gone - and that's why we are here!

Broadcasting 24 hours a day and available on your phone, tablet, laptop or desktop - and with a very familiar name - Chiltern Radio is set to return on Monday 11 March 2019 as a truly localised station for the three counties of Bedfordshire, Buckinghamshire & Hertfordshire.  We are a not-for-profit social enterprise, with every penny re-invested in the service - but we need your help to get the project up and running!

Our exciting station will target the 40+ audience, harnessing the latest technologies to deliver a vibrant localised radio station with a mix of music, news, sport, weather, travel, community information - everything that Chiltern Radio offered but now re-invented for 2019.

You can listen to our test transmissions on the myTuner website - just click here.

 

What We Need & What We Can Offer:

We need to raise £6,500 to launch the station.  Much of the preparatory work has already been done. We have trademarked the name, test transmissions are underway via our website, the studio is built and some presenters have been found.  If we can't raise all of the money in this crowd funding bid, we plan to run again minus whatever we have raised.  Provided the vital licence fees can be covered we are guaranteed to launch on time even if it has to be a limited service.

The funding we seek will allow us to operate for two years, by which time we will have won an audience and be able to sell advertising to fund our future plans to broadcast as a DAB station. 

In return for your support we have put together some reward packages which we think will be of interest and ensure that Chiltern Radio really rocks!  Part of our reward scheme includes advertising on our website as banner ads, programme feature sponsorship and conventional radio advertisements - so for the first year in order to honour these commitments we will not actively try to sell more.

We have produced a multi-page document which details the entire ILR project in some detail, if you want to read it you'll be able to download a *.pdf version here. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help:

If you want to support Chiltern Radio but can't afford to help financially, we would certainly love to hear from you.  If you'd like more information you can email info@chilternradio.net, contact us via our Facebook page or call us on 0330 043 5705 (Monday-Friday 09:00-17:00).

story:
WHO WE ARE

Communication and the delivery of ideas is at the heart of why we make music. Whether investigating the human condition, culture, or history through music, we choose our projects and create our programs to be about something. We defy genre and break down the walls of tradition, reimagining and redefining the classical music experience…

We are the Catalyst.

Hailed by the New York Times at their Carnegine Hall debut as "invariably energetic and finely burnished...playing with earthly vigor," Catalyst Quartet is comprised of top Laureates and alumni of the internationally acclaimed Sphinx Competition. Their programming ranges from traditional and obscure works from the classical music tradition, to collaborations across genre and medium that invite and challenge audiences to a new understanding of the 21st century string quartet.

 

UNCOVERED

Over the course of time there have been many overlooked artists in classical music, especially because of their race or gender. It is important to acknowledge that we have not yet heard the whole story due to this sidelining of musical voices. Composers like Samuel Coleridge-Taylor, Florence B. Price, and Coleridge-Taylor Perkinson have contributed beautifully crafted work to the repertoire but are not widely celebrated because quality recordings and performances of their music are rare or non existent. With this recording project we are helping to change this unfortunate reality.

THE MUSIC

Samuel Coleridge-Taylor

Piano Quintet in G Major Op. 1

5 Fantasiestucke Op.5

Clarinet Quintet in F sharp minor Op. 10

 

Florence B. Price

String Quartet in G Major (1929)

Five Folksongs in Counterpoint (1951)

 

Coleridge-Taylor Perkinson

String Quartet No. 1 "Calvary"

 

*This album will be a DOUBLE DISK feature! More than 2 hours of music!

 

GUEST ARTISTS

We are thrilled and honored to have these wonderful musicians joining us on this album!

STEWART GOODYEAR

Proclaimed "a phenomenon" by the Los Angeles Times and "one of the best pianists of his generation" by the Philadelphia Inquirer, Stewart Goodyear is an accomplished young pianist as a concerto soloist, chamber musician, recitalist and composer. Mr. Goodyear has performed with major orchestras of the world , including the Philadelphia Orchestra, New York Philharmonic, Chicago Symphony, Pittsburgh Symphony, San Francisco Symphony, Los Angeles Philharmonic, Cleveland Orchestra, Academy of St Martin in the Fields, Bournemouth Symphony, Frankfurt Radio Symphony, MDR Symphony Orchestra (Leipzig),  Montreal Symphony, Toronto Symphony Orchestra, Dallas Symphony , Atlanta Symphony, Baltimore Symphony, Detroit Symphony, Seattle Symphony, Mostly Mozart Festival Orchestra, Royal Liverpool Philharmonic, and NHK Symphony Orchestra.

Mr. Goodyear began his training at The Royal Conservatory in Toronto, received his bachelor's degree from Curtis Institute of Music, and completed his master's at The Juilliard School. Known as an improviser and composer, he has been commissioned by orchestras and chamber music organizations, and performs his own solo works.  Last year, Mr. Goodyear premiered his suite for piano and orchestra, "Callaloo", with Kristjan Jarvi and MDR Symphony Orchestra in Leipzig, and last summer, the Clarosa Quartet premiered his Piano Quartet commissioned by the Kingston Chamber Music Festival. Mr. Goodyear performed all 32 Beethoven Piano Sonatas in one day at Koerner Hall, McCarter Theatre, the Mondavi Center, and the AT&T Performing Arts Center in Dallas.

Mr. Goodyear's discography includes Beethoven's Complete Piano Sonatas (which received a Juno nomination for Best Classical Solo Recording in 2014) and Diabelli Variations for the Marquis Classics label, Tchaikovsky First Piano Concerto and Grieg's Piano Concerto, and Rachmaninov's Piano Concertos No. 2 and 3, both recorded with the Czech National Symphony under Stanislav Bogunia and Hans Matthias Forster respectively, and released to critical acclaim on the Steinway and Sons label. His Rachmaninov recording received a Juno nomination for Best Classical Album for Soloist and Large Ensemble Accompaniment. Also for Steinway and Sons is Mr. Goodyear's recording of his own transcription of Tchaikovsky's "The Nutcracker (Complete Ballet)", which was released October 2015 and was chosen by the New York Times as one of the best classical music recordings of 2015. Mr. Goodyear's recording of Ravel's piano works was released in the spring of 2017, and his new recording "For Glenn Gould", that combines repertoire performed by Gould in his US and Montreal debuts, has been released this past March.

Highlights of the 2018-19 season are his debut with Chineke! at Queen Elizabeth Hall in London, return engagements with the Philadelphia Orchestra, Toronto, Vancouver and Victoria Symphony orchestras, and three recitals for the Chamber Music Society of Detroit. He has been commissioned to write a work for piano and orchestra for the Toronto Symphony, and it will be premiered January 2019.

ANTHONY MCGILL

Clarinetist Anthony McGill is one of classical music’s most recognizable and brilliantly multifaceted figures. He serves as the principal clarinet of the New York Philharmonic — that orchestra’s first African-American principal player — and maintains a dynamic international solo and chamber music career. Hailed for his “trademark brilliance, penetrating sound and rich character” (The New York Times), as well as for his “exquisite combination of technical refinement and expressive radiance” (The Baltimore Sun), McGill also serves as an ardent advocate for helping music education reach underserved communities and for addressing issues of diversity, equity, and inclusion in classical music. McGill was honored to take part in the inauguration of President Barack Obama, premiering a piece written for the occasion by John Williams and performing alongside violinist Itzhak Perlman, cellist Yo-Yo Ma, and pianist Gabriela Montero.

McGill’s 2018-19 season includes performances of concertos by Bolcom, Copland, Mozart, and Strauss with the New York Philharmonic, Los Angeles Chamber Orchestra, Tallahassee Symphony, Vermont Symphony, and Austin Symphonic Band. He will also collaborate together with soprano Miah Persson in a performance of Schubert’s “The Shepherd on the Rock” together with Iván Fischer and the New York Philharmonic. Additional performances include a collaboration with the Dover Quartet for the Philadelphia Chamber Music Society and a recital with soprano Julia Bullock for the Metropolitan Museum of Art, along with collaborations with the Brentano Quartet for Princeton University and a tour of Asia with the Chamber Music Society of Lincoln Center.

McGill appears regularly as a soloist with top orchestras around North America including the New York Philharmonic, Metropolitan Opera, Baltimore Symphony, San Diego Symphony, and Kansas City Symphony. As a chamber musician, McGill is a favorite collaborator of the Brentano, Daedalus, Guarneri, JACK, Miró, Pacifica, Shanghai, Takacs, and Tokyo Quartets, as well as Emanuel Ax, Inon Barnatan, Gloria Chien, Yefim Bronfman, Gil Shaham, Midori, Mitsuko Uchida, and Lang Lang. He has led tours with Musicians from Marlboro and regularly performs for the Chamber Music Society of Lincoln Center and the Philadelphia Chamber Music Society. Festival appearances include Tanglewood, Marlboro, Mainly Mozart, Music@Menlo, and the Santa Fe, Seattle, and Skaneateles Chamber Music Festivals.

In January 2015, McGill recorded the Nielsen Clarinet Concerto together with Alan Gilbert and the New York Philharmonic, which was released on DaCapo Records. He also recorded an album together with his brother Demarre McGill, principal flute of the Seattle Symphony, and pianist Michael McHale; and one featuring the Mozart and Brahms Clarinet Quintet with the Pacifica Quartet that were both released by Cedille Records.

A dedicated champion of new music, in 2014, McGill premiered a new piece written for him by Richard Danielpour entitled “From the Mountaintop” that was commissioned by the New Jersey Symphony, Kansas City Symphony, and Orchestra 2001. McGill served as the 2015-16 Artist-in-Residence for WQXR and has appeared on Performance Today, MPR’s St. Paul Sunday Morning, and Mr. Roger’s Neighborhood. In 2013, McGill appeared on the NBC Nightly News and on MSNBC, in stories highlighting the McGill brothers’ inspirational story.

A graduate of the Curtis Institute of Music, McGill previously served as the principal clarinet of the Metropolitan Opera and associate principal clarinet of the Cincinnati Symphony Orchestra. In-demand as a teacher, he serves on the faculty of the Juilliard School, the Curtis Institute of Music, Bard College’s Conservatory of Music, and the Manhattan School of Music. He also serves as the Artistic Advisor for the Music Advancement Program at the Juilliard School, on the Board of Directors for both the League of American Orchestra and the Harmony Program, and the advisory council for the InterSchool Orchestras of New York.

 

HOW YOU CAN HELP

With your generous support you will not only help us make this album, but you will also be helping to share this amazing repertoire with the world.

Your contributions will go towards the following costs:

Engineer, Mixing + Mastering for this DOUBLE DISK album

Hall Rental

CD Printing

Album Design

PR

*Thanks to our fiscal sponsors, the Sphinx Organization, all donations to this campaign are TAX DEDUCTIBLE. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this campaign with everyone you know!

story:
Short Summary

When people ask why I recorded this album, my response has always been for love of music. In a world where you can stream music for free, my hope is to prove that people still support the art of music. The honest truth is recording music cost money. This record is a glimpse into "My Little Life." 

This past July, I headed to Georgia to recorded a 10 song LP called "My Little Life." The debut solo album was produced by myself and The Nashes. It was engineered and mixed by Jon Ashley (Engineered 2018 Grammy-Winning Rock Album-War On Drugs).  The Nashes happen to be my brother in law Kalen Nash (Ponderosa/New West Records) and my sister Aslyn (Capitol Records). All three of these individuals poured a lot of heart and musicianship into my record and I'm happy for the world to finally here it.  

The record consist of the following songs: Let Me Be, Hey Little Sunshine, Beautiful, Richer, It's You, Hold On, Ever So Holy, Let It Ride, Call Out To You, & My Little Life.

What We Need & What You Get

The record ended up costing $17,500. That included studio time, engineer, producer, musicians, mixing, mastering, artwork, and CD duplication. 

There are different levels on ways you can help from ordering a digital download of the record  before it's officially released to paying off the record. If someone pays off the record, all sales from the record in 2019 will be donated to Hurricane Michael victims. 

The Impact

Sometimes in life, you know you are suppose to do something. This is one of those projects where I felt God saying "trust me with this."  The idea of this project is that no matter who you are, what your age, everyone can have an impact on others. 

As many of you know, my heart has always gone out to the victims of Hurricane Michael. When we set up the relief station in Lynn Haven two days after the storm, I knew that we needed live music & music playing. A couple days later, I showed up with our Rock On The Road mobile stage and sound system. I saw firsthand how nerves were calmed with music. I've decided that for every person that purchases my album, I will give away a copy to a victim of Hurricane Michael. There are few things in the works on how to distribute the album to hurricane victims. When it happens, I'll let you all know.  

Other Ways You Can Help

I know for some people, they may can't help financially. I totally get it. One way you can help is by sharing the link on social media and spreading the word about "My Little Life." God bless all of you!

There are few things in the works on how to distribute the album to hurricane victims. When it happens, I'll let you all know.  
Other Ways You Can Help
I know for some people, they may can't help financially. I totally get it. One way you can help is by sharing the link on social media and spreading the word about "My Little Life." God bless all of you!

story:
Versión en español véase abajo.

Short Summary

The Orchestra of the Tropical Forests serves as a platform for the promotion and dissemination of the arts created by indigenous and rural peoples of Costa Rica. Its purpose is to revitalize and raise awareness about caring for the country’s tropical forests, which are threatened by large extensions of monoculture crops, such as pineapple and sugar cane among others. At the same time, the orchestra seeks to promote the cultures of those peoples and communities that have preserved these territories for centuries. We will realize all this through music. Our orchestra is an integrated model that combines arts, manual work, and education in the rural context of agroecology and food sovereignty; in pursuit of a harmonic and sonorous impact for each person who has been involved and touched by this musical project.

Who & Where We Are

The Orchestra of the Tropical Forests is a project of Casa Madremonte, an independent cultural center, created by the multidisciplinary Costa Rican artist Guadalupe Urbina, a place where arts, el Buen Vivir, and spirituality go hand in hand with the forest. (https://urbinaart.wixsite.com/casamadremonte)

We are people who are concerned about the destruction of the tropical ecosystems in Costa Rica’s southern region and with the loss of the local knowledges still alive in these ecosystems. We want to care for, learn from, and spread our green sanctuary to secure its long life. And long life – Longo Maï – is the name of the village where we want to make sound and sing to the tropical forests of Costa Rica, in order to share with you its music, its medicine, and its beauty.

Longo Maï is a small agricultural village with a culturally diverse population. Here live indigenous people, Central American refugees, Costa Ricans displaced by poverty and after forty years we have become to be a community with great culinary wealth, with knowledges of traditional medicine, and music.

Impact

With the Orchestra of the Tropical Forests we promote the social and ecological integration and transformation in our village and the southern region. The orchestra offers the opportunity for all who are interested in making and learning the music that promotes its cultures; to build, invent, and sell instruments and in that way promote our village, the work of our people and the communal life: el Buen Vivir.

What We Need & What We Can Offer You

The Orchestra of the Tropical Forests is just being born. It will be inaugurated during the Festival Madremonte Longo Maï (February 15, 16, 17 2019) (https://urbinaart.wixsite.com/casamadremonte/fe...).

To fully realize our dream, we need working spaces where we can practice, host workshops, and build, exhibit, and sell our handmade instruments. We are in the process of planning a gallery, storage room for instruments, and classroom – solid structures made from affordable local materials from the region. The designers are ready, we have multiple partnering agencies, and a corps of volunteers.

We need your help raising $4,000 to build the structures and pay the person in charge of the direction of the construction.

We are very grateful for any contribution. We also offer some perks (optional) to demonstrate our gratitude.       
For donations in the amount of:

50$ … we’ll paint your name on one of the new building’s walls.
100$ … we’ll paint your name and give you 2 songs of Guadalupe’s disc ‘Cantos Simples del Amor de la Tierra’.
200$ … we’ll paint your name and give you 4 songs of Guadalupe’s Disc.
500$ … we’ll paint your name and give you the full Disc.
1000$ … we’ll paint your name, give you the full disc, and offer you a guided tour in our village, the primary forest in our community, a visit to our ancestor’s petroglyphs, ending up with a swim in the river to later get to know Casa Madremonte and its edible and medicinal garden, and of course the Music Center for the Tropical Forests; if you decide to come to visit us.

Please send us an email to cadisur2012@gmail.com if you donated and are interested in the corresponding gifts.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute financially, that does not mean you cannot help us! Please, spread the word, our video, and make some noise about our Orchestra! We are deeply thankful for your time and support to help us reach our goal.

__________________________________________________________________________

Centro de Música para la Selva Tropical

Link al video con subtítulos en español: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Rbq6cXcm154

Resumen Corto

La Orquesta de las Selvas Tropicales es una plataforma de promoción y difusión del arte creado por los Pueblos originarios y rurales de Costa Rica, para revitalizar y concientizar sobre el cuidado de las selvas tropicales que se encuentran amenazadas por las grandes extensiones de monocultivos (como la caña y la piña) y a la vez promover las culturas de los pueblos y comunidades que durante siglos han preservado estos territorios. Todo lo haremos a través de la música. Nuestra orquesta es un modelo integral que combina el arte, el trabajo manual y la formación en el contexto rural, la agroecología y la soberanía alimentaria; en pos de un impacto armónico y sonoro en cada persona que es tocada e involucrada en este proyecto musical.

Quiénes somos, dónde estamos

La Orquesta de las Selvas Tropicales es un proyecto de Casa Madremonte, centro cultural independiente creado por la artista multidisciplinaria costarricense Guadalupe Urbina, un lugar en donde el arte, el Buen Vivir y la espiritualidad se dan la mano con la selva. [https://urbinaart.wixsite.com/casamadremonte]

Somos personas preocupadas por la destrucción de los ecosistemas tropicales de la zona Sur de Costa Rica y la pérdida de los conocimientos locales aún vivos en ellos. Queremos cuidar, aprender y difundir nuestro santuario verde para que tenga larga vida. Y larga vida – Longo Maï – es el nombre del pueblo en donde queremos hacer sonar y cantar a las selvas tropicales de Costa Rica, para compartir con ustedes su música, su medicina y su belleza.

Longo Maï es un pequeño pueblo agrícola con una población culturalmente diversa. Hay indígenas, hay refugiados centroamericanos, costarricenses desplazados de la pobreza y después de cuarenta años hemos llegado a ser una comunidad con una gran riqueza culinaria, con conocimientos de la tradición medicinal y la música.

Impacto

Con la Orquesta de las Selvas Tropicales promovemos la integración y transformación social y ecológica en nuestro pueblo Longo Maï y la región Sur. La Orquesta abre la oportunidad a todas y todos quienes están interesados en hacer y aprender la música que promueve estas culturas; a construir, inventar y vender instrumentos y de esta manera promover nuestro pueblo, el trabajo de nuestra gente y la vida comunitaria: el Buen Vivir.

Qué necesitamos y qué te podemos ofrecer

La Orquesta de las Selvas Tropicales está naciendo. Vamos a tener nuestra apertura en el Festival Madremonte Longo Maï (15, 16, 17 de febrero 2019) (https://urbinaart.wixsite.com/casamadremonte/fe...).

Para poder realizar nuestro sueño necesitamos espacios de trabajo, donde podemos ensayar, recibir talleres, y construir, exhibir y vender nuestros instrumentos artesanales. Estamos en el proceso de planificar una plataforma o cobertizo y dos módulos, uno para construir y el otra para exhibición y venta de nuestros instrumentos. El diseño ya está, también contamos con gente voluntaria de nuestra comunidad, del Circo FantazzTico de Pérez Zeledón y más personas con ánimos de ayudarnos a lessvantar nuestro Centro de Música para la Selva Tropical. Haremos una construcción sencilla, pero sólida, hecha con materiales de la zona.

Necesitamos tu ayuda para conseguir $4,000 para la construcción y poder pagar a la persona responsable de dirigir la construcción.

Agradecemos mucho cualquier contribución que nos puedas brindar. También tenemos unos regalos (opcional) con los que te queremos mostrar nuestro agradecimiento.
Para donaciones de:

50$ … pintamos tu nombre en una de las paredes de la construcción.
100$ … pintamos tu nombre más te regalamos 2 canciones del álbum ‘Cantos Simples del Amor de la Tierra’ de Guadalupe Urbina.
200$ … pintamos tu nombre más te regalamos 4 canciones del álbum.
500$ … pintamos tu nombre más te regalamos el álbum completo.
1000$ … pintamos tu nombre, te regalamos en álbum completo y te ofrecemos un tour por nuestro pueblo, el bosque primario de nuestra comunidad, visita de los petrograbados de nuestros ancestros, terminando con un rico baño en el río para después conocer Casa Madremonte con su jardín comestible y medicinal y por supuesto el Centro de Música para la Selva Tropical; si decides venir a visitarnos.

Por favor escríbanos un correo a cadisur2012@gmail.com si donaste y estás interesado en los regalos correspondientes.

Otras maneras en las que nos puedes ayudar

Si no puedes apoyarnos económicamente ¡no significa que no nos puedes ayudar! Por favor, comparta nuestro proyecto y el video con tus amigos, familiares y conocidos. Te agradecemos profundamente tu tiempo y apoyo para poder lograr nuestra meta.

story:
Short Summary

I Am…

A Russian Immigrant , Pianist, Composer, Writer, Entrepreneur,

Runner, Cat Lover......Vegetarian

What I Need 

I'm looking to raise $20,000 to start with. What I need to complete the project is $25,000. To realize my ultimate vision for the project (which includes renting a performing space, advertising and recording expenses for a new album)

In order for this to happen there are 3 things that I'd love for you to do right now:

Pick your reward (to the right)

Contribute  

Help spread the word!!

 

You'll get...

Some super sweet perks!

New & Old music you never heard before. 

Tickets to my performances. 

Or me, in your living room, playing the piano !!!

Songs to move you and give you some joy in this trying time.

My love

 

 

You'll help...

    Tell untold stories.

    Heal a divided country.

    People to listen.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If it's not possible to financially contribute towards my campaign, it's cool, I get it! That being said, there are some things you can do that would make a huge difference and don't cost a thing.

It would be AMAZING if you could share my video or campaign through your social media or have a yarn to your aunt, dad, boss, girlfriend, bartender, neighbour....you never know who's going to want to help turn this dream into reality.

Thank you so much.

story:
Short Summary

Jake Rat Neumann began laying groundwork for Causettes in Winter of 2018, with work experience in two previous independent record labels, and over a decade in New York City Nightlife as a performer, deejay, and event sponsorship coordinator. Jake also brings decades of fundraising experience from work among Non-Profit organizations including the Anti-Defamation League, National & California Abortion Rights Action Leagues, Citizen Action of Wisconsin, and PBS - Public Television. 

Causettes is not a record label... Causettes is a network.

  • Bridging the gap between independent recording artists and humanitarian organizations; Causettes provides proof that artists, fans and art communities that independent events can turn big results.
  • Causettes Volumes 1, 2 and 3 will expand fan exposure and merchandise for 72 recording artists and raise over $2,340 to assist humanitarian causes, helping to cover legal, medical and travel expenses to those in need. 
  • In campaigns to come, Volumes 4 through 12 are projected to raise an additional $6,000 to $7,500 after completion of sales. 
  • Causettes will never seek to own rights to the musical works of its contributors. Instead, our board members will be available to provide consultation to musicians on issues of publishing and copyrights.
  • Causettes has a five year business plan in place, eventually owning partial means of production (expanded duplication machinery, co-op recording studio, and print services). Owning partial means of production will increase our profit margin from 34% to over 50%. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • A combined $4,500 is needed to launch Causettes Volume 1, 2 and 3. 
  • See above "Campaign Overview" or send us a message for more info on expense breakdowns.
  • Contributors at the $30 to $59 level will receive Volumes 1, 2 and 3 (domestic postage paid) with complimentary admission to Causettes Volume 1 Showcase Event on June 22nd at Gran Torino, in Brooklyn, NY.
  • At the $60 to $99 level, contributors receive all three cassette compilations, plus complimentary entry to all three NYC showcase concerts.
  • Contributions of $100 to $299 will receive one limited and signed print of Causettes Vol. 1 poster art, in addition to all three cassette compilations and plus complimentary entry to all three NYC showcase concerts.
  • At the $300 to $499 level, contributors receive limited and signed prints of poster art of Causettes Vol. 1, and also signed prints of art of Volumes 2 and 3.  
  • Friends contributing $500 to $1000 will receive all the above perks, plus invitations to private events in NYC and beyond.  
  • In the event that less than $4,500 is raised for Volumes 1, 2 and 3, then Volume 1 will be released with a combination of existing funds, or a loan from Causettes founder, Jake Rat Neumann. We simply will keep trying!

The Impact

  • Jake's previous cassette compilations (No Red Tape label), sold a combined 800 copies. This was in 2009 and 2010, a decade before the current cassette revival. For example, large corporate brands such as Urban Outfitters having been stocking "walkman" style cassette recorders over the past 20 months. 
  • Cassette culture currently appeals to four generations of music lovers, from Boomers to Gen X and Millenials, with steadily rising interest from Gen Z, as documented by Crain's and Business Insider. 
  • Not every artist has opportunities to play at large fundraisers like Farm Aid or sing on "We Are the World", but within the boutique scale of Causettes an independent artist or group can contribute to results that are tangible, transparent and easily documented. 
  • Our online magazine will give artists the opportunity to interview one another, and be published in a professionally edited format, internationally available online.

Risks & Challenges

  • Problem: Storage. We are located in New York City where space is scarce.
    • Answer: TBD. We are working on it. 
  • Problem: Possible future changes in sales trends of the cassette format. 
    • Answer #1: Explore possibilities for streaming by developing a mobile application which would pay our artists at a higher rate than any existing streaming services.
    • Answer #2:  All volumes of Causettes come with a free download card, from which tracks can be transferred from desktop to mobile devices.
    • Answer #3: Contributors at the $300 level receive a customized portable Cassette to MP3 player  within the perks package. 
  • Problem: Causettes is currently running as a "dba" of No Red Tape Music, Inc., a for-profit corporation. We are not a Non-Profit, therefor contributions are not tax-deductible. Our five year plan includes only options for operating as an LLC, or transitioning to a Public Benefit Corp. This still does not make contributions tax-deductible.
    • Answer #1: We craft the Causettes series with a high degree of curation and care, so any tax benefit on a $25 to $1000 contribution  will not surpass the enjoyment and piece of mind one may experience from our ongoing cassette compilations, concert series, and additional collectible merchandise 
    • Answer #2: In the future, Causettes may consider partnering with Non-Profit organizations so that volunteers may receive services-in-kind documentation. This development would be considered on a case-by-case basis per event.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Join the Causettes Street Team. Inquire about promotional materials.
  • Interview a Causettes artist for our online magazine. 
  • Good with spreadsheets? Volunteer an hour or two each month on our advisory panel.
  • Are you a deejay or musicologist? Inquire about curating future compilations on Causettes. 
  • Spread the word about Causettes, with IndieGogo sharing tools for social media. 
  • Support local music and protect small music venues by attending not only concerts, but also neighborhood board meetings. Advocate locally by protecting late night noise!

In the event that less than $4,500 is raised for Volumes 1, 2 and 3, then Volume 1 will be released with a combination of existing funds, or a loan from Causettes founder, Jake Rat Neumann. We simply will keep trying!


The Impact

Jake's previous cassette compilations (No Red Tape label), sold a combined 800 copies. This was in 2009 and 2010, a decade before the current cassette revival. For example, large corporate brands such as Urban Outfitters having been stocking "walkman" style cassette recorders over the past 20 months. 
Cassette culture currently appeals to four generations of music lovers, from Boomers to Gen X and Millenials, with steadily rising interest from Gen Z, as documented by Crain's and Business Insider. 
Not every artist has opportunities to play at large fundraisers like Farm Aid or sing on "We Are the World", but within the boutique scale of Causettes an independent artist or group can contribute to results that are tangible, transparent and easily documented. 
Our online magazine will give artists the opportunity to interview one another, and be published in a professionally edited format, internationally available online.


Risks & Challenges

Problem: Storage. We are located in New York City where space is scarce.Answer: TBD. We are working on it. 

Problem: Possible future changes in sales trends of the cassette format. 
Answer #1: Explore possibilities for streaming by developing a mobile application which would pay our artists at a higher rate than any existing streaming services.
Answer #2:  All volumes of Causettes come with a free download card, from which tracks can be transferred from desktop to mobile devices.
Answer #3: Contributors at the $300 level receive a customized portable Cassette to MP3 player  within the perks package. 


Problem: Causettes is currently running as a "dba" of No Red Tape Music, Inc., a for-profit corporation. We are not a Non-Profit, therefor contributions are not tax-deductible. Our five year plan includes only options for operating as an LLC, or transitioning to a Public Benefit Corp. This still does not make contributions tax-deductible.
Answer #1: We craft the Causettes series with a high degree of curation and care, so any tax benefit on a $25 to $1000 contribution  will not surpass the enjoyment and piece of mind one may experience from our ongoing cassette compilations, concert series, and additional collectible merchandise 
Answer #2: In the future, Causettes may consider partnering with Non-Profit organizations so that volunteers may receive services-in-kind documentation. This development would be considered on a case-by-case basis per event.




Other Ways You Can Help

Join the Causettes Street Team. Inquire about promotional materials.
Interview a Causettes artist for our online magazine. 
Good with spreadsheets? Volunteer an hour or two each month on our advisory panel.
Are you a deejay or musicologist? Inquire about curating future compilations on Causettes. 
Spread the word about Causettes, with IndieGogo sharing tools for social media. 
Support local music and protect small music venues by attending not only concerts, but also neighborhood board meetings. Advocate locally by protecting late night noise!

story:
• SOUNDBALL - ARE YOU READY FOR THE NEXT BIG THING?

Soundball is an innovative musical instrument and the ultimate combination of MUSIC, SPORTS and TEAM WORK. Soundball consists of musical bats and a special soundball. Each bat produces a different musical note when it strikes the ball. The bats come in eight different colors according to the note they produce. 

No prior musical knowlege is needed!

The official Sounball kit comes with a colorful music sheet booklet so you can play a variety of musical pieces right from the start.

  • CAN YOU REACH THE LAST NOTE?

In order to play and create music you must work together, with at least one partner. Team work makes the Soundball challenge fun and exciting. 
SOUNDBALL can be played with as many players as you like, depending on the number of bats you own. 

  • WHO WILL BE THE NEXT SOUNBALL HERO?

Soundball is suitable for children as well as adults and can be used for teaching music, playing music, as a music therapy tool, in group dynamics or just for the sake of music, fun and sports.

The idea of Soundball came to me when I was driving home a few years back, and it has never left my mind since.

Hello world! My name is Omer and I'm a music teacher and a music therapist.

In my job I realized that starting to play an instrument is not always easy, and it usually involves practicing independantly or with a music teacher. Therefore, I tried to figure out a way for people to enjoy music from the first moment, without any prior musical education and with the help of their friends and family. 

 

NOW IT IS TIME TO JOIN THE FUN & SHARE IT WITH THE REST OF THE WORLD!

 

SOUNDBALL - PLAYING MUSIC. LITERALLY.

story:
Who We Are

James "JP" Connell and Reid Spencer are former members of the band Milkweed, which gained prominence in the Southeast in the early 1970s, sharing stages with the Allman Brothers, Jimmy Buffett, Jerry Jeff Walker, Al Kooper, Wet Willie, Randall Bramblett and Wet Willie. 

By a remarkable coincidence detailed on the website www.jamesreidband.com, the two songwriters reunited after 40 years and recorded the CD "Breakfast at Sunset" (released in 2016). That album featured an eclectic blend of new songs and compositions from the Milkweed days.

The band's new CD, "Tales Tall and Tender," will incorporate that same concept, and it is for this project that we ask for your support. Our campaign seeks funding for recording studio sessions at Bredouw's Barn, a state-of-the-art recording studio on Orcas Island in Washington state, as well as travel expenses and compensation for the world-class musicians who make up the James Reid Band.

Your support will allow us to record and distribute the music we create. Any proceeds from the sale of CDs over and above the costs will be donated to charitable causes. In fact, the first scheduled record sessions for the new CD follow two benefit concerts on April 1 and 2 in support of Recovery in Community, a network of trained volunteer advocates supporting the recovery of Orcas Island residents suffering from mental illness or substance abuse disorders.

WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT YOU GET

Our total need for the recording project is $8,000, which will cover studio time and travel and compensation for the band members, who are traveling from Connecticut, Kentucky, North Carolina and Seattle to create "Tales Tall and Tender." Included in the $8,000 are graphic design for the CD jacket and liner as well as the physical production of the CDs.

If you contribute $10, you'll receive a free download of the CD as soon as it becomes available. For $25, you'll get a copy of the CD, signed by JP and Reid. Contributors of $100 receive signed copies of both the "Tales Tall and Tender" and "Breakfast at Sunset" CDs. For $250, you'll get a special thanks, with your name printed in the liner notes of the CD, in addition to the other perks listed above.

And if you really want to be an "angel" and contributed $4,000, JP and Reid will play their songs for you at a private party. But more than anything, you'll get the satisfaction of helping two creative songwriters establish their legacy in music.

If you can't contribute, you can still help us by getting the word out through social media and the Indiegogo share tools. Just know that, whatever you're able to do, we sincerely appreciate it.

story:
We are Lucía Caruso (Argentinean-born composer and pianist) and Dr. Pedro H. da Silva (Portuguese composer, multi-instrumentalist, and NYU composition and classical guitar faculty) are both award-winning composers and founders of the Manhattan Camerata. We have performed at the most prestigious concert halls all over the world, including: Carnegie Hall, Lincoln Center, Kennedy Center, the Palace of Versailles, the Louvre Museum, and Kew Royal Palace in London, among many others.

Active in film, we have worked on two feature films with Oscar-winner Michel Gondry, and have just won an award this May 2019 at the Cannes Film Festival for Best Emerging Documentary at the American Pavilion. We both founded Light and Sound Film Scoring and have three documentaries made about us.

This campaign is to support our recording at the legendary Abbey Road Studios this July. We will be recording our two original and historic concertos, and our joint composition "Folia," with the Academy of St. Martin in the Fields, arguably the best chamber orchestra in the world. This will be the most important recording in our careers up to now. We would appreciate any help possible to reach this dream! Thank you for the support! 
 

What We Need & What You Get
 

To cover expenses for this album, we need to raise $12,500 by early July 2019. We have created an exciting reward system for donations. All donations are tax deductible.

(Free shipping to North America, Europe, and Argentina, other countries might incur shipping fees.)
 

Main Goal and Stretch Goals
 

Our initial goal is to raise $12,500. If we are able to exceed this number, we will have other amazing benefits to come along your way and we would love if you could help us meet our stretch goals:

$2,500 more will help us record a piece with world-renowned French soprano Laetitia Grimaldi Spitzer!

$5,000 more helps us with the above and covers travel expenses and accommodation when in London for the recording.

$10,000 more helps with the above plus we would be filming a behind-the-scenes documentary of our recording sessions at Abbey Road Studios, including a short tour of the studios where the Beatles, Pink Floyd, et al, recorded.
 

The Impact


This recording will be nothing short of historic: it’s the first time a concerto for Portuguese guitar and orchestra has been written and recorded. Lucia’s piano concerto is no less unique in that it uses new and innovative techniques that have never been done before: having a guitarist (Pedro) play inside the piano with his nails, using chalkboard erasers, large felt sticks, guitar picks and drumsticks. 

Both concertos are Transclassical™, a term created and trademarked by Lucia to define our unique style of composition: grounded in classical technique, the compositions include improvisation and elements from a variety of cultures, incorporating world instruments in a range of styles and genres. 

We are excited to announce that we will be recording with the Academy of St. Martin in the Fields, arguably the best chamber orchestra in the world, conducted by the music director of the Royal Shakespeare Company, Bruce O'Neil.

This recording will take place at Abbey Road Studios in London, which is widely considered the best studio in the world. It is well known for where the Beatles recorded all their albums, as well as every other major artist such as Pink Floyd, Queen, Elton John, U2, Lady Gaga, etc. Many of the great classical albums were recorded there by Rubinstein, Horowitz, Argerich, Barenboim, Karajan, Maria Callas, and Pavarotti. It also happens to be where the most famous Hollywood film scores have been recorded such as Lord of the Rings, Harry Potter, the Marvel movies, and Star Wars.

The recording will take place on July 14 and 15, which also happens to be the 50th anniversary of the Beatles recording their Abbey Road album! Our two producers are Pedro and Grammy-winning producer Steve McLaughlin, who has produced many Hollywood blockbuster films. 
 

Risks 
 

There aren't really any risks! The orchestra, the studio, the producer, the engineers, have all been hired, so this recording must happen no matter what. We have put years of work into these compositions and recording and are beyond excited to share this with you! 
 

Other Ways You Can Help
 

If you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help: please spread the word and make some noise for our campaign! We urge you to use the Indiegogo share tools to share this campaign on your social media accounts, email, or to any music lover who would be interested!

story:
The First Hello. 

Hello, my name is Kerri Lyn Angel. I have been a songwriter,  poet and artist all my life. Over the course of that time I have written hundreds of lyrics and melodies but,  for the most part,  I have never released any of this to the public.

With your help,  I would like to change this.

I grew up on the eastern end of Long Island, N. Y. .I was born in 1958, the first of 5 children,  3 boys, 2 girls. I had a somewhat idyllic childhood in white bread middle class America. I was known as a daydreamer, dawdle and dilly dallier. In spite of that I was still, for the most part,  an "A" student. I spent a lot of time reading and writing poetry and songs.  I was extremely creative and also did a lot of artwork and handcrafts. That's what lead me to my Aunt who I  learned my profession from,  floral design which I excelled at.  I continued writing and held my dream of being the "songwriter " for some fancy recording artist. 

My life took me to L. A. in 1978 where I excelled so much at my profession that I eventually became co owner of a  beautiful florist in Beverly Hills. My wonderful success was short lived though, due to bad behavior and poor choices.

I made my way back to Long Island in 1986 and started over again. My new life included 2 children,  a boy and a girl. 

In 2005 I was diagnosed with a rare brain tumor. After undergoing 20 hour brain surgery, I was left disabled. I no longer had my balance or hearing on the left but all of my  cranial nerves were damaged,  leading to chronic facial and eye pain. I have had, and continue to have any procedure possible to help. I have had to learn to deal with terrible random noises in my head in order to do music again. I thought those days were over so I concentrated on my artwork.  I even exhibited a few times after I moved to Pa. 

In 2006, I was gradually learning to cope with my disabilities. Then on March 15, 2014, along came Max (Mathew Malanowicz) oh boy, our eyes locked and it was pure magic. It was joy. It was love. I was so thrilled to collaborate with Max. He had music and no words. I had so very many words and no music. He was willing to work and work we did. We worked very hard and took it very seriously because we had a plan. We were not just soulmates and lovers but creators of timeless,  simple songs that could stand alone or be built upon.  We even played out a few times even though ultimately we did not really want to be the "performers ".Oh yes, I loved Max like no other. Unfortunately,  he suffered from mental illness and even though he was getting better, suddenly suffered a series of personal tragedies which resulted in his suicide on January 10th 2015. I was devastated to the point of nervous breakdown.  The hundreds of practice recordings were all that was left. So my inspiration for this  body of work and  probably the next 2 are not only to live my life long dream but to also leave Max a legacy of these songs we worked so very hard on. 

Max believed in our music and so do I.

I need your help with this incredible stepping stone.

With a very limited fixed income, and many personal daily struggles on my part, much love and help is needed for me to pull this off successfully. I am only asking for a very modest sum, in order for me to complete this heartfelt project. 

Your generous contribution will make a great impact.

In return for your generosity, know that your contribution will change this poet's life forever.

story:
Who is Brooke Brown?

 

Every once in awhile you run across a soul like Brooke Brown. She is a 25 year old  traveling troubadour  from Lenox Alabama. 

Although she loves her hometown, she’s always been ready to take on an adventure. She’s never been afraid of taking the road less traveled. Has spent many nights after playing shows sleeping in her car or  has found a spot to curl up on a friend or twos couch along the way. If asked, she takes full responsibility for her parents hair turning grey. She has a gypsy soul and a little bit of a rebel side at times but you can’t deny that she has a way of lighting up the room with her smile and personality. She is the meaning of “never met a stranger”.  She has a kind heart but she’s also not afraid to let you know where she stands and what she believes in. She’s exactly the kind of true grit country music needs today.

 

Why should you contribute? 

 

The chances are, if you’re on this page, at some point in your life  Brooke has made some sort of impact on you. Whether you’ve known her for years, met her at a show, or became mutual friends with her through Facebook. .. you’re here for a reason and it’s because you believe in her. Brooke’s goal is to produce an EP before she goes on tour this summer. The money she raises will help her pay for studio time and musicians. We believe her songs need to be heard.. and we believe in Brooke Brown! 

Any contribution you make will help get her one step closer to being able to produce and EP! Thank you for showing her so much love and support!
