story:
Get Savage!

 

Started in 2016, the Savage Mountain Punk Fest is an old school music festival celebrating bringing national and regional punk bands to economically distressed Appalachia. Located 2 hours from Pittsburgh, Washington DC, Baltimore, and Harrisburg, Frostburg is a small college town that welcomes Festival guests from as faraway as Connecticut, Chicago, Denver, and even San Francisco, and bands from around the country. We strive to keep the costs low, and we sell no Festival merchandise beyond "best of" records, allow the bands to sell merch for free, and provide a venue for bands to reach a new audience, and the audience to discover new bands or see bands they otherwise would never be able to see. The Savage Mountain Punk Fest is an economic boost to a region that needs it, and this year we want to increase the visibility of the festival by bringing Richie Ramone of the Ramones and legendary pop punk pioneers the Queers to Frostburg.

 

Over the three years of Savage Mountain Punk Festival, we've seen bigger names take the stage, and bigger crowds in the club. And each year, we get more ambitious.


We need your help. We recognize not everyone's into punk, and we realize not every punk can come out; we see this as a DYI festival in a world of Warped tours that brings people to a region that needs something to celebrate. ANd to thank you, we offer a variety of perks, from tickets to digital downloads to vinyl records. We want to thank all of you who helps us, and hope you'll make this the best Savage Mountain Festival yet.

And each year, we get more ambitious.
We need your help. We recognize not everyone's into punk, and we realize not every punk can come out; we see this as a DYI festival in a world of Warped tours that brings people to a region that needs something to celebrate. ANd to thank you, we offer a variety of perks, from tickets to digital downloads to vinyl records. We want to thank all of you who helps us, and hope you'll make this the best Savage Mountain Festival yet.

story:
About Us

We met at Bethel University located in McKenzie, TN at a songwriting competition where one of us (cough cough Adam) won. That day we decided to start a band together. We played a couple of coffee houses on campus, but with our demanding music programs we were unable to really dive into starting a band. We did, however, succeed in falling in love. We got married in 2014 and were finally able to start our career as a duo. We decided on Cherry Avenue because that's the street where it all began.

One of our dreams is to have a complete, high quality, radio ready album. The songs we will be recording are our best yet! Our new material and another high quality video are exactly what we need to take our music career to the next level.

By contributing to this campaign you will be a part of what we are doing here in Nashville. We have a message that we believe people need to hear. This album will show many sides of us, from vulnerability and passion, to some light heartedness and a little (or a lot) of sass.

What We Need & What You Get

The first $1500 will go to the creation of our next music video for our song Off Road. This song greatly contrasts our first music video "I Miss Home" and is exactly what we need to show a different side of us and help us push our brand. The money will go to production, editing, filming, venues and everything else it takes to create a high quality music video from Copper Saw Films. The remainder of the funds will go toward completing our album with a goal of 5 more songs in addition to the 7 we have. This will go to the production, studio time, engineering, A-list musicians and everything else that goes into making a high quality, radio ready album.  The production will be done by Chris Goff of GoffHouse Music featuring the best players in Nashville who have played on albums such as Brooks & Dunn, Alan Jackson, Carrie Underwood, Tim McGraw, Sugarland, Martina McBride and MANY more.

Every contributor, no matter how big or small will be able to request a cover or original song for us to perform on our Youtube and Facebook with a personal shout out in the video. As we move up through the amounts you can receive a signed original EP, an original Cherry Avenue T Shirt, signed copy of our Album (This will take time to complete and order), and even a personal concert in your home! 

If we don't reach our entire goal, we will record as many tracks as we can and reach out to our previous sponsors. Anything above and beyond our goal will be used to record more songs for our album.

The Impact

We believe these tracks will really influence people across the world. "Don't Worry 'Bout Me" is based on one of Erika's high school friends that passed away too young. This song describes what she believes Maci would want us to hear. It is great for anyone coping with loss. "Wide Eyed And Pretty" is a sassy song about those who underestimate women and our take on it. "Better For Me" is a women's anthem. You know those guys who think they're hot stuff and better than everyone else. Well... this one is for you. "Takin' Me Back" is about a summer love that ended too soon. Every little thing reminds you of that person and you can't forget the memories as hard as you try. "Honky Tonk Home" is a fun loving song about a couple that just wants to kick back, throw on some classic country records and dance the night away.

Our Debut EP has been very successful so far. We have thousands of streams on Spotify, Apple Music, etc. It has been played on radio stations across the nation. Our EP helped us break through as artists. Our first music video has over 80k views and is climbing. We will be using the same people to produce both, so the quality will be just as good, if not better. 

Our vision is to create positive country music with a faith based message. We are striving to produce songs that aren't just about cussing, drinking, and going out all the time. Our end goal is to be on a large platform where we can set a good example for others, share our love for the world and most of all our love for God. We can't wait to get this music out to the world, thank you so much for being a part of our dream! 

Risks & Challenges

We don't think we will run into any issues as we have worked with these individuals and companies before. Sometimes time can be an issue, but we plan to release singles along the way. Another challenge would be not receiving enough money. In this case we will have to cut less tracks and have a smaller album, or just release singles until we can raise more money.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute monetarily, we totally understand! Remember a couple of things. Every dollar counts, so don't think your contribution is too small. There are many other ways to help. Share our story and campaign on your media pages, with your rich uncle down in Florida, talk about it with your friends, family and even your co-workers. Another way to help is to send us some encouragement. It takes a lot of vulnerability to ask for money and put our music out there for others to hear. Every bit of encouragement keeps us moving forward!

story:
Shortly after the release of the debut "As It Should Be", A BEAUTIFUL CURSE embarked on writing and recording the second collection of songs that became "A Scar Is Born".  The momentum and excitement was enormous with the creation of live performances, more videos, etc. but in the excitement, only digital copies of the album came out.

Now that things have calmed down from the "...Scar..." era, we looked back and realized that we never released any vinyl or cd's or anything from it.  What the...?  So here we are, ready, willing, and able to make hard copy versions of the celebrated second album a reality but only with your help.

So the full disclosure is this, if hard copies are going to be made we wanted to go all out.  SO, for "...Scar..." we're doing a number of things just for you to enjoy (and truthfully for us to experiment with):

1. Re-mastering the original stereo mixes, 2. creating 3D stereo mixes of the album (3D stereo is intended for headphone use and it's like surround sound in a stereo field), 3. 5.1 surround sound mixes on both DVD (in case anyone still has a dvd player) and on blu-ray, both of which will have hi-res audio listening options for you.  On top of all of that, we were asked to create a "making of"-type documentary explaining the history and the formation of A BEAUTIFUL CURSE so we're putting that on the DVD and Blu-Ray as a requested bonus for you.

It's been said before but here it is again: there's nothing like having a tangible item in your hands compared to just "another collection of files sitting around on your computer", ya know?  It's an actual "thing" in your hands and in this case, the "thing" is a collection of songs and videos from ABC.

So we're asking for your help in order to create this tangible art piece.  And you digital fans are part of this as well.  Each copy of the vinyl comes with a download code so you can have the songs (and videos and what-not) on the device of your choosing.  And believe me, there's a lot of stuff for you all.

Check out the multiple perks packages that we're putting together for you to choose from (from the full on collection to simply a copy of the cd if that's all that you're needing.  

If you’re curious about what the project sounds like feel free to look for A Beautiful Curse on any of your streaming/download platforms you like, but ultimately, please contribute to this campaign to make this hard copy release a reality (which ends on September 13th (yup, a Friday)). 

Thank you SO much for checking this out and helping out.  Please spread the word about this Indiegogo campaign in any way you can.  It will be glorious (wink).  

Love y’all.

story:
Bannister Ride is an alternative/indie rock band based in Barcelona, Spain. Founded by guitarist and songwriter Marc J Curcio (originally from the USA) and vocalist Giulia Burchielli (Italy) after they met and realized the both had a love of Nick Cave, PJ Harvey, Portishead and Queens of the Stone Age.  They soon added bassist Julian Thorne (UK) to the mix, as well as a Spinal Tap assortment of drummers (Pacho, Giorgio, Fred and current drummer Manu). Barcelona can sometimes be a difficult city to maintain an original music endeavor, but they have tried to stay true to their vision and passion for the music and art they create. 

Though we have had a few unexpected bumps in the road (both personal and musical), we are almost finished recording a  12 song album with producer Dave Bianchi (NYC/BCN) at his Dry Town Studios in Barcelona. And we need your help to finish tracks, mix and master the album, which we hope to have released by the end of 2019.  

Everything sounds great so far, but the complete process of making a record (recording, mixing, mastering, art production, releasing physical and digital copies) can be complicated and we need some love and help to reach the end of our goal.  Contributors will help us achieve funds for production, studio time, and the many other costs involved to create an album. We are almost there, and we'd love for you to help us finish the race!

Other Ways You Can Assist

Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign. Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thanks!

Bannister Ride

story:
Introducción.

Primero que nada, gracias por interesarte en ayudarnos. 

 

 

Recién fallecido mi padre (Alfonso Ramón Pérez Talamantes, o  como se le decía de cariño: "Ponchin"), muchos de sus familiares y amigos se acercaron amable y cordialmente pidiéndome que les enviara algo de su música. 

 

Prometí que lo haría. Pero sentí que faltaba algo. No quería distribuir la música en discos "copiados" como si fuera música "pirata". Sentí que no era algo digno de la música de mi papá. 

 

Tuve la oportunidad de vivir con mi padre unos meses antes de que el partiera. El estaba muy inmerso y enfocado en terminar su carrera musical. Yo estaba muy familiarizado con sus ideas, futuros proyectos e inquietudes. 

 

Mi padre logró terminar su carrera musical y como parte de su tesis, presentó  4 temas. Estos temas son especiales pues el los compuso y los produjo en su totalidad, es decir, él realizó y programó las baterías digitales y personalmente grabó el piano, el bajo, las guitarras y, por primera vez, la voz.

Nunca había hecho tal cosa en sus discos anteriores. 

Además, tenía su siguiente proyecto en ciernes. Había ya seleccionado una seria de temas que iba a lanzar en un nuevo disco bajo el título de: "Lo mejor de Ponchin". El le regaló a varios familiares y amigos muy cercanos una "muestra/demo" de lo que iba a ser su siguiente CD.Así que me di a la tarea de terminar este proyecto que él comenzó. 

 

 

El proyecto.

Lo que se necesita para realizar este proyecto es grabar, mezclar y re-masterizar la compilación de temas que él tenia en mente. Para ello se requiere la contratación de los servicios de un estudio de grabación profesional, el diseño y la maquila del CD.

Además, en este CD quisiera incluir y compartir unos temas que me parecen algo verdaderamente bello (sus primeras composiciones clásicas a la guitarra totalmente inéditas) que descubrí cuando estaba poniendo sus papeles y partituras musicales en orden después de fallecido. Créanme: son una belleza. Estos temas hay que grabarlos.

Asimismo, logré rescatar el controversial y último tema musical de su autoría, tema que estrenó e interpretó en vivo el mismísimo día que se fue. El titulo de la obra: "Tengo que partir".

 

Estoy muy contento de poder compartir este proyecto con ustedes y hacerlos parte del mismo. 

 

¡LA META ES DARLE DE REGALO DE NAVIDAD A PONCHIN SU NUEVO DISCO!

¡Estamos seguros que familiares y amigos juntos podemos lograrlo!  

Naim Pérez

 

Financiamiento.

Para realizar un disco profesional, hemos cotizado y conseguido poder realizar el proyecto anterior con 7000 USD. 

Lo siguiente es para dar una noción de lo que toma la realización y producción de un CD y los costos:

1. PRE-PRODUCCIÓN: Esto incluye la selección de temas a grabar, cotizaciones, contratación de músicos, estudios de grabación, productores, partituras, ensayos y en general los arreglos y coordinación de todos los elementos para que la grabación pueda ocurrir sin contratiempos y de forma fluida. 

2. GRABACIÓN: En promedio un estudio de grabación cobra por tema musical entre 800 y 4,000 USD. Esto es grabar cada instrumento y voces, es decir, captar el sonido en una cinta magnética o un dispositivo digital.

3. MEZCLA y MASTERIZACIÓN: Las tomas grabadas para cada canción o tema musical, se someten a un proceso llamado mezcla y masterización. La mezcla incluye cualquier efecto especial o ajuste de volumen para que todas las tomas grabadas tomen su lugar en la canción. Una vez mezclado el material la masterización le da el "matiz" y el "brillo" al tema en sí. Normalmente la mezcla y masterización se hacen por separado y a veces lleva mas tiempo que la grabación. Es todo un proceso de edición complejo y detallado. Algunos estudios de grabación ya incluyen este servicio como parte de la grabación.

3. DISEÑO: Se busca un especialista que diseñe arte para la caja del CD, el disco, etc y se asegura de que exista una congruencia entre el sonido y el arte visual del CD. 

4. MAQUILA y DISTRIBUCIÓN: Una vez que se tiene el diseño seleccionado y los temas musicales mezclados y masterizados, estos se mandan a una maquiladora para que fabriquen los CDs. Una vez entregados se hacen los arreglos de mensajería y paquetería necesarios para el envío y distribución del CD. El costo unitario de un CD puede oscilar entre 1 a 5 (o mas) USD.

¡Proyecto Terminado: Marzo 2017!

Muchas gracias a todos los que hicieron posible esta producción discográfica. Está ahora en proceso de envío.

story:
Who Am I?

My name is Yaa-Hemaa. I am a public servant by day, but by night I am a jazz and soul singer.
I used to harbour secret dreams of being an artist, and on the heels of a few twists, turns and serendipity over the past few years, I'm now fully embracing the opportunity to tell stories, communicate and connect with audiences through song. I am a classically trained pianist, a vocalist, as well as a songwriter who incorporates jazz, soul, pop, R&B, and classical genres into my original pieces. I count greats such as Nina Simone, Eva Cassidy, and Etta James as personal inspirations.
I was amazed at the reaction to my song "Sunday" during the CBC Searchlight competition (check out the brand new music video for Sunday here), as well as the encouraging comments from friends and strangers following an appearance on CBC Radio One's Ottawa Morning. These last few months, in particular, have proven to me that I'm on the right path and that my music can have an impact. I'd like to up my game to reach a much larger audience and progress in the music industry.
A professionally produced and recorded EP will get closer to my goal of being a musician full-time and will help to promote my music and attract interest from professional managers and booking agents.

Funds Needed for the EP

I am raising $8500 for the recording and release of the EP.

$7140 will cover:

  • Studio/producer/engineering time
  • Musicians
  • Mastering
$1360 will cover:
  • Production of physical copies of the EP (CDs)
  • Website upgrades
  • Marketing and promotion
Even if I don't raise the full figure requested I'm still going to go for it!

Other Ways You Can Help

You may not be in a position to contribute financially right now, but there are other ways in which you can help. 

You can spread the word by e-mail, Facebook, or Twitter!

Thank you for your support and encouragement!

Much love,

Yaa-Hemaa

https://www.sonicbids.com/band/yaa-hemaa/ 

www.yaahemaa.com

Endorsements

Yaa-Hemaa has a powerful and original voice – and strong positive material.
I was struck by her energy and sincerity from our first meeting. I’m excited to be producing this project with her. Phillip Victor Bova, Bova Sound

Yaa-Hemaa Obiri-Yeboah is an exquisitely talented  pianist, vocalist, lyricist and composer of breadth and depth. She is gifted with a hauntingly soulful and ethereal  voice - with echoes of Simone, Holiday and Amos- that pierces then envelopes one's interior and remains. Adrian Harewood, CBC

A rising star. Our pick for best up and coming artist in 2016. The Public Servant

Press

story_txt:
Who Am I?
My name is Yaa-Hemaa. I am a public servant by day, but by night I am a jazz and soul singer.
I used to harbour secret dreams of being an artist, and on the heels of a few twists, turns and serendipity over the past few years, I'm now fully embracing the opportunity to tell stories, communicate and connect with audiences through song. I am a classically trained pianist, a vocalist, as well as a songwriter who incorporates jazz, soul, pop, R&B, and classical genres into my original pieces. I count greats such as Nina Simone, Eva Cassidy, and Etta James as personal inspirations.
I was amazed at the reaction to my song "Sunday" during the CBC Searchlight competition (check out the brand new music video for Sunday here), as well as the encouraging comments from friends and strangers following an appearance on CBC Radio One's Ottawa Morning. These last few months, in particular, have proven to me that I'm on the right path and that my music can have an impact. I'd like to up my game to reach a much larger audience and progress in the music industry.
A professionally produced and recorded EP will get closer to my goal of being a musician full-time and will help to promote my music and attract interest from professional managers and booking agents.   Funds Needed for the EP I am raising $8500 for the recording and release of the EP.


$7140 will cover:  Studio/producer/engineering time
Musicians
Mastering


$1360 will cover:

Production of physical copies of the EP (CDs)
Website upgrades
Marketing and promotion
Even if I don't raise the full figure requested I'm still going to go for it!
Other Ways You Can Help You may not be in a position to contribute financially right now, but there are other ways in which you can help. 
You can spread the word by e-mail, Facebook, or Twitter!
Thank you for your support and encouragement!
Much love,
Yaa-Hemaa
https://www.sonicbids.com/band/yaa-hemaa/ 

www.yaahemaa.com

story:
The "Living Album"

This is more than just an album, it's an experience.

The alternative to short-lived, uninvolving albums is here.  From Stanford to the studio, please help me improve how you experience music.  I've assembled a team of hyper-talented individuals to create an innovative and interactive album—delivered via mobile app (iOS & Droid).

Each song on I Am Not Them:  The Legacy Project has a corresponding episode that takes the form of either a music video or "engagement piece".  These episodes weave a narrative through the music visuals as well as share smaller “stories” from user generated content resulting in a unique outcome.  In addition, a "FAM" feature serves as new age "digital liner notes" showcasing both the creators and selected users of the project. 

With this project we’re expecting to set a new and innovative standard for albums.  One that increases your enjoyment and serves as an inspiration for others to share their ambitious ideas.  Your contribution will go a long way to help us revolutionize an industry.  Please join us on this amazing journey.

Please contribute to "I Am Not Them:  The Legacy Project" today.

*****

Project Background:  So, How Did We Get Here?

Over a decade and a half ago, I was laying on a shag carpet in an apartment in Toledo, OH.  I was there for my summer internship with General Motors and although I appeared chill, I was bottling-up chaos.  I knew that the Stanford engineering path I was on was not the road I needed to travel and it soon hit me that pursuing my passion was my only valid option to impact the world.  I was going to rap and inner peace resulted...

Now, I won't say all was easy after that. I still had to convince my parents it was a good idea to toss away guaranteed engineering money in favor of a makeshift living. I had to work through a steep artistic learning curve while simultaneously dealing with skeptics, naysayers, and critics.  But still nothing was more soul hollowing than the relationships I lost through the petty misunderstandings and frailties that accompany the game...

But the game also brings joy when your musical creation finally reaches your vision.  I smirked when I realized that I had not only become a dope rapper, but also a seasoned songwriter, orchestrator, and storyteller.  Plus, I’ve been allowed to tour (domestic & abroad), open for major artists, throw my own shows, and create several albums worth of stellar music. I’ve mentored youth, created platforms for other artists to flourish, and gave back to the communities that nurtured me.  

But the greatest part of this journey has been the countless number of positive relationships I've formed. My best memories are of collaborating and sharing with other people.  You see, I create for folks like me:  those who understand and exercise the power to better themselves and their world.  And in all my future musical endeavors, I want to bring forth more and more ways to have these worlds collide...

And that brings us here...

I Am Not Them:  The Legacy Project brings all of these pieces together.  It’s what I’ve been unknowingly working towards since that shag carpet “epiphany” back in college.  I not only want to work to create the incredible with those whose talent extends where mine ends, but I want to interact with, hear from, and exchange stories with the wide spectrum of folks my art reaches. It just so happens that this purpose is packaged within a unique hip-hop experience, because it wouldn’t be right to do it any other way.

You can help bring this project to life by becoming a backer today. AND... as a token of appreciation (and to make this more fun) we have rewards on deck for you.  So, please check out the perks and make a pledge today.

Also, although NO MONEY DIRECTLY FROM THIS CAMPAIGN will be given to a charitable cause, when all is launched, 10% of all future net sales from the project (CDs, merch, etc.) will go to Global Kids-Arkansas. It's a program for high school students in underserved communities who show interest in leadership and global initiatives (AND we send 'em overseas for some foreign experiences as well). You can check out more information about it HERE.


*****

The Below is for Those Who Would Like Greater Detail.  A Frequently Asked Questions, If You Will...

So to further explain, I had a fictional conversation with myself.  Although there was some friction at first, when all was over, not only was ole boy on #TeamLetsRide, but he also was the first to contribute. For your clarity, the conversation is in its entirety below:

What’s Good Bruh? 

Nothing much, man. Glad the project piqued your interest.

Nah.  Just Bored, But I Did Read Your “Purpose” Above and That Was Real Cute.

Uhhhh...thanks man. You know I wa---

Yeah Whateva Mane. So What Exactly Does This “I Am Not Them” Mean? 

Well, the “I” is clarified by establishing who the “THEM” are. THEM = Those who are Anti-Growth, Giving, and Greatness. You know, nothing like you and I, right man?

Chill...So What's this Legacy Project Exactly? An Album in an App, Right? 

Mmmm...kinda, but not really.  It's a 1st of its kind, interactive "app based album" that engages, highlights, and connects the FAM (or users) through storytelling. 

Bruh...In Human Terms. Explain That To Me Again. 

My bad, man. I get excited. Basically, it consists of:

  • The Music Still the heart and soul of it all.
  • The "Music Video" Episodes Visuals will be uniquely suited to the song, but will be connected telling a larger story. 
  • The "Engagement" Episodes Social media shenanigans, call-to-actions, "art imitating life experiments", hashtag walls, and other items that share and connect.
  • The "FAM" Features  Highlighting both the creators and selected users of the project.
  • The Duration About 2 months. Albums are so short lived nowadays. Here’s a cool-like way to lengthen the experience. 
  • The App Insuring that all is an engaging and seamless ride. 
  • The Music Distribution  Although all is meant to be experienced through the app, we are still having the album in digital form and CD hard copy.  Vinyl may be considered later...
  • The FAM Or...YOU There's an overarching story that needs you.  It's gonna be an incredible project as is, but with your input it will end up being something legendary.

That Sounds Kinda Dope Actually, But Why Are You the One Making It? 

A tad condescending, but cool I guess.  See, you’re looking at it wrong. It’s not just me.  Yeah, the core of this project is coming from yours truly, but I have an expert team for all aspects of the project. So perhaps the better question is, who but WE to create this?

Ok. I See.  You Feelin Yourself a Bit.  But What About This $$$ Though?  What Dollars Go Where?

Well, I've learned how to create very polished projects for very reasonable amounts. To get the project up and complete we’ll need $25,000.  

So What Happens If You Get Over That Amount?

Good call.  Given that this is something special, we’d like to expose it to as large an audience as possible, so a second goal of $12,000 would be utilized to market it. Lastly, since it would be great to document the entire project and share it with ya’ll, we have another goal of $3,000 to form a 5-part webisode series showing the adventures. (Similar to the one we did HERE). 

So, the minimum goal is $25k, but $40k is Big Boi status?

Cute reference, but yeah.  Matter of fact, I have this real cool-like 8th grade throwback pie chart explaining all:


Man, Ya'll Are Doing Some Incredible Things for Some Real Reasonable Rates.  That's Less Than Jay-Z's Daily "Keep Up With Beyonce" Budget and Drake's Ghostwriter Retainer!

Who you telling, man.  Preciate.

Soooo...Are the “Perks” Like My Gift or Something for Helping This Come to Be? 

Exactly. It’s like us letting you know that your contribution isn’t taken lightly so here’s this token of our appreciation. You know, fund the whole thing and I’ll Riverdance for your next birthday, bruh...

Well, Let's Hope I Never Age Then, But Now I’m Intrigued. After the Project is Released and I’ve Enjoyed the Entire Experience, Is That It? Any Follow-Ups? 

Man, I couldn’t have prepped that question better myself. I'm aiming to go on tour as both a solo artist and with the full band, Big Piph & Tomorrow Maybe. Also, we'll hit certain schools and organizations in underserved communities to conduct workshops for students and youth. Very similar to what we do now both foreign and domestic, but just on a larger scale. Plus, there is a sequel in mind...

Bet, But Say...Could You Hold On a Second or Three, Mane?

Yeah, I'm kosher. Do you.

Ok. I'm Back. I Just Had to Go Pledge to the Campaign Real Quick. I'm Thoroughly Impressed and Looking Forward to It.

Well, shoot man. Preciate that.

No Thing.  Plus, You Remind Me of Myself Actually.

I guess that's cool...

Well, I'ma Spread the Word via Social Media and All.  In the Meantime, You and Your Squad Get to Work. You've Gotta Lotta Folks Looking Forward To This.  And Congrats in Advance!

Means a lot man. Preciate again and will get at you later.

Cool.

Cool.

Can't wait to take this journey with ya'll.  

Please Contribute Today!

#IAmNotThem

story:
My name is Ben Larsen, and I am a NYC-based cellist and curator. Thanks for checking our our project, “Pieces of Eight”! A little background on our commissioning project:

Very little has been composed for the duo combination of cello and flute. There have been incorporations of this combination into larger ensembles (more notably those of flute, cello, piano [Weber Trio]; flute, violin, viola, cello [Mozart Flute Quartets]; two flutes and cello [W.F. Bach, one of the most talented sons of J.S. Bach]; and flute, violin, and cello [Haydn’s London Trios]), but almost nothing exists exclusively for the combination of the two outside of Brazilian composer Hector Villa-Lobos’s “Assobio a Jato” (Jet Whistle). Recently, a friend and I were talking about performing duos together, and we realized there was this lack of available repertoire. I decided to approach some of my composer friends, as well as the superbly talented flutist Martha Cargo, to tackle this dilemma.

The biggest obstacle when it comes to commissions is funding: as much trouble as freelance musicians have making a living, composers often have an even more difficult path, tasked to teach theory, teach or perform on any instruments they are able, and/or take a day job, typically after spending a decade or more in school to get a Doctorate of Musical Arts, one of the few degrees that will give them a chance at a college or university teaching position. While the musicians are the people who most often want to commission works, performers are often those who are least able to afford the fees of the composers, and composers are even less able to afford to simply give away their services.

Martha and I have approached eight composers to write works for our particular duo combination, and we have received an enthusiastic response from each one. These incredible creative minds are:

Juan Pablo Contreras

Molly Joyce

Natalie Dietterich

Paolo Marchettini

Qin Ding

Reena Esmail

Robert Sirota

Whitney George

The composers involved in this project are an exceptional gathering of three men and five women from a variety of cultural, geographical and generational backgrounds, spanning three continents, and over four decades. They hail from the country's finest conservatories and universities, including Manhattan School of Music, Juilliard, Harvard, Yale and Oberlin, and include Fulbright recipients as well as winners of a diverse array of international awards. Their works have been performed by major symphony orchestras across the globe, in addition to groups including the Chiara, American, Ethel and Blair string quartets, Windscape Ensemble, and Decoda.

This project provides space for creators from diverse backgrounds to learn about each other in a new light, while also allowing them the opportunity to forge new relationships and friendships. That is what makes this project unique: it allows composers to connect to one another, as well as working with the performers to reimagine the ensemble of flute and cello in their own distinct voice. We are thrilled to share this diverse body of work with you!

One of the best parts of this project is that it gives you, the donor, the opportunity to take part in making this creative process possible. Over the centuries, many of the greatest works ever written were commissioned by Popes, Cardinals, Kings, Duchesses, Princes and Emperors. These days, we don't see the Queen of England picking up her checkbook: will you step forward and take an integral part in making a new masterpiece possible? Join us in expanding the repertoire for this vital instrumentation. Who knows: maybe one day, decades from now, somebody will be reading about you in their program notes!

story:
LADIES AND GENTLEMEN.

When this country calls to them, our defense forces are the ones to answer,  no matter the danger, no matter the sacrifice

For every soldier that goes out to protect our borders, there are wives, husbands, mothers, fathers, sons, and daughters praying for their safe return

Supporting our soldiers are the community that lives, breathes and understands the need for vigilance of our borders.  They have also joined the fight as citizens to free this country from terrorism

On behalf of my fellow artists, I want to sincerely THANK our soldiers and community living in these insecure areas and let them know how much we appreciate their efforts

Following the Head of State’s initiative, I launched this project of musicians committed to peace and security in Cameroon (I SAY YES !), because this fight is a challenge to all of us,

Vigilance is our collective responsibility; we should all be involved. TO PROMOTE RELIGIOUS TOLERANCE AND HELP THE LOCAL DISPLACED POPULATIONS

Together let’s say YES to PEACE and SECURITY in Cameroon !

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • WE NEED $50 000 to cover recording and  video production,the participation of more than 50 cameroonian artistes is free,but we need the money to support the studios for audio and the video.
  • The transportations for artists coming from different cities and some leaving aboroad
  • the food and hotels for those artists.
  • The communication campagne through televisions,radios and new papers.
  • the campaign promoting peace and security,vigilance,religious tolerence considering that Cameroon is dominated by two religions Christian and muslim
  • The Impact

The campaign will help to 

-Organise fund raiser events to help the internally displaced people

-Bring people to stay united and accept each other no matter the religion and the color

-Promote peace and mental and emotion support to those leaving in these insecure area


Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please make some noise about my campaign.
  •  use the Indiegogo share tools!

THANKS
story_txt:
LADIES AND
GENTLEMEN.
When this country calls to them, our defense forces are the ones to
answer,  no matter the danger, no matter
the sacrifice
For every soldier that goes out to protect our borders, there are wives,
husbands, mothers, fathers, sons, and daughters praying for their safe return
Supporting our soldiers are the community that lives, breathes and
understands the need for vigilance of our borders.  They have also joined the fight as citizens
to free this country from terrorism
On behalf of my fellow artists, I want to sincerely THANK
our soldiers and community living in these insecure areas and let them know how
much we appreciate their efforts
Following the Head of State’s initiative,
I launched this project of musicians committed to peace and security in
Cameroon (I SAY YES !), because this fight is a challenge to all
of us,
Vigilance is our collective responsibility; we should all be involved. TO PROMOTE RELIGIOUS TOLERANCE AND HELP THE LOCAL DISPLACED POPULATIONS
Together let’s say YES to PEACE
and SECURITY in Cameroon !
   What We Need & What You Get Break it down for folks in more detail:  WE NEED $50 000 to cover recording and  video production,the participation of more than 50 cameroonian artistes is free,but we need the money to support the studios for audio and the video.
The transportations for artists coming from different cities and some leaving aboroad
the food and hotels for those artists.
The communication campagne through televisions,radios and new papers.
the campaign promoting peace and security,vigilance,religious tolerence considering that Cameroon is dominated by two religions Christian and muslim

The Impact


 The campaign will help to 
-Organise fund raiser events to help the internally displaced people
-Bring people to stay united and accept each other no matter the religion and the color
-Promote peace and mental and emotion support to those leaving in these insecure area   
    Other Ways You Can Help 
Please make some noise about my campaign.  use the Indiegogo share tools!   THANKS

story:
Hello I am Callum, Attila The Pun. A rapper from Reading/ Folkestone, Uk. I make music about my life and struggles with depression I never considered doing this but  people said they would back this, so I thought what do I have to lose!


I am pretty poor and can not afford to record for a while; truthfully music is all I trully love it is an escape and keeps me sane if you want to back me then thank you, if you don't that's fine too! Thanks for reading.


Basically the minimum I am allowed to pledge was £500. That Would go towards recording a new EP (both recording and mastering,) Graphic design for the EP, and making cds and promo.


If this was to actually happen and I got the full amount it would help so much honestly, I could afford to make the EP exactly how I want it to sound and give you the best I possibly can, again many thanks.

story:
Pour contribuer au second tour de ma campagne visitez
To contribute to the Round 2 of my Campaign visit
https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/ep-album-6-songs--2/x/12198616#/

  1. Pourquoi faire de la musique? / Why am I singing?

La musique est faite pour divertir mais aussi revendiquer, redonner espoir, réconforter et rassembler. La musique a le pouvoir d'influencer et les gens y retrouvent leur histoire et leurs rêves. Certains chanteurs et chanteuses ont marqué des générations entières, d'autres sont aujourd'hui des références. Bob Marley, James Brown, Tracey Chapman, Alpha Blondy, Tiken Dja Facoli et bien d'autres. Tout comme eux, je chante pour faire aussi une différence, sur des thèmes ou tout le monde se retrouve, pour donner un portrait chaleureux et beau de la culture africaine, soutenir des causes sociales tel que la pauvreté, la santé et les enfants. Originaire de Côte d'Ivoire, je chante depuis mon jeune âge et aujourd'hui je vis au Manitoba, ma terre d'accueil. J'ai appris beaucoup et ma musique s'est imprégnée de cette belle culture. Encouragée par la rétroaction positive que mon premier single Africa a reçu, j'ai commencé a préparer un maxi-disque de 6 chansons, qui offrira un mélange de Folk et musique du monde. Un lien vers quelques démos (sur SoundCloud ) est affiché sur mon site et vous pouvez nous suivre sur facebook (Kelly E. Bado) pour voir les progrès.

...............................    ................................     .................................     ................................

Music is made to entertain but also advocate, give hope, comfort and gather people. Music has the power to influence and people can relate to the stories that are told. Some singers have impacted entire generations, others are references today . Bob Marley, James Brown, Tracey Chapman, Alpha Blondy , Tiken Dja Facoli and many others . Like them , I sing to also make a difference, topics everyone can relate to, to give a warm and beautiful portrait of the African culture , to support social causes such as poverty, health and children. Born in Côte d'Ivoire, I started to sing at a young age and Manitoba has been my new home since 2008. I learned a lot and my music has been impacted by this beautiful culture. So, encouraged by the positive response to my first album Africa, I started working on an EP album of 6 songs that will showcase a mix of Folk and World Music. A link to some demos (on soundcloud) is posted on my website and you can follow us on facebook (Kelly E. Bado) to see the progress.


2. L'objectif de ma campagne / The goal of my campaign 

Financé en  grande partie par Manitoba Film and Music, le Conseil des arts de Winnipeg, le 100 nons par l'entremise de Francofonds et Radio Envol 91, j'ai  pu enclencher mon projet de maxi-disque. Mes réalisateurs sont Norman Dugas et Daniel Roa. Norman Dugas est vétéran de la scène musicale, y œuvrant depuis ses débuts sur la scène musicale montréalaise et canadienne des années '70 avec, entre autres, Daniel Lavoie. Daniel Roa est un musicien très sollicité et auteur­compositeur établi, ayant à son actif 2 disques appuyés par Musication. 

La musique est un domaine qui demande beaucoup d’investissement et dont la rentabilité est seulement à long terme. Mon objectif est donc de prélever 5500$ en faisant la pré-vente de mon album et en offrant des bonus alléchants.

Cet argent va soutenir directement le coût des musiciens professionnels, le temps du studio, la conception et l'impression de 500 exemplaires de l'album. Il faut plus qu'un chanteur pour produire un album , nous avons besoin d' une équipe de professionnels qui donneront de leur mieux et, surtout, de leur temps. Un lien vers quelques démos (sur SoundCloud ) est affiché sur mon site et vous pouvez nous suivre sur facebook (Kelly E. Bado) pour voir les progrès.
........................     ........................     .........................    .........................    ..........................
Partially funded by Manitoba Film and Music, The Winnipeg Arts Council, le 100 Nons through Francofonds and Radio Envol 91, I was able to start the production of my EP album. My producers are Norman Dugas and Daniel Roa. Norman Dugas is a veteran of the music scene , working in the domain since its debut on the Montreal and Canadian music scene of the 70s with, Daniel Lavoie, among others. Daniel Roa is a well-known musician and singer-songwriter established, with two albums supported by Musication .
Music requires considerable investment and profitability is only in the long term . My goal is to collect $ 5,500 by pre-selling my album and also offering you bonuses. This money will directly support the cost of the professional musicians, the studio time, the design and printing of 500 copies of the album. It takes more than a singer to produce an album, we need a team of professionals who will give their best and most importantly, their time. A link to some demos (on soundcloud) is posted on my website and you can follow us on facebook (Kelly E. Bado) to see the progress.

3. Ce que vous obtenez / What you obtain
Procurez-vous mon album d'avance et recevez des bonus tel que des tickets du concert de lancement, une photo profesionnelle dédicacée, une copie des paroles, des t-shirts (combinés avec des tissus africains) de la boutique en ligne, une expérience en studio, des concerts maison, des remerciements personnalisés et bien d'autres! 
En février, un aperçu de chaque morceau sera publié sur mon site web www.kellybado.com 
...............................    ................................     ..............................   ...............................

To support this project you can purchase my album in advance and receive some bonuses such as tickets for the release concert, autographed photos, lyrics, t- shirt mixed with african fabrics from my e-boutique, an experience in the studio with us recording, house concerts, a personalized thank you note and many others!

In February 2016, a preview of each song will be posted on my website www.kellybado.com 


4. Mon objectif à court-moyen et long terme / my short-medium and long term goal
  • J'espère faire jouer mon album dans les radios communautaires, nationales au Canada et internationales grace à un plan marketing solide et une équipe qui commence à se former autour de ma carriere. Mon premier album single Africa joue déjà en onde à Ici Manitoba grâce à une de leur généreuse bourse , à Radio Envol 91 et à la radio en ligne de Manitoba Music. Un gros merci pour leur généreux soutien! Vous l’avez peut-être déjà écouté. Si vous vous êtes procuré l’album, je vous remercie chaleureusement. Une partie des bénéfices a été versé aux Médecins sans frontières lors de la crise du virus Ebola et à Unicef Afrique. Cet album continuera de supporter des causes en Afrique.
................................   ...............................   .................................    ................................
  • My marketing plan includes radio air play on community and national radio stations in Canada as well as international radio stations. I am also building a solid team of professionals to help me succeed. My first single album Africa is already airing on Ici Manitoba, Envol 91 Radio and Manitoba Music online radio. So a big thank you to them for their generous support! Maybe you've already heard it. If you bought a copy of that album, I am deeply grateful and I thank you. Part of the proceeds was donated to Doctors Without Borders to fight against Ebola and Unicef Ouest Africa. That album will continue to support other causes in Africa.


5. Risque et défis / Risks and challenges

Les projets comme le mien demandent des heures de travail. Le défi si nous n'atteignons pas l'objectif de cette collecte, sera de pouvoir ajuster le tout. Donc réduire le nombre d'instruments et le temps de travail (l'enregistrement studio, le temps de mixage, le mastering et le nombre d'impressions). Nous pensions inclure un instrument traditionnel appelé la kora dans un des morceaux mais pour cela, il nous faut embaucher un musicien de Kora à Montréal car il n'y en pas de disponible à Winnipeg. Il faudra aussi couvrir des frais d'enregistrement d'un studio à Montréal. Si nous n'avons les fond nécessaire, nous devrons trouver des alternatives ou maximiser le travail sur les 2 meilleurs morceaux, même si nous souhaitons que toutes les chansons aient les mêmes chances. Ce projet se veut simple, acoustique ce qui facilitera l'utilisation rationnelle et intelligente des fonds qui seront disponibles. 

................................    .....................................   .................................   ...............................

Projects like mine demand hours of work. The challenge we will face if we do not reach the goal of this campaign, will be to adjust the cost which can lead to reducing the number of instruments and the recording time, mixing, number of impressions, etc. We want to include a traditional instrument called the kora in one of the songs but for this we need to hire a musician in Montreal and cover the studio cost because there are none available in Winnipeg. We sometimes have to find alternatives or maximize effort on the two best tracks, even we wish to give all the songs the same opportunities. This project is simple, acoustic which will allow us to use wisely the available funds.


6. Autres facons d'aider / other ways to help

Veuillez passer le mot et faire de la publicité autour de vous ou utiliser les outils de partage Indiegogo!
Merci au 100 nons et à Manitoba Music pour leur mentorat, mes 2 soeurs Raissa et Carine et tous ceux qui ont aider à monter cette campagne! 

...............................     ................................    ...............................    ...............................
Share this project around you and use the tools provided by indiegogo!

Special thanks to 100 nons and Manitoba music for their mentorship, my 2 sisters Raissa &Carine and all the people who helped prepare this campaign! 

Mè lé bou nassè! (thank you in my native language)

story:
Help Julia Fairlight and Rachel Oto have a successful tour!

Hello! We are two passionate singer songwriters, Julia Fairlight and Rachel Oto,  on a mission to share our soulful  message of hope, love and light on our first West Coast Tour, The Stardust & Stagecoach Tour.

Julia Fairlight: My purpose is to inspire hope in others by honestly sharing my experience of recovery from addiction through my voice & music. I am releasing a deluxe edition of my debut album, Midnight Muse on this tour!

Rachel Oto: I have put my heart and soul into creating vivid musical vignettes that ignite courage and perseverance in the face of adversity. My debut EP, Run, releases at the start of the tour!

By contributing to this campaign you are helping us share our beautiful, positive  message and inspiring music.


What We Need & What You Get

The tour schedule is filling up fast and our band has been busy rehearsing, we just need some help getting us to our shows. Our goal of $7000 will cover the cost of gas, pay and meals for our amazing band (4 musicians for two weeks), merch for our awesome fans, as well as a couple nights in a hotel when we aren't on the move, and print and promotion costs to make sure we reach as many people as possible.

To show our appreciation, we have exquisite perks at every level that give you a taste of road life, our music, our personalities, or some rad combination of all those elements!

The Breakdown:

  •   Gas ($600)

  •   The talented musicians traveling with us ($2000)

  •   Board ($1000)

  •   Food ($1500)

  •   Merch - t-shirts, stickers, buttons, etc.  ($500)

  •   Promotion - social media, print ads, etc. ($500)

  •   Print costs - flyers, posters, mailers, etc. ($100)

  •   Contingency - van repairs, snake bites, gear maintenance, etc. ($800)

  •   Total: $7000


Every cent helps! Even if we don't manage to reach our goal, your donation will still help us travel up the coast and share our music.



Other Ways You Can Help:

Even if you cannot donate any money, there are others ways you can help! Simply sending us your good vibes, love and light is sure to be felt. You can also help by:

  • Sharing with your Facebook friends & Twitter followers (click on the "share" links on the upper left of this page).
  • Sending an email directly to people who love women in music!
  • Telling your friends about our campaign directly.
We passionately believe that as artists we can make a positive impact on the world. By contributing to our campaign you are forever a pivotal part of our careers & we are so very thankful for your believe in us and our message! Thank you!!

story:
The Soul Shakers Story

Rebecca and the Soul Shakers are a 5-7 piece rock and southern soul band from the little town of Sayre Pennsylvania.  We perform original music, written from the heart by Rebecca Smith, along with her husband and collaborator Jim.  Along with their amazing bandmates, RC Nobles, David Smith, and Scott Parsons, the Soul Shakers have been steadily building a following around Upstate New York/Finger Lakes area and beyond. 

In 2014, the band recorded it's first record, a collection of 12 original songs.  That album, titled "You Should Be Living" is available on Spotify, iTunes and on the band's website.

That experience really lit a fire under the band and since then we've been writing and performing a new batch of songs that we can't wait to share with a wider audience.  This new collection of music ranges from foot-stomping rockers like "My Goodbyes" and "The Devil That You Know" to Heartfelt ballads like "Turbulence" and "When You Lie To Me", showcasing the range of the band's musicianship and the raw power of Rebecca's voice.

This time we are headed to Electric Wilburland Recording Studio  in October to work with Grammy Award winning producer Will Russell. 

What We Need & What You Get

Here's what we need:

  • In addition to what we have saved up, we hope to raise $2000 to help pay for studio time, mixing and mastering, copyright registration, manufacturing  cd's and a few records for those die hard collectors.

The Impact

We know there are lots of musicians looking for your support.  A contribution from you is something we appreciate more than you could imagine.  This album is the culmination of years of hard work, late nights and pouring of hearts onto page.  We love making this music and want you to share that joy with us.

Other Ways You Can Help

We'd love for you to spread the word about this campaign so share the link with your friends and family.  You can follow us on facebook or bring some friends and come see a live show.
story_txt:
The Soul Shakers Story
 Rebecca and the Soul Shakers are a 5-7 piece rock and southern soul band from the little town of Sayre Pennsylvania.  We perform original music, written from the heart by Rebecca Smith, along with her husband and collaborator Jim.  Along with their amazing bandmates, RC Nobles, David Smith, and Scott Parsons, the Soul Shakers have been steadily building a following around Upstate New York/Finger Lakes area and beyond.  
In 2014, the band recorded it's first record, a collection of 12 original songs.  That album, titled "You Should Be Living" is available on Spotify, iTunes and on the band's website.
That experience really lit a fire under the band and since then we've been writing and performing a new batch of songs that we can't wait to share with a wider audience.  This new collection of music ranges from foot-stomping rockers like "My Goodbyes" and "The Devil That You Know" to Heartfelt ballads like "Turbulence" and "When You Lie To Me", showcasing the range of the band's musicianship and the raw power of Rebecca's voice.
This time we are headed to Electric Wilburland Recording Studio  in October to work with Grammy Award winning producer Will Russell.  
  What We Need & What You Get Here's what we need:

In addition to what we have saved up, we hope to raise $2000 to help pay for studio time, mixing and mastering, copyright registration, manufacturing  cd's and a few records for those die hard collectors.
    The ImpactWe know there are lots of musicians looking for your support.  A contribution from you is something we appreciate more than you could imagine.  This album is the culmination of years of hard work, late nights and pouring of hearts onto page.  We love making this music and want you to share that joy with us.
  Other Ways You Can HelpWe'd love for you to spread the word about this campaign so share the link with your friends and family.  You can follow us on facebook or bring some friends and come see a live show.

story:
Click Here for English!

Bref résumé

Depuis maintenant 11 ans, la CLES soutient les femmes qui souhaitent sortir de la prostitution ou qui en sont sorties.

À travers les 600 contacts que nous avons par année avec des survivantes de la prostitution, nous avons pu constater que la pauvreté est un obstacle majeur à la sortie de la prostitution et qu'il n'existe aucun soutien financier direct pour aider les femmes. 

C'est pourquoi nous avons mis sur pied le Fonds de solidarité!

Il nous permet de soutenir financièrement les projets des femmes afin de faciliter leur sortie et leur après-sortie. Ce Fonds ne reçoit aucun financement gouvernemental. Il repose entièrement sur vos dons!

En donnant au Fonds de solidarité, vous soutenez concrètement les femmes dans leur sortie de la prostitution. 

Aucun argent ne va à l'organisme.  


Ce dont nous avons besoin...

Nous souhaitons amasser 10 000$ . Ce montant nous permettra de soutenir les projets des femmes en lien avec... 


    Le cheminement scolaire et professionnel 

Les Fonds amassés nous permettront de défrayer des frais d'inscription au secondaire, au cégep ou à l'université, de fournir des ordinateurs ou du matériel scolaire ou encore, d'effectuer une demande de pardon judiciaire, le casier criminel étant souvent un obstacle majeur à l'emploi.  

            La sécurité et l'accès au logement

Pour sortir de la prostitution, plusieurs femmes ont besoin de quitter un conjoint, un milieu malsain ou de simplement laisser derrière elles leur ancienne vie. Le Fonds nous permettra de supporter financièrement le déménagement d'une femme vers un lieu plus sûr. Le sentiment de sécurité après avoir fui une situation violente étant également un enjeu crucial, le Fonds nous permettra d'offrir l'installation de systèmes d'alarme ainsi que des cours  d'autodéfense.

  La mobilité 

La pauvreté, comme obstacle majeur à la réinsertion, prend plusieurs formes. C'est le cas entre autre de la difficulté à défrayer des frais de déplacements, que ce soit pour chercher un emploi, aller à l'école ou encore se rendre à des rendez-vous médicaux. Le Fonds de solidarité nous permettra d'offrir des passes de métro mensuelles ou annuelles à des femmes, des cours de conduite ou des vélos afin de favoriser leur mobilité tant physique que sociale.

             La famille et les loisirs

Les hobbys et les passes-temps sont bénéfiques pour la santé mentale, particulièrement lorsqu'on a vécu des traumatismes. De plus, de nombreuses femmes ayant un vécu en lien avec la prostitution ont des enfants, avec qui elles souhaitent passer du temps de qualité. Le Fonds de solidarité nous permettra d'offrir à des femmes et à leurs enfants des moments de répit (camps de jour et activités parascolaires) et de qualité en famille (sorties et activité familiales).

 La santé

Les femmes ayant un vécu en lien avec la prostitution ont de grands besoins en lien avec la santé, tant physique que mentale et les services ne sont pas toujours accessibles. Le Fonds nous permettra de défrayer des coûts de psychothérapie ou encore des soins chez le dentiste, des lunettes ou d'autres services essentiels pourtant couteux.    


... et ce que vous obtenez

En échange de votre générosité, nous avons concocté une liste de contreparties à l'image de la CLES et des femmes qui la fréquentent. Ainsi vous pourrez recevoir des poèmes inédits, des cartes de souhaits faites à la main par les femmes, un calendrier féministe et plein d'autres choses encore!


Pour les groupes et organismes, nous offrons également nos services de communication, d'animatrices et de formatrices! Il y en a pour tous les goûts et tous les budgets!  



D'autres façons de nous aider

Même si vous ne pouvez soutenir financièrement notre campagne, cela ne signifie pas que vous ne pouvez pas nous aider! 

Parlez de nous, partagez notre vidéo sur les réseaux sociaux, sollicitez vos amiEs, vos collègues et votre famille en leur envoyant le lien vers la campagne.  

Finalement, utilisez nos photos de profils Facebook en mettant un lien vers la campagne dans la description et faites ainsi savoir que vous soutenez le Fonds de solidarité!

Toute l'équipe de la CLES vous remercie du fond du coeur!


English

Summary

For the past 11 years, CLES has been working to support and help women who are in the sex trade, who want out, or have exited.

Each year, we have more than 600 contacts with survivors of prostitution and we are able to see how poverty is a major obstacle to their exiting prostitution and how direct financial support for them is non-existing.

That is why we have set up the Solidarity Fund!

The Solidarity Fund allows us to offer financial support to women as a way to help them exit prostitution and after they have exited. This Fund receive no financial support from the government. It lives entirely based on your generosity.

By contributing to our Solidarity Fund, you are actively supporting women’s exiting efforts, and lending a hand to those who have already exited.

Not one cent will be kept by our group. Everything will go to women and their children.


What we want...

This goal of this campaing campaign ? To raise 10, 000$

This will allow us to support projects in relation to…


  … women’s transition to the job market or return to school

The funds raised through this campaign will allow us to pay for school admission fees, to provide computers of school supplies or to help pays for a pardon application, a criminal record being a major obstacle to employability.

  … women’s security and secure housing rights

To successfully exit prostitution, many women need to leave a spouse behind, to flee an unhealthy environment or simply leave their old life behind. The Fund allows us to pay for a relocation in a more secure environment. After being in a violent situation, a sense of safety is also very important so the Fund could allow us to pays for an alarm system installation and self-defense classes.


… women's access to mobility

Poverty as an obstacle to social rehabilitation can take many forms. One of them is the inhability to pay for travel expense, be it to find work, go to school or make it to medical apointments. The solidarity Fund will allow us to pay for metro pass, drinving lessons or even a bike to support women’s social and physical mobility.

 

… leisure and quality time with families

Hobbies and past-time are important for mental health, especially if you have experienced trauma. Also many women who are survivors of prostitution have kids with whom they need to spend quality time. The Solidarity Fund will alow us to offer women some free time, while their kids are off to camp or after school activities as well as quality time together (family outings ans special activities).

 … women’s access to health services

Women who are or have been in prostitution often have great needs in terms of physical as well as mental health and those services aren’t always affordable. The Solidarity Fund will allow us to assist in the costs of a psychotherapy, dental treatment, glasses or other essential but pricey services.


What you get

In exchange for your generosity, we have prepared a list of perk that are an extension of CLES and the women who come to CLES.

Thus, there are poems, handmade cards, a feminist calendar and many other thing!

For groups and associations, we also offer our communication services, as well as workshops and formations. There is something for everyone and every budget!


Other ways to help

Even if you can’t give money, doesn’t mean that you can’t lend a hand!

Talk about us, share our video on social media, sollicitate your colleagues, friends and family by sending them a link to our campaign.

You can also use our images as Facebook pictures and link them to our campaign. Make it known that you support the Solidarity Fund!

A big thanks from all of us at CLES!

story:
The EP Project

I have the opportunity to get into a professional studio and make my very first pro-studio record.  I've teamed up with acclaimed producer/engineer Neal Miskin and he has found us an amazing deal at Redlight Studio, Vancouver.  We are ready to record my career-launching album with real instrumentation, passionate performances and a ton of love.  We've got the songs, we've got the studio, we've got the musicians, we've got the talent, and now we need to fund it.  Your contributions will got directly towards the studio time, production costs and the final marketing and design when the record is finished. 

What We Need

-The Producer
Neal has given us an amazing rate and him and I will do the majority of the work ourselves to cut costs.
-The Studio
Again, we have haggled for a deep discount, but everyone needs to pay rent.
-The Musicians
Neal and I will be working very hard to play as many instruments as we can without outside help, but what we can't do needs to be done by pro-musicians and their talent is valuable.
-The Gear
To make music "the old fashioned way" (minimizing computer trickery) we need to play real instruments through real equipment.  We will be utilizing everything Redlight can offer as part of our rental agreement, but to get the professional sound we are aiming for, this will require the rental of some special vintage and modern equipment. 
-The Final Push (Design and Marketing)
We are very honoured and happy to get our music to you, our Indiegogo backers.  That said, getting our music to the world beyond your loving ears is essential for future success.  For this we will need to design packaging, print discs, swag, and promote, promote, promote.


Why?

Why go through all this time and effort to put out a record? 

It's how we make the world a better place. 

With sincere and heartfelt "non-commercial" music, we can reach out and make changes in the world.  Through the relation and reflection of our art, we create a ripple of positive social evolution that affects us all on micro and macro levels.  My music comes from my real life experiences.  I reflect upon my life experiences and relate it to others through my music from a place of acceptance and sincerity.  It's my hope that people will hear my songs and feel less alone in world.  They may even be inspired to create artworks of their own.

Risks & Challenges

There are a number of hurdles to cross in order to make this record work.  Neal and I have spend a long time carefully planning out our moves to make sure The EP Project is a complete success.   The main hurdle we have is funding.  If we don't meet our campaign goals, we may not be able to complete the record in the fashion we have envisioned.  This is where you come in.  Please share this campaign and tell as many people as you can about me, Rob Fillo, and my music.  Any love you send my way will be graciously accepted and turned into more music for people to enjoy.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some of you may want to help out in fashions beyond financial contribution.  That's great!  Please start by sharing this campaign with everyone you know.  If you have further ideas, feel free to get in touch with me directly through www.robfillo.com  You can also add me on Facebook, Instagram, Tumblr, YouTube, etc. to stay up to date on the goings-on in my world and assist with promotion.  Every bit helps.

I look forward to hearing all of your suggestions and welcome your contributions.

It is an honour and a pleasure to share my music with you.


SoundCloud:  https://soundcloud.com/robfillo
Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCvZYK2yThe9Ow-TyKhPmANg
Twitter:  @RobFillo
Facebook:  https://www.facebook.com/pages/Rob-Fillo/100652543386392
Instagram:  rob_fillo
Tumblr:  robfillo
