story:
** The crowdfunding campaign for the album has ended, recording will start in August 2016. In case you still want to contribute, and receive the perks, please contact liza@filmfestival.be **

Thanks! www.filmfestival.be / www.worldsoundtrackawards.com




 "If a piece of music was written for a film, the memories of many images cling around the piece in the beginning, then those images gradually go away. Then the essence of the piece of music would be distilled at the end."  

-Ryuichi Sakamoto


Make your contribution today. Support us and receive awesome perks. NEW! You can even help decide what tracks will make it to the album via this poll where you can make the decision for the final score: http://bit.ly/298gG6r

About Us

Because of its focus on film music Film Fest Gent launched the World Soundtrack Academy in 2001. The World Soundtrack Academy is aimed at organizing and overseeing the educational, cultural and professional aspects of the art of film music, including the preservation of the history of the soundtrack and its worldwide promotion.

The World Soundtrack Awards (#WSAwards) are awarded annually to mark and celebrate outstanding achievements in scoring music for motion pictures and television. Since many years, the WSAwards successfully put both established and upcoming film music composers in the limelight. We believe film music deserves appropriate recognition for its integral role in filmmaking.

This year the World Soundtrack Awards will be a two night event with television music as its central theme. On October 19 there will be an Awards Gala with a concert of temporary tv-scores (House of Cards, Mad Men, Dr. Who, Fargo,...) performed by Brussels Philharmonic conducted by Dirk Brossé. The second night, October 20 will repeat this concert and will also include another performance going back to the television series of our youth (Star Trek, Dallas, Man from U.N.C.L.E.,...).
Tickets can be found here and here.

World Soundtrack Lifetime Achievement Award

Each year a Lifetime Achievement Award is presented to a composer who deserves to be celebrated for his or her contributions to the landscape of film scoring.

This year we are proud to announce that Maestro Ryuichi Sakamoto will be the Lifetime achievement Award recipient for his work as film composer. Maestro Sakamoto is mostly known for his music in ‘Merry Christmas, Mr Lawrence’, ‘The Last Emperor’, ‘The Sheltering Sky’, ‘Little Budda’, ‘Femme Fatale’, and of course his most recent project, ‘The Revenant’.

Help us create a UNIQUE ALBUM!


About the WSAwards albums with Brussels Philharmonic

Our mission is to focus on the film and/or TV work of the composer rather than on his or hers separate scores. We need your help in creating an album praising the whole oeuvre of a composer. 

Each year we release an exclusive album where we gather the best of a composer’s work in film recorded with the acclaimed Brussels Philharmonic and several soloists, all conducted by Maestro Dirk Brossé. This way we are able to create a unique album with outstanding performances.

This album containing Sakamoto's film & TV work, will be recorded with a large symphonic orchestra, different ethnic instruments and soloists. 

About Ryuichi Sakamoto

 Says Patrick Duynslaegher, artistic director of Film Fest Gent:

‘We are extremely pleased to welcome Mr. Sakamoto next October at the World Soundtrack Awards Gala where he will be the recipient of the Lifetime Achievement Award for his work as a film composer. With his recent creative collaboration with Mexican director Alejandro G.Inarritu on The Revenant, Ryuichi Sakamoto found himself again at the forefront of the film music profession.’ 

‘Ryuichi Sakamoto was already a celebrated rock-pop composer / pianist / singer in Japan when he conquered the international film scene in 1983 with his score for Nagisa Oshima’s Merry Christmas Mr.Lawrence, a film in which he also starred alongside David Bowie. Ever since, his work for leading Japanese (Oshima again for Gohatto) and international directors (Bernardo Bertolucci’s The Last Emperor, in which he also played a part and for which he won an Academy Award for best Original Score, The Sheltering Sky and Little Buddha; Brian De Palma’s Snake Eyes and Femme Fatale; Pedro Almodovar’s High Heels; Volker Schlöndorff’s The Handmaid’s Tale; Oliver Stone’s produced television miniseries Wild Palms) revealed him as one of the most inventive film composers of our time.’

‘For those films and many more Japanese titles that didn’t get released in the West, he conceived a unique approach of composing for the movies: a blend of splendid melodies, synthesizer work, traditional orchestral music, drum tracks, sound effects and unusual musical colors. Out of the striking contrasts of musical styles and cultures, he created standout scores that will never stop to fascinate and enchant us.’

What's in it for YOU

There are some pretty cool perks, like a MEET & GREET with Mr. Sakamoto himself, a DUO VIP-ticket for the 16th World Soundtrack Awards Gala, your name on the thanks page of the album, a hotel stay, attending the World Soundtrack Awards Rehearsal, attending a recording session for the album, and MANY MORE! 
Look at the perks for more information!
Our backers will be awarded regularly with some cool news, gadgets and surprises! #staytuned
story_txt:
** The crowdfunding campaign for the album has ended, recording will start in August 2016. In case you still want to contribute, and receive the perks, please contact liza@filmfestival.be ** Thanks! www.filmfestival.be / www.worldsoundtrackawards.com "If a piece of music was written for a film, the memories of many images cling around the piece in the beginning, then those images gradually go away. Then the essence of the piece of music would be distilled at the end."  -Ryuichi SakamotoMake your contribution today. Support us and receive awesome perks. NEW! You can even help decide what tracks will make it to the album via this poll where you can make the decision for the final score: http://bit.ly/298gG6r 


About Us
Because of its focus on film music Film Fest Gent launched the World Soundtrack Academy in 2001. The World Soundtrack Academy is aimed at organizing and overseeing
the educational, cultural and professional aspects of the art of film music,
including the preservation of the history of the soundtrack and its worldwide
promotion. 
The World Soundtrack Awards (#WSAwards) are awarded
annually to mark and celebrate outstanding achievements in scoring music for
motion pictures and television. Since
many years, the WSAwards successfully put both established and upcoming film
music composers in the limelight. We believe film music deserves appropriate
recognition for its integral role in filmmaking.
This year the World Soundtrack Awards will be a two night event with television music as its central theme. On October 19 there will be an Awards Gala with a concert of temporary tv-scores (House of Cards, Mad Men, Dr. Who, Fargo,...) performed by Brussels Philharmonic conducted by Dirk Brossé. The second night, October 20 will repeat this concert and will also include another performance going back to the television series of our youth (Star Trek, Dallas, Man from U.N.C.L.E.,...).Tickets can be found here and here.

World Soundtrack Lifetime Achievement Award
 

Each year a Lifetime Achievement Award is
presented to a composer who deserves to be celebrated for his or her
contributions to the landscape of film scoring. 
This year we are proud to announce that Maestro Ryuichi Sakamoto will be the Lifetime achievement Award recipient for his work as film composer. Maestro Sakamoto is mostly known for his
music in ‘Merry Christmas, Mr Lawrence’,
‘The Last Emperor’, ‘The Sheltering Sky’,
‘Little Budda’, ‘Femme Fatale’, and of course his most recent project, ‘The Revenant’.
    Help us create a UNIQUE ALBUM! 





About the WSAwards albums with Brussels Philharmonic

Our mission is to focus on the film and/or TV work of the composer rather than on his or hers separate scores. We need your help in creating an album praising the whole oeuvre of a composer. 
Each year we release an exclusive album where we gather the best of a composer’s work in film recorded with the acclaimed Brussels Philharmonic and several soloists, all conducted by Maestro Dirk Brossé. This way we are able to create a unique album with outstanding performances.
This album containing Sakamoto's film & TV work, will be recorded with a large symphonic orchestra, different ethnic instruments and soloists. 


About Ryuichi Sakamoto

 Says Patrick Duynslaegher, artistic director of Film Fest Gent:


‘We are extremely pleased to welcome Mr. Sakamoto next October at the World Soundtrack Awards Gala where he will be the recipient of the Lifetime Achievement Award for his work as a film composer. With his recent creative collaboration with Mexican director Alejandro G.Inarritu on The Revenant, Ryuichi Sakamoto found himself again at the forefront of the film music profession.’ 
‘Ryuichi Sakamoto was already a celebrated rock-pop composer / pianist / singer in Japan when he conquered the international film scene in 1983 with his score for Nagisa Oshima’s Merry Christmas Mr.Lawrence, a film in which he also starred alongside David Bowie. Ever since, his work for leading Japanese (Oshima again for Gohatto) and international directors (Bernardo Bertolucci’s The Last Emperor, in which he also played a part and for which he won an Academy Award for best Original Score, The Sheltering Sky and Little Buddha; Brian De Palma’s Snake Eyes and Femme Fatale; Pedro Almodovar’s High Heels; Volker Schlöndorff’s The Handmaid’s Tale; Oliver Stone’s produced television miniseries Wild Palms) revealed him as one of the most inventive film composers of our time.’
‘For those films and many more Japanese titles that didn’t get released in the West, he conceived a unique approach of composing for the movies: a blend of splendid melodies, synthesizer work, traditional orchestral music, drum tracks, sound effects and unusual musical colors. Out of the striking contrasts of musical styles and cultures, he created standout scores that will never stop to fascinate and enchant us.’
What's in it for YOU
There are some pretty cool perks, like a MEET & GREET with Mr. Sakamoto himself, a DUO VIP-ticket for the 16th World Soundtrack Awards Gala, your name on the thanks page of the album, a hotel stay, attending the World Soundtrack Awards Rehearsal, attending a recording session for the album, and MANY MORE! Look at the perks for more information!
Our backers will be awarded regularly with some cool news, gadgets and surprises! #staytuned

story:
From Joni Mitchell to Lady Gaga, countless musicians made the leap from recording demos in their bedroom to playing in front of huge crowds and recording full length albums. 

Passion, determination and talent were only the first ingredients to success for many legendary female musicians that started from nothing. 

How did they do it? They had someone believing in them, supporting them!

So now it’s my turn: I’m finally taking the leap from recording demos in my room to recording full length songs in a studio with a band. And you can help me do it!


Who am I?

My name is Helena. I'm a Swedish musician based in Zurich on my way to New York. I've been composing since I was 13 and have always dreamed of sharing my creations with others.


What is this campaign for?

This campaign is for my first EP "Blind". We'll be recording it at the Department of Noise Studios in Zurich in July. 

I'll be supported by these wonderful musicians:

Yves Gerber (git.)

Miriam Burger (arr./ strings)

I myself will be doing vocals, playing the guitar and the ukulele!

I have chosen 4 of my favorite and most meaningful songs for this EP and would like to have the opportunity to record them with my band in a proper studio. 


Why should you contribute?

To be able to share my music with the world and with you, I need your financial support.  

Contributing to the creation of “Blind” is not just a financial investment, you'll be impacting my future as a musician! 

You’ll be supporting me as an independent artist, motivating other passionate and talented people to believe in themselves, and contribute to shaping the Swiss music industry.

And if you help me, you’ll definitely be seeing more of me and hearing more of my music!


What do we need?

Recording a CD takes an enormous amount of time and resources. The process of recording will take about a week and most of the money collected will go to paying for the use of the studio and the support of the talented staff at the studio.

Some of the money will be going to the production of the actual CD. We'll be working with local artists an designers to get a fresh and unique design. We will keep it simple but of course we want a professional product that people can appreciate with both their eyes and ears!


What can you get?

We have come up with different perks you can get when you pledge.

There are experiences such as a studio visit or a phone call on your birthday, but you can also receive things like a personalized postcard or a signed CD.


Why record an EP?

Not only has this been a lifelong dream of mine, but this EP is meant to be somewhat of a calling card for my future musical endeavors. I'll be moving to New York this fall to attend the Manhattan School of Music. What would be more perfect than to have 4 pieces of my soul available to bring to New York to kick start my career in music?

I believe this EP will have an impact not only on my own career, but on the ones who listen to it.


What other ways can you help?

Being a student myself, I understand if you don't have the funds to contribute to someone else's dream when you're chasing your own. That's okay!

You can simply like and share my campaign with others and you'll already be helping me.


Thank you!

I am so incredibly grateful for all of the support I've received so far, the people that believe in me and my music. I wouldn't have gotten this far without having so many people motivate me and support me. The best thing I know is when I can reach someone through my music.

story:
My name is Damian Clarke. I am an artist and musician. I play two rare instruments: the Hammer Dulcimer and the Hurdy Gurdy. You can see and hear a lot more on my website at www.damianclarke.co.uk, or go on youtube at https://youtu.be/OWBwFOd2pDE
I have a new CD album being launched on May 30th 2016, with 14 songs and tunes, mostly featuring the Dulcimer which I am on a mission to bring to people's ears, so that they too will fall in love with it. This is where you can help me. I want to promote this album in the press and to lots of Radio stations around the world and that needs a budget.
I sell CDs mainly at concerts and whenever I busk and this way I overcome the hurdles of not being a mainstream musician with an easily marketable style and persona. After all, I'm a nearly 58, a white, bald, bearded man who doesn't know when to shut up. But as one of the songs on the CD says, "Nobody's written the Rules" and I'm proud to be just as creative and motivated, if not more so, as I was at 18.
I am very excited that this CD, unlike my first two solo CDs, will feature mostly my own songs, plus a couple from friends who have written music and words that have been important to me. So this CD is like my autobiography.
Also, I have discovered that I love combining opportunities to play music alongside my artwork. So, I have started to include texts or even lyrics within some of my paintings. I always use an original painting as the starting point for the CD artwork and these always sell straightaway. So I have decided to offer the originals for the inner and outer covers as part of this funding campaign.

What I Need & What You Get

I am looking for a promotional budget of at least £1500.  I want to take out ads in some recognised international music magazines and most importantly send the CD to loads of radio stations:

Advert in FRoots, UK magazine: £350
Advert in R2 UK magazine: £250
Advert in Folker, German magazine: £300
Advert in Living Tradition : UK magazine £250
Misc adverts in various smaller folk magazines: £150
Postage to 100 radio stations: £200

I can offer some great perks, if you'd like to support me beyond buying a CD (which is always appreciated!) I have three original paintings at a special price for this campaign, which were used to create the artwork for the CD cover. I have prints taken from these images which I embellish so that each one is slightly unique. So you can own a piece of original art from my own hand that relates to the CD.

I am also offering to play a house concert for you, or a fundraiser for a charity that you support.

    Doing it my way!

    I have always enjoyed the way that we can carve out our own path and not have to fit into the mainstream. The punk revolution in the mid 70's co-incided with my time at Art College and an incredibly important time for me, opening my ideas to possibilities and ambitions that I had hitherto never dreamed as possible, along with many other people at that time. 

    I really want the Hammer Dulcimer (and the Hurdy Gurdy) to be enjoyed by as many people as possible, but the guitar seems to rule the folk world at the moment and many promoters are nervous at putting on a Dulcimer concert as they think audiences don't know about the instrument. So, I have to break the mould, introduce it and then I KNOW that most people are intrigued and love the sound.

    By advertising and getting the CD on the radio, I can do this, but it is expensive. So your extra support really helps me to do this. I will use as much of the funding as I receive to fund the promotion. 

    You are welcome to come and see the paintings in real life. I can bring them to gigs, or show them at my Open Studios. I will be open every day between May 28th and June 12th as part of Dorset Arts Weeks and before / after that by appointment.
    I have a proven track record of selling paintings and prints over the last 5 years. My first two CD cover paintings both sold on the first day they were exhibited. All three paintings use the idea of words and ideas creating unforeseen waves, echoing and impacting on those around us, changing the direction of our lives, merging with others, or breaking up and dissolving into a new idea. The paintings relate to the song "One more Gaudy Night" starting with a quote from Anthony and Cleopatra. The lyrics refer to my relationships, with my wife and family, touring and Pressgang.  "Something to say" 1 and 2 both contain lyrics from that song. I have always believed strongly in freedom of speech but for some years I kept my council rather than be outspoken. But now I am freed to speak out again and hopefully support those for whom that is difficult, or even life-threatening. The paintings are darker yet with glimpses of light shining through.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Please feel free to share this campaign via Social Media. There are thousands of people who know me from playing with Pressgang and who may well want to support me.

story:
For too long the art and music have been very distant...                                 now is the time to  change that.

‘Hearing Art Seeing Sound’ is an annual contemporary art and music festival that combines various art forms and presents a platform for new works to emerge. Its unique concept is rooted in collaboration, bringing artists and art disciplines together. The project is fully dedicated to intellectual and cultural exchange between international composers and Armenian visual artists. This year's location is Yerevan, Armenia. 

                                                     www.hassfest.com  

               

          

  • Create a dialogue through art, extend the boundaries of Armenian contemporary art, and bring it into international light. 
  • Establish a unique cultural event in Armenia which will transcend the borders of ethnicity and nationality. 
  • Bring contemporary arts and music into the mainstream. We want to attract as many people as possible in order to broaden their perspectives of life. We want people to talk about the arts and make them a part of their everyday life.

  •  Present Art and creativity as an essential necessity.  Nowadays more and more people feel the need to escape from an increasingly mechanized and so-called rational culture. Every soul is rich , but it needs food. Art is that food.  

     

       

We have united the brightest artistic talents of today from around the world. We have brought passionate young composers, inspiring artists, and dedicated musicians together in one place. We will mix these ingredients and serve them at the festival. It's as simple as that. 

Final performances present 7 months of collaborative work by creative minds from all over the world. They haven't met before, but they have shared their experiences and thoughts over long distances and have worked together on one final product.   

 

 And many more....


The audience will get the chance to hear music in a new way and see art in a fourth dimension. This will change the growing tradition of barely looking at a new canvas into a mindful and communicative approach that draws the observer into a more spiritual atmosphere where one can simply be with and in art.

                                              

     



Serj Tankian (California) and his Musical Paintings

Armenian Artist, Composer, Vocalist of System of a Down.

                 

Vahe Berberian (California) collaboration with Bofan Ma

Armenian Artist, Author, Actor

                     


Lucie Abdalian (New York) live performance with a Dj Adam Longman Parker from (Berlin) Performing artist, actress.   

                                                        


 Ensemble x.y. is a contemporary ensemble that commissions and performs new music in a flexible and ever-changing lineup. Formed in late 2014, Ensemble x.y seeks to add to the music of the 21st Century by commissioning young composers and performing thematically charged programmes that combine newly commissioned works with the often underplayed works of the modern era.



And many other great performers, artists and composers


So far we have united composers from the USA, UK, China, Switzerland, Russia, Thailand and other countries; Contemporary music performers from France, Turkey, the UK, Armenia, Spain, Kazakhstan, Switzerland; and fine artists, who are leading figures of the Armenian art scene.

12 composers, 12 artists, 19 international musicians and 3 Armenian musicians will gather together for 6 days of events that will consist of masterclasses, seminars, HassGuitarFest, street performances, concerts and a final Flashmob, where every visitor will get the chance to take part in the creation of an artwork. For this, we have provided over 25 meters of canvas. All performances will be professionally recorded and presented at the Dalan Art Gallery with earphones attached to the artworks.

    

We truly believe our project is important for everyone. It's time to push creativity onto a new level and make it mass action. The festival offers opportunities for cutting-edge artists. It combines technology, imagination, and the current generation of young talents. 

Every voice counts and right now we need your support. This will give us the energy to continue our mission and fulfill the vision of the festival we have. 

We need to buy round-trip flights for 23 musicians, composers and artists from around the globe who will travel to Armenia as participants to the festival. We have managed to cover most of the participants expenditures already and just a little is left to raise. With your help we will be able to support the rest, as well as a few additional costs, such as performance equipment and recording studio fees. 

        

  • Accommodation for international participants

  • Flight tickets for performers and artists

  • Recording sessions

  • Equipment hire


 

We have prepared few specially edited by our artists and musicians items for you to keep the memory about the 'Hearing Art Seeing Sound Festival".
The list includes:
Pillowcases with a silk screen print on featuring Armenian artists works, and Armenian themes from Yevgine Martirosyan.
Signed CD's from starring guitarists. 
Signed Poster with an artwork reproduction in the size of the original from a starring artist.
T-shirt with the Festival's logo and an art print (silk screen).
Dinner with all participants on the opening or closing ceremony.
Original paintings by Arthur Sarkissian. 
                                              


                          


                                                          Arthur Sarkissian

          

                            




                              


               

           

The festival is organised by “Progressive Art Agency”, an international artistic collective, working together to produce art that crosses all borders and disciplines. Working with artists, composers, musicians, directors, and cinematographers, we aim to create an artistic experience like no other. We promote the work of musicians, composers, and artists from across the globe. The organisation aims to cross borders both artistically and politically by striving to create unity across the world’s divides and by promoting upcoming talent and celebrating some of the world’s unknown gems. It is a group that goes beyond promotion by producing projects, masterclasses, and contemporary art and music events.

The ProArt main team members are: Van Sarkissian, Ben Lunn, and Assel Abilseitova. Being classical musicians and composers ourselves, we understand the demands of today's art scene. We aim to be a stimulus for the progression of art and to be the producers of the next daring cultural and artistic events. 



Main Staff

Van Sarkissian - General Director

"Art has been as active as a volcano in particular periods of time, like the Renaissance in Florence or Modernism in Paris. Modernism is one of the brightest moments in cultural history, where artists, writers and musicians such as Picasso and Stravinsky came to Paris and led the cultural movement. The air was thick with art, giving birth to many new artworks and "ism"s and becoming the centre of development for art at that time. Our aim is to recreate this formula, where we can fill the atmosphere with the art of today which will hopefully give birth to many new cultural horizons."

 Assel Abilseitova- Deputy Director, Project manager

      "I've always thought that I am lucky to be a musician, that I have this opportunity to express myself . The idea that only a selected group of people are involved in creative arts and have it as an important part of their lives just doesn't sound right to me. The festival aims to attract attention to different arts and music, to challenge the imagination, to get outside the box and explore more".                                                                                                                                                                                                     

Ben Lunn- Program Director & Head of International Department

"When I started discussing this project with Assel and Van, I felt amazingly driven and animated. I was overjoyed for two reasons: firstly, I thought it was a truly noble endeavour to join artists from a variety of backgrounds with composers. But I also find the idea of using art and culture to bring nations and people closer together is such a vital thing and this project is a great opportunity to do so. Supporting this project and festival will help increase the success of such a noble goal".

  Support us and take your part at the development of contemporary art and music.

Vahe Berberian (California) collaboration with Bofan Ma
Armenian Artist, Author, Actor

                     
Lucie Abdalian (New York) live performance with a Dj Adam Longman Parker from (Berlin) Performing artist, actress.   
                                                        

 Ensemble x.y. is a contemporary ensemble that commissions and performs new music in a flexible and ever-changing lineup. Formed in late 2014, Ensemble x.y seeks to add to the music of the 21st Century by commissioning young composers and performing thematically charged programmes that combine newly commissioned works with the often underplayed works of the modern era.



And many other great performers, artists and composers



So far we have united composers from the USA, UK, China, Switzerland, Russia, Thailand and other countries; Contemporary music performers from France, Turkey, the UK, Armenia, Spain, Kazakhstan, Switzerland; and fine artists, who are leading figures of the Armenian art scene.
12 composers, 12 artists, 19 international musicians and 3 Armenian musicians will gather together for 6 days of events that will consist of masterclasses, seminars, HassGuitarFest, street performances, concerts and a final Flashmob, where every visitor will get the chance to take part in the creation of an artwork. For this, we have provided over 25 meters of canvas. All performances will be professionally recorded and presented at the Dalan Art Gallery with earphones attached to the artworks.

    

We truly believe our project is important for everyone. It's time to push creativity onto a new level and make it mass action. The festival offers opportunities for cutting-edge artists. It combines technology, imagination, and the current generation of young talents. 
Every voice counts and right now we need your support. This will give us the energy to continue our mission and fulfill the vision of the festival we have. We need to buy round-trip flights for 23 musicians, composers and artists from around the globe who will travel to Armenia as participants to the festival. We have managed to cover most of the participants expenditures already and just a little is left to raise. With your help we will be able to support the rest, as well as a few additional costs, such as performance equipment and recording studio fees. 



        

Accommodation for international participants
Flight tickets for performers and artists
Recording sessions
Equipment hire




 

We have prepared few specially edited by our artists and musicians items for you to keep the memory about the 'Hearing Art Seeing Sound Festival".The list includes:
Pillowcases with a silk screen print on featuring Armenian artists works, and Armenian themes from Yevgine Martirosyan.
Signed CD's from starring guitarists. 
Signed Poster with an artwork reproduction in the size of the original from a starring artist.
T-shirt with the Festival's logo and an art print (silk screen).
Dinner with all participants on the opening or closing ceremony.
Original paintings by Arthur Sarkissian.                                               
                          

                                                          Arthur Sarkissian
          
                            





                              

                
           
The festival is organised by “Progressive Art Agency”, an international artistic collective, working together to produce art that crosses all borders and disciplines. Working with artists, composers, musicians, directors, and cinematographers, we aim to create an artistic experience like no other. We promote the work of musicians, composers, and artists from across the globe. The organisation aims to cross borders both artistically and politically by striving to create unity across the world’s divides and by promoting upcoming talent and celebrating some of the world’s unknown gems. It is a group that goes beyond promotion by producing projects, masterclasses, and contemporary art and music events.

The ProArt main team members are: Van Sarkissian, Ben Lunn, and Assel Abilseitova. Being classical musicians and composers ourselves, we understand the demands of today's art scene. We aim to be a stimulus for the progression of art and to be the producers of the next daring cultural and artistic events. 


Main Staff
Van Sarkissian - General Director


"Art has been as active as a volcano in particular periods of time, like the Renaissance in Florence or Modernism in Paris. Modernism is one of the brightest moments in cultural history, where artists, writers and musicians such as Picasso and Stravinsky came to Paris and led the cultural movement. The air was thick with art, giving birth to many new artworks and "ism"s and becoming the centre of development for art at that time. Our aim is to recreate this formula, where we can fill the atmosphere with the art of today which will hopefully give birth to many new cultural horizons."
 Assel Abilseitova- Deputy Director, Project manager

      "I've always thought that I am lucky to be a musician, that I have this opportunity to express myself . The idea that only a selected group of people are involved in creative arts and have it as an important part of their lives just doesn't sound right to me. The festival aims to attract attention to different arts and music, to challenge the imagination, to get outside the box and explore more".                                                                                                                                                                                                     

Ben Lunn- Program Director & Head of International Department



"When I started discussing this project with Assel and Van, I felt amazingly driven and animated. I was overjoyed for two reasons: firstly, I thought it was a truly noble endeavour to join artists from a variety of backgrounds with composers. But I also find the idea of using art and culture to bring nations and people closer together is such a vital thing and this project is a great opportunity to do so. Supporting this project and festival will help increase the success of such a noble goal".
  Support us and take your part at the development of contemporary art and music.

story:
theSHIFT is a new band out of NYC. In just 1 year we have been around the entire country 3 times played over 250 shows and traveled 68,000 miles in our tour van all in the interest of introducing our music to the world one mile at a time and promoting our debut record "7th Direction". The response to theSHIFT has been overwhelming wherever we go but particularly in the vast metropolis of Lima, Peru.
Last October we began to notice that we were receiving a few messages in Spanish below our video "DREAMS". As these messages began to pick up frequency, we started to interact and found out the main radio station Radio Doble Nueve 99.1 had put us into heavy rotation and that people were requesting it non-stop. They said "We love theSHIFT! Lima, Peru welcomes you"
From there it exploded further. "Dreams" went from 3200 plays to over 60,000 in about 5 months. It was at the top of the charts in Lima for over 7 weeks and stayed at #1 for over 2 weeks straight. It was then voted #5 best song of the year, all within 3 Months! We have been waiting for an invitation to play in Lima and that invitation has finally come but the funds in a country like Peru to bring smaller name acts to the country are very limited...which is why we are here. Help us get to Peru, bring our music to the people, and discover what is awaiting us there!

 

 

"How did this all happen?". As it turns out, upon further digging, we discovered our good friend Alan had taken a vacation to Lima, Peru that fall bringing several of our CDs with them. Now Alan is a great friend but he is also a super fan of theSHIFT and fully fluent in Spanish so he was playing our music to anyone that would listen. By his account he was in a cab playing the CD for the cab driver who loved it and asked if he could keep the copy to give to his brother who is a DJ in Peru. Ahhh...the plot thickens. Help us follow up on this mysterious chain of events!

story:
Short Summary

 Hello everyone, we are The Drip Effect. We are an alternative/hard rock band in South Florida, formed in 2011. We have recorded and released an EP titled "Dinosaw" and we are currently in the studio recording our second release.

We understand many of you coming across this probably have no idea who we are or what our music is like. We have included our first single "Diorama" from this project to give you an idea: https://soundcloud.com/the-drip-effect/diorama

 This next release is set to be a full length album (LP), and we believe that not just our music, but our lyric writing improved leaps and bounds over the course of making this record. The album is titled "What Holds You Down". We specifically wrote this album to tell a story, and we truly believe it does. We feel it is very different, and a huge improvement over our first EP. A lot more emotion, careful and deep thought, and time went into this process. This lead to what we think, is a darker, gloomier, more melodic album but still keeping our edge. We also believe there is a lot more relatability for listeners. This means a lot to us, and we believe it could mean a lot for anyone willing to give it a chance.

We have self-funded a very large portion of this process already. As we did with our first release, completely. However, while we all have day jobs this is beginning to be a little more than we thought we could handle on our own, considering it is a full length album. We're not asking for strictly donations, and we are not asking for anyone to "fund" our project. We're asking people to buy it in advance so we can use that money for the remainder of the project. It's essentially a pre-sale, in which the money we get immediately goes back into the project. Those who contribute WILL receive something in return (album, stickers, t-shirt, etc). We will explain packages and details below.

What We Need & What You Get

Alright guys, so our goal for this campaign is to reach $3000. These funds will be used for remaining tracking (recording) costs, production, CD and artwork printing expenses, and will also allow us to get this thing out earlier, rather than later.
We have some really cool packages available. We believe there is something for everyone here. $8 gets you a digital download of our album, and for just $2 more you can get the physical copy along with it, plus a free bumper sticker! We are on "flexible funding" so we will still receive any contributions that are made whether we reach the goal or not. That means if you contribute, you are GUARANTEED the package you paid for, and ALL funds will be used for everything we explained above.
We love what we do, and at the end of the day we will get this thing out whether we make our goal or not. We completely self-funded our first EP, but a full length album has proved difficult. Words can't express how much any help, or contributions will mean to us. We also see this as an opportunity to potentially share our music with people who may never have discovered it otherwise.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone is able to contribute. However, you can still help us out IMMENSELY by spreading the word. The more people we reach, the better chance we have at meeting our goals. So anything you can do to get the word out would be greatly appreciated!

story:
Short Summary

  • I am a recovering addict and stripper turned musician. I have an educational and employment background in various artistic and technical fields that include, music, visual arts, 3D animation, film production, audio engineering, dance, interior design, acting, stage craft and business. Borg Queen is an intergrated project of every discipline I have every trained for or worked in professionally. Everything you hear and see is created by me.
  •  My intention by sharing my story Sex, Drugs & Shiny Brass Poles is to inspire hope to those people who are facing adversity and struggling with issues mental health, addiction, poverty and abuse. It's a true story of overcoming addiction, depression and domestic violence while discovering purpose, love and acceptance in the most unlikely of places...a strip club. The message is, that regardless of your social status and mistakes you've made, everyone has intrinsic value and purpose, and no matter how far you've fallen there is light at the end of the tunnel.
  • With your help I can finally have the means to spread the message of hope and acceptance to a broader audience. To date I've personally funded the recording, production and mixing of the album and the production of 4 extremely high quality music videos. With your help I can have the album mastered, CD's and merch printed, and hire a PR firm to start spreading the love.

What You Get


What I Need

  • Based on the quotes I've received I am looking to raise $8,965 to get the ball rolling on this release. 
  • $3,000 for PR, 
  • $1,600 for live show production costs
  • $1,650 for physical CD printing, 
  • $1,050 for album mastering  
  • $800 for merch printing
  • $815 to cover Indigogo fees and payment processing
  • Mastering the album is the priority and funds will be allocated to mastering first before anything else. If I do not reach my target goal then I will will scale down the quantity of merch and physical CD's to be printed or use a print on demand service. PR companies have different levels of PR for different budgets so I'll just go with a less comprehensive one and take a more DIY approach to my PR where I can.  To date I've funded everything myself through hard work and savings and I'll keep doing it to achieve my goals. It will just take longer.

The Impact

  • Your contribution is more than just a monetary one. You are supporting a message of hope in dark times. Your contribution is a show of solidarity with those battling their demons of depression, addiction and abuse. You are providing comfort and encouragement through art to those going through dark times.
  • Since getting clean 7 years ago I've made it my own personal mission statement to use my talents as an artist to reach out to the lonely, isolated, depressed and abused. 
  • PR is the key to this campaign as it will be the most effective tool to reach the right audience. 

Risks & Challenges

  • Having worked in Arts and Entertainment for over 16 years I'm not naive to the unique challenges faced by artists. Because of this fact I've also invested in a business education to better equip myself. 
  • I'm serious about craft and treat it like a business. I view the launch and release of my debut album as a business start up. 
  • I know that in a start up business the majority of your budget needs to be invested into marketing
  • I've conducted 3 years of market research in order to determine my target market and how to reach them.
  • I've invested tens of thousands of dollars of my own personal money without going into debt to create a quality product.  My work to date speaks for itself.
  • I'm fiscally responsible, resourceful and fully committed to my life's purpose of using my art to touch people's lives in a positive way.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can't make a financial contribution, please share my campaign through email and social media. If you write a personal little note as to why you believe in what I'm doing when you share then you increase my chances of reaching my goal.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
My name is Andrew Strassell and I love guitars. I own a bunch and have enjoyed tinkering with them to get different sounds and tones. One thing that always seemed frustrating was changing pickups. I had to take off the guitar strings, de-solder connections, try to remember how the whole thing went back together, then put new strings on, re-tune and hope the intonation wasn't affected. This bothered me. So, I did something about it.

I created a 3D-printed system that allows guitarists to quickly and simply change guitar pickups through the back of the guitar--think of video game cartridges except each cartridge contains your favorite pickup. It's different than anything out there because pickup cartridges are held in place with a set on magnets instead of clips that tend to break...and, it's 3D-printed so any style of guitar pickup can be used.

I've been promoting the quick-connect pickup system for the last several months to see what sort of traction I could get in the marketplace. The system has received notable press from the tech, guitar, and 3D-printing industry (www.psfk.com, www.ultimate-guitar.com, www.3dprint.com).

Now it is time to take the design to the next step and apply for a patent.

To apply for a patent with the U.S. government, I am trying to raise $5,000 in 50 days. The funds will mostly go to lawyers.

I have set up four funding levels, all of which have perks:

  • Level 1: Donation amount = $10 (perk = receive a Strassell Guitar sticker)
  • Level 2: Donation amount = $20 (perk = receive a Strassell Guitar beverage koozie)
  • Level 3: Donation amount = $30 (perk = receive a Strassell Guitar t-shirt)
  • Level 4: Donation amount = $50 (perk = receive a Strassell Guitar sticker, koozie, and t-shirt)
Or, if you just want to donate and not request a perk there is an option to do so.

If I don't reach my goal, I will donate a portion of the funds raised to a charity.

I realize that not everyone is able to donate. That's okay. I encourage you to spread the word. Thanks.

story:
Hi.  I'm Burgs, and the Give Back Generation is about all of us...

We...that's you and me; all of us, ARE the Give Back Generation. We are the generation in whose hands the future lies. Our decision to start 'giving back' will define the world our childen inherit in 30 years from now.

For the past twenty years I have taught meditation to thousands of people from all ages and backgrounds. During this time I have watched how we have become increasingly overwhelmed in the wake of the increasing uncertainty of this technological age. I am passionately committed to empowering people towards a positive and courageous response to those challenges. We are alive at a unique moment in history and how we meet these challenges, will determine the future for generations to come.

If you have a deep longing to seek and see changes in the way we are approaching the challenges in front of us, please take time to look at the material I have shared and get behind this campaign.

 The book "The Give Back Generation; A Survival Guide to Staying Conscious" takes a deep and honest look at the changing quality of our living experience and the challenges it faces in the wake of the technological age. It looks at the effect this is having upon the way we are functioning, and investigates some of the compelling indicators that suggest we need to embrace wholesale change if we are going to safeguard the integrity of our  living experience. in essence the book looks deeply at what it actually means to be a human being. This is not an environmental arguement. It is a penetrating look at the very nature of the human condition. But it is also a call to action. A call to arms to all you Brave Souls out there who have it in your heart  to stand tall now and find the courage to ask difficult questions and dig deep in the search for answer.

I know it is normally the case that these pitches need to be made in a few minutes of video sound bite. But this is slightly different. I am asking you to stop for long enough to refelct upon some of the things that are going on around us; to beathe out and ask yourself, " How Do I feel? "

Please watch the videos and listen to the sample tracks. Have a look at the summary for the book and see if it resonates with you. Because with your support now we can get this book and album in to peoples hands by the end of the summer. We are not far away. The book is written we need only to finish the edit and do the design and production.

The Album. Brave Souls is intended to compliment the book and it is a collaborative project on which I have worked with a diverse and telented group of musicians from around the world. you can listen to sample tracks here.

Brave Souls playlist

I dearly want to share this material now. Because it is current and it is important, and I hope that by reaching out to all of you, we can make it happen. We are all passionately in love with life and in need of a road map back to the essence of our being. This is why I have subtitled the book. "A Survival Guide to Staying Conscious."

Things are changing so fast. I do not feel we can stand aside for even the time it would take to bring this book to press through a publisher. But with your help I can get this book and album to those who it may help encourage and inspire by the end of the summer. 

So what is the story I want to tell?

The Book:  'The Give Back Generation: A survival guide to staying conscious'



In this book I hope to take you on a journey deep into the very heart of the mystery that is life, in the hope that by looking a little more deeply at what is actually going on in the background of our lives, right now for us as a society and as humans on this planet, we might re- establish a healthier and more enriching relationship to the life that each of us is a part of.

I would like to encourage you to look at life with an open mind and a courageous heart so that we might reach a place of deep reverence and respect of life. I believe that only once we have re discovered the sense of awe and wonder at life, and learn once again to see it as deeply sacred, will we develop a more healthy attitude towards it that will form the backbone and bedrock of not just our own welfare, but that of the generations to come.

 I wish to propose a solution, which is for all of us to collectively become part of what I call the Give Back Generation, a generation who seek to contribute to the world every bit as enthusiastically as we have sought to take out what we can from it. In fifty years from now, history will testify how we chose to meet our challenges, and those who follow in our wake will live through the outcome of the choices we now make.

The Album. Brave Souls



 Click to listen to the  Brave Souls playlist ( Stay Tuned ! These are early unmastered mixes and with your help we will bring them up to professional quality for final release. This list is regularly updated as new material is completed.)

The Album is also called "Brave Souls" and I see it as an invitation for us all to  become exactly that. I have gathered 10 motivational discourses taken from the last 10 years. It has been a privilege to collaborate on this with a number of amazing musicians from around the world, to create what I hope will be a profound listening, healing and meditative experience. I hope to take you on a journey of reflection into how we might live more fully, courageously and considerately.  The Album is in effect a call to arms; an invitation to find the Brave Soul in each of us so that together we might forge a bright new future as the Give Back Generation.

Below are some short clips set to two of the tracks from " Brave Souls"


Going Forward

By supporting our campaign you are not just purchasing one of the perks on offer, you are enabling this material to reach out to an audience that I know will hugely benefit and appreciate it. 

What we need and what you get

With valuable help from many volunteers we have gone as far as we can on the production of both the book and the album.  We now need to spend real money to bring them to completion where they can be offered to a wide audience. With your help we can achieve this.  Initially we are looking for funding to:

  • Complete  and publish the book.  Whilst the book is now largely written, we need funding to pay for professional editing, proof-reading, production, an initial print run of 1000 books, distribution and marketing. We estimate these costs to be £10k.
  • Complete and publish the album. Most of the vocals and half the music is now recorded. We now need funding to pay for final mixing, mastering, album production and distribution and marketing. We estimate these costs to be £15k.
  • 10k for archive editing and publishing for the next 2 years. All funding in excess of the 25k for production will fund the on going edit and publication of our large archive of material. We hope to publish the entire library of over 500 hours of material in the next 2 years. You contributions will help to fund this ongoing work.

Below is the full version of the Album track " The Most Moving Experience there is"


( Click here) visit the Give Back Generation page on our website.

FAQs

What happens if we do not reach our initial target?  In this case we will prioritise the production of the book.

Can we deliver the products?  We have considerable experience across our volunteers in  media production.  Burgs has already self-published three books. Burgs has had a great following on Soundcloud for some years now and we are confident that the album will be hugely popular. We believe we have an excellent track record on managing our projects and delivering projected outcomes.

Why are we self publishing this book?  The book is a response to current predicaments. Things are changing so fast, and we need to get motivated and galvanised right now in search of positive solutions. The time that it will take to bring this book to print through conventional publishers is just too long.

What happens if we exceed our initial target?  All additional and on-going  funding will contribute to making as much of our library available to a wider audience.  This will involve funding as many people as possible to work on editing the material and preparing it for distribution.


We appreciate that not everyone can afford to contribute money to support us. However, if the Give Back Generation resonates with you then please do spread the word with your friends and contacts. Send them links to this campaign or  The Art of Mediation or the Give Back Generation.

Thank you for your support.

Burgs.
story_txt:
Hi.  I'm Burgs, and the Give Back Generation is about all of us...We...that's you and me; all of us, ARE the Give Back Generation. We are the generation in whose hands the future lies. Our decision to start 'giving back' will define the world our childen inherit in 30 years from now.For the past twenty years I have taught meditation to thousands of 
people from all ages and backgrounds. During this time I have watched 
how we have become increasingly overwhelmed in the wake of the 
increasing uncertainty of this technological age. I am passionately 
committed to empowering people towards a positive and courageous 
response to those challenges. We are alive at a unique moment in history
 and how we meet these challenges, will determine the future for 
generations to come. If you have a deep longing to seek and see changes in the way we are approaching the challenges in front of us, please take time to look at the material I have shared and get behind this campaign. The book "The Give Back Generation; A Survival Guide to Staying Conscious" takes a deep and honest look at the changing quality of our living experience and the challenges it faces in the wake of the technological age. It looks at the effect this is having upon the way we are functioning, and investigates some of the compelling indicators that suggest we need to embrace wholesale change if we are going to safeguard the integrity of our  living experience. in essence the book looks deeply at what it actually means to be a human being. This is not an environmental arguement. It is a penetrating look at the very nature of the human condition. But it is also a call to action. A call to arms to all you Brave Souls out there who have it in your heart  to stand tall now and find the courage to ask difficult questions and dig deep in the search for answer. I know it is normally the case that these pitches need to be made in a few minutes of video sound bite. But this is slightly different. I am asking you to stop for long enough to refelct upon some of the things that are going on around us; to beathe out and ask yourself, " How Do I feel? " Please watch the videos and listen to the sample tracks. Have a look at the summary for the book and see if it resonates with you. Because with your support now we can get this book and album in to peoples hands by the end of the summer. We are not far away. The book is written we need only to finish the edit and do the design and production.The Album. Brave Souls is intended to compliment the book and it is a collaborative project on which I have worked with a diverse and telented group of musicians from around the world. you can listen to sample tracks here. Brave Souls playlist I dearly want to share this material now. Because it is current and it is important, and I hope that by reaching out to all of you, we can make it happen. We are all passionately in love with life and in need of a road map back to the essence of our being. This is why I have subtitled the book. "A Survival Guide to Staying Conscious."Things are changing so fast. I do not feel we can stand aside for even the time it would take to bring this book to press through a publisher. But with your help I can get this book and album to those who it may help encourage and inspire by the end of the summer. So what is the story I want to tell?The Book:  'The Give Back Generation: A survival guide to staying conscious' In
this book I hope to take you on a journey deep into the very heart of
the mystery that is life, in the hope that by looking a little more
deeply at what is actually going on in the background of our lives, 
right now for us as a society and as humans on this planet, we might
re- establish a healthier and more enriching relationship to the life
that each of us is a part of.I
would like to encourage you to look at life with an open
mind and a courageous heart so that we might reach a place of deep
reverence and respect of life. I believe that only once we have re
discovered the sense of awe and wonder at life, and learn once again to see it as deeply sacred, will we develop a
more healthy attitude towards it that will form the backbone  and
bedrock of not just our own welfare, but that of the generations to
come. I wish to propose a
solution, which is for all of us to collectively become part of what
I call the Give Back Generation, a generation who seek to contribute
to the world every bit as enthusiastically as we have sought to take out what we can from it. In fifty years from now,
history will testify how we chose to meet our challenges, and those
who follow in our wake will live through the outcome of the choices
we now make.The Album. Brave Souls Click to listen to the  Brave Souls playlist ( Stay Tuned !
